description:
Painted Past: Tribute to the Heritage City of Ahmedabad, An exhibition Sandip Prajapati celebrating the architectural heritage of Ahmedabad, India.
Opening Hours
Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm
Sunday: 11am - 4pm
Ahmedabad, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage City in 2017, is renowned for its rich architectural heritage and cultural significance, showcasing a blend of Indo-Islamic architecture and vibrant local traditions.
Born in Patan, Gujarat, Sandip Prajapati has always been fascinated by the rich history and culture of the region.
An architect by profession, he uses his knowledge of design and structure to capture the essence of the pol houses. Pol houses are traditional residential buildings that are clustered around narrow streets and courtyards in the old city of Ahmedabad. They date back to the 18th century and reflect the influence of various communities and religions that coexisted in the city. Pol houses are known for their intricate wooden carvings, ornamental facades, and colorful decorations. They are also a living testimony of the social and harmony that prevailed in the city.
CONTACT
Website: sprajapati.com
Instagram: @sandipprajapati1

description:
Rob Beckett – Giraffe, Comedian, presenter and panel-show superstar announces new tour Giraffe for 2025.

Smashing the life out of the M25, M1, M5 and any other road that’s in my way. From Bromley to Brisbane, my new show Giraffe is going worldwide.

Expectations on me: put on 3 stone from takeaways and post-show drinking.

Expectations of you: leave the gig happier than when you arrived.

My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children/podcast content providers… but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.

What else is there to do? Sit next to your partner on the sofa, scrolling TikTok in silence again? You did that the last three nights. See you there!

Host of Sky’s Rob Beckett’s Smart TV and Rob & Romesh Vs. He’s also the unmistakable voice of Channel 4’s Celebs Go Dating and the smash-hit podcast Parenting Hell.

“Hilarious” – The Mirror

“Naturally funny” – The Times

“Hilariously observational comic… brings roars of laughter” – Arts Desk
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
New Zealand International Comedy Festival, Every May, the capital comes alive with laughter, thanks to the New Zealand International Comedy Festival (NZICF). New Zealand’s homegrown talent shares the stage with some of the world’s most exciting comedians. You could catch a big-name international artist, or discover a new local rising star. 
Since it began in 1993, the aim of the festival has been to champion the craft of comedy so everyone can share a laugh. Every year, a huge group of comedians descend on Wellington from local shores and beyond to deliver three weeks of merriment. 
The festival offers a diverse range of high-quality laughs. It showcases the best of local comedy and gives audiences a taste of some of the world’s best acts. Catch over 100 comics performing at The Opera House, BATS Theatre, Fringe Bar, San Fran, and more.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.
ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone), Rory Lowe: NZ Tour (Petone)
Award-winning Australian comedian Rory Lowe is bringing the chaos to New Zealand!
Fresh from sold-out tours across Australia and Asia—and with his first comedy special about to be filmed—Rory hits NZ for the very first time with an hour of wild stories, razor-sharp crowd work, and unfiltered laughs.

From getting arrested for terrorism, to snitching on a meth head, to getting married and failing miserably at quitting the party life, Rory’s real-life tales are as ridiculous as they are hilarious. Expect raw, real, and unpredictable comedy from one of the most exciting voices in stand-up today.

Critics and audiences can’t get enough:

★★★★★ – What’s On In Adelaide:
“Comedy at its finest! Lowe draws us in with his unique stories and larger-than-life personality… absolutely guarantees a f*ing funny hour of laughs!”


★★★★½ – Fourth Wall Media:
“Rory Lowe is absolutely killing it in the comedy scene… Fast-paced and non-stop, the jokes are funnier every year and the crowd interaction is spot on.”


★★★★ – The AU Review:
“Time flies when watching Rory, a non-stop comedian, with ready-made jokes and quick wit to keep the crowd on its toes.”

With over 2.2 million YouTube subscribers as part of YeahMad, 475K TikTok followers, and a reputation for high-energy, off-the-wall shows, Rory Lowe is ready to take New Zealand by storm.

One man, one mic, and an hour of absolute mayhem—get ready for Rory Lowe unleashed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Running Into The Sun, Running Into The Sun
After exploding onto the Australian scene, a2 Company bring their euphoric hour of award-winning physical theatre home to Pōneke

About this Event

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance, and theatre.
It’s graduation night. Ash and Mary discover they are pregnant. A flash flood hits their hometown. The war crimes overseas become more horrifying.
Running into the Sun is “messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.”
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington, Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington
https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance and theatre.

The story follows Ash (Ben Ashby), Morris (Ethan Morse) and Mary (Jasmine Susic), at their university graduation house party. As they deal with personal heartbreaks, surprises and betrayals they must also reckon with a climate disaster unfolding in their hometown and a global future filled with war and political unrest. Dance, Clown, Live Music, Film and Physical Theatre weave together to catch the feeling of hope in the face of oncoming doom.

Running into the sun was developed by a2 Company; The Dance & Theatre production house co-directed by Nadiyah Akbar (Footnote NZ Dance, Joel Bray Dance) and Ben Ashby (Artistic Director of Long Cloud Youth Theatre 2020-2023).

“messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.” - Melbourne Fringe Festival: Judges’ Picks.

“...suffocating and comforting …exhausting but exhilarating” - My Melbourne Arts

https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

description:
Songwriter Showcase 106, Every 3rd Sunday of the month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present.. The Vorn String Trio, Emily de Vegt, CP3o, and Banjo Ben and the Breeze


The Vorn String Trio..
Wellington songwriting legend Vorn needs no introduction! But since I have to write something in this box and you seem compelled to read it, let’s both reflect on the wonder of a 25-year career spent labouring in prolific obscurity, across 9 albums of songs which veer from sublime to ridiculous, often within a single verse. Fresh off releasing The Late Album (the only NZ indie album ever to beat terminal cancer), Vorn and the ludicrously talented Charley Davenport (cello) and Thomas Liggett (violin) will present a selection of the best songs ever written in this country. You should come listen!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/a-safe-pair-of-hands
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/all-along-the-shore
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MqYKO64nHuM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7CoOPc6AX8
https://www.facebook.com/Vornmusic/

Emily de Vegt..
Taranaki’s Emily de Vegt brings a cosy, whimsical charm to the girl-with-a-guitar flavour of singer-songwriter. Her songs draw from her background in classical piano and pay tribute to melancholic modern artists like Radiohead and Lana Del Rey.

https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/birds-hawera-2023
https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/somygardengrows-hawera-2023
https://facebook.com/emilydevegt/videos/718456777591120

CP3o..
Barry Carter's CP3o give you original songs with a Jazz-Acana feel.

https://www.youtube.com/@CarterParkerTrio-CP3o/videos
https://www.facebook.com/people/CP3o-Carter-Parker-Trio/100091844075290


Banjo Ben and the Breeze
Banjo Ben and The Breeze are a new 4-piece indie-folk comedy band based in Wellington,
NZ. They are known for their iconic beanies, their regular evening busking sessions on
Cuba Street, and their theatrically charged gigs which are packed full of catchy lyrics, wild
stories and plenty of laughs.

https://youtu.be/ejM7pZYBMYI?si=Rc_CSQEt2zQYvewW
https://www.instagram.com/banjo_ben_and_the_breeze
https://www.facebook.com/people/Banjo-Ben-and-The-Breeze/61578992621362/

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Draw It Out - Adults workshop 25 Nov, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.
Theme: Re-finding your spark
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop focuses on the theme of re-finding your spark, and connecting to what it is that is driving you. Great if going through change or curious about something new.
Date
This is a single workshop
6.30pm-8.00pm
Tuesday 25 November
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night, Roger Hall’s Easy Money -final night
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)

DATES
Wed 27 Aug 2025 - Sat 6 Sep 2025
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like, Split Bill: Friends to the End & Living is Like
THIS SHOW IS R16.

Friends to the End - Presented by Wiremu Tuhiwai & Brendon Bennetts

Join Wiremu and Brendon as their friendship is tested by an alien invasion, or a robot uprising, or a zombie outbreak, or whatever else the audience might suggest.

Inspired by movies like Shaun of the Dead, The World’s End, and Scott Pilgrim vs the World, prepare for a show that mixes sincerity and over the top action into a joyful improvisational maelstrom. After all, the real apocalypse is the friends we make along the way.

Living is Like - Directed by Andrea Ferpo

Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.

Living Is Like harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

R16 - As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:

This could be considered a curated scratch night. It could also be considered a low-budget SNL. One thing's for sure: It's happening and it's happening SOON.
Hosted by local devil Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin, and featuring some of Wellingtons up-and-comers, this show is a new ensemble premiering works to make people either laugh or at least exhale out their nose a little.

description:
Split Bill: Sohn Zone & D.E.I.'s, Sohn Zone - Rich & Rebecca Sohn

The Sohn Zone is a half hour of comedy, improvised in form and content, from Second City, Annoyance and iO Chicago veterans, Rich and Rebecca Sohn.
This show is organic. They trust each other, the audience, improv, and the moment to find their form. Nothing is decided beforehand.

Rich and Rebecca Sohn met as improvisers in Chicago over 30 years ago. As long-time teachers, this duo show began when former students asked them to headline a new evening of improv. Students often expressed surprise at how different their teaching styles were and took to saying “you’re in the Sohn zone” when seeing the couple work together.

D.E.I.'s - Mo Munn & Ralph Hilaga

When two besties land jobs at a prestigious company, they discover they’re not there for their skills — they’re the token hires. What follows is an improvised journey of chaos, corporate jargon, and an earnest attempt to prove they’re more than just the diversity checkbox.

From the chaotic minds of Wellington improv duo Mo and Ralph, D.E.I.’s is a sharp, satirical, improvised workplace comedy about tokenism, identity, and the conundrums of modern day allyship. If you’ve ever wondered what happens when the diversity quota starts talking back — this is it.

As the Sohn Zone is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. D.E.I.'s contains strong language and adult themes, and discussions of topics like racism, queerness, and tokenism. Some material may touch on lived experiences of marginalisation and may be confronting for some audience members.

Both shows may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf, Experience the world through the lens of award-winning photojournalists at The World Press Photo Exhibition at Tākina. This event showcases this year’s best visual journalism, featuring powerful and thought-provoking images from New Zealand and around the world.
Additionally, visitors can view "The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf: The Friends, Influences and Inspirations Exhibition," curated by Simon Woolf.
Photos on display will feature images by Ronald Woolf and Spencer Digby (Te Papa Tongarewa Collection), alongside works by Wellington’s own Simon Woolf, internationally renowned photographer Brian Brake, and legendary sports photographer Peter Bush. The exhibition will also display images by Barry Durrant, former chief photographer of The Dominion, as well as photographs by acclaimed recent talents, including Pulitzer Prize winner Melanie Burford, celebrated international photojournalist Simon Townsley, and esteemed photo historian Graham Stewart.
Don't miss your chance to see Kiwi photographers on show at Tākina.
Epson NZ sponsors the 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf.
Event Details:
• 5 September – 5 October: 10 am – 5 pm
• Tākina Exhibition Space
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Tickets available online or at the door.
Photo: © DAVID UNWIN / The Post.

description:
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, General admission tickets have now sold out! Tickets for the community and walkers are still available
Whakatau mai ki tētahi pō whakataetae whakaari i te rerehua, ā-kākahu hoki e whakanui ana i te hunga takatāpui, hunga whakawāhine hoki, me te rerehua o te toi Ballroom.
Experience a night of performances, beauty, and fashion as walkers compete for trophies in a display of queer and trans joy, liberation, and Ballroom artistry.
Full events programme: https://tepapa.nz/MaramaBall
The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present The Grand Kiki House Of Marama Ball.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.
With a fabulous line-up of categories, judges, commentators, and a DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap, dance, and cheer the night away.
CATEGORIES AND THEMES:
Virgin Vogue – A Marama Storm (Treasure Chest)
Bizarre – Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (Femme Queens, Trans Men, and Butch Queens) – Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance – Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) – Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem – A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (Female Figures, Male Figures, and Gender Non-Conforming) – Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA (Open to All) Best Dressed – Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator – Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance – A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway – The Phases of Marama
House of the Night
JUDGES:
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the House of Miyake-Mugler)
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman
Trailblazing Founding Mother Ella Alexander
Legendary Founding Father Tamatoa Aitu
Founding Fatheir Fang Coven-Aucoin
COMMENTATORS:
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Orijah Marama
DJ:
ATARANGI
BALLROOM COMMUNITY WALKERS & SPECTATORS TICKET ACCESS:
Contact the House of Marama on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code that provides FREE access for Femme Queens who are not walking or competing. Contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball is hosted by the Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama and proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.
This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Dictionary of Moments, The Dictionary of Moments
Directed By Jason Geary

This isn’t your ordinary dictionary.

Here, you won’t find dry definitions — instead, every word unlocks a moment from a story that brings its meaning to life.

Drawing from his acclaimed short story podcast of the same name, Jason Geary reinvents storytelling onstage with this bold hybrid of live-written tales and spontaneous scenes. Each performance is a one-of-a-kind experience where language leaps off the page and into vivid, unscripted life.

Part literary experiment, part theatrical adventure — words have never been this alive.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Tuesday 28th October – Saturday 1st November (5 shows only)
$25 – $49
Circa One
Age Recommendation PG
Audience Care: Occasional strong language & themes
Runtime: 95mins plus interval

Performances:
Tuesday 28 October 6.30pm
Wednesday 29 October 6.30pm
Thursday 30 October 6.30pm
Friday 31 October 8.00pm
Saturday 1 November 8.00pm

Director: Jonathan Hendry

-Jamie McCaskill
-Cohen Holloway
-Jerome Leota
-Cameron Clayton

description:
Cheesy Lovers by Le Marché Français, Calling all cheese lovers!
Looking for a fun and original night out for two? Whether it’s a romantic date, a chill evening with a friend, or a cozy family moment, our Cheesy Lovers workshop is the perfect plan
What’s on the menu:
Roll up your sleeves and make two fresh cheeses from scratch, step by step, with our expert cheesemongers
Discover the magic of artisan cheesemaking — milk, love, and a little bit of alchemy

Then, get creative and build your very own cheese platter for two — beautiful and delicious
A full spread of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be waiting for you, along with expert tips on pairing and presentation. And of course… tasting is highly encouraged
It’s an intimate, tasty, hands-on experience for anyone who loves good food, good vibes, and of course... cheese

description:
The Satire We Deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies | Writers on Mondays, Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia.
Brannavan Gnanalingam's The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media.
Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders' association in Star Gazers.
Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks, and why it's a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

Trick or Treat?!
Don’t be scared, it's just The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show!

This Halloween, jump on your broomsticks or ride your headless horses down to The Fringe Bar, for a night you won't be able to forget…

Our ghastly ghouls, maleficent monsters and spooky scary skeletons will have you SCREAMING, death dropping, and chilled to the bone.

Prepare for a night(mare) full of the sexiest scares and tricks at every turn.

Costumes are highly encouraged and will be rewarded…

Gather your coven and take a stab at tickets from just $20 on Eventfinda.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Writers on Mondays: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies, The satire we deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies
Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia. Brannavan Gnanalingam’s The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media. Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders’ association in Stargazers. Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks and why it’s a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.

ADMISSION IS FREE—ALL WELCOME
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs, Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs
Make a vase or cup and saucer
When: 21st of September at 10.30am
Where: Big Mac Slab, Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu
How long: 2 hours
What it bring: just yourself

This vase or cup and saucer making workshop is a fun way to be introduced to slab building with clay. Fiona your tutor will show how to roll out a slab, add decoration by imprinting patterns into the surface. All materials are provided and each participant chooses a glaze colour for their items to be glazed. Fiona takes the items back to Whanganui to dry and then she fires and glazes them the colours chosen. Each participant will be given approximately 1kg of tan coloured clay and equipment needed to make the vase or cup and saucer.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Carterton AFC Centenary Dinner, Come and celebrate the end of year break up and Centenary Dinner of Carterton AFC. That's right, Carterton AFC is 100 years old, and it is time to party like it is 1925. Ticket price includes, entry, meal (Smorgasboard) automatic entry into raffles and dancing the night away with DJ Dan playing all the tunes you love.

So come on current players, players partners, ex players, old timers and all the others that have helped make Carterton AFC the greatest little club in the universe, get your glad rags on and come celebrate with us.

If you purchase multiple tickets we cannot guarantee you will all be seated together. Seating will generally be ona first come basis. If you purchase 10 tickets, or 6 tickets, where possible, we will reserve a table for your group.

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Tawa, Wellington - Disco Ball (circular canvas), The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a masterpiece on a 30cm round canvas!
Join us at this unique event, where our expert artist will lead you step-by-step to create this stunning painting on a 30cm round canvas.
Create, laugh and socialise with friends while exploring your inner artist. No previous painting experience necessary - get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!
No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

description:
Nutcracker High Tea, QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.
label: Food & Drink

description:
DRAG BINGO with Homer Neurotic @ Dirty Little Secret, This is not your grandma’s bingo night. Wellington’s resident sad boy and pint-sized powerhouse, Homer Neurotic, is taking over the rooftop at Dirty Little Secret for a night of unhinged chaos, cocktails, and camp realness.
Get ready for an evening dripping in glamour, glitter, and glorious nonsense as you soak up the skyline views from one of the capital’s most iconic rooftop hideaways.
What to expect:
• Free entry, all you need is a table booking and good vibes
• Over $200 worth of prizes, including a $100 bar voucher for the grand winner
• Spot prizes, cheeky antics, and bad decisions encouraged
• Live drag performances that’ll leave you confused, flustered, and deeply entertained
• Dad jokes, dance-offs, and plenty of double entendres
• Drink and kai specials to keep you going
• After the Bingo stick around to boogie down with one of the resident DJ’s, spinning your tracks all night long
Bookings essential:
Tables available from 7.00 pm with balls dropping no later than 7.30. Walk-ins are very limited so grab your spot now:
https://dirtylittlesecret.co.nz/events/drag-bingo/
Safe and inclusive:
Dirty Little Secret is proudly LGBTQIA+ friendly. Our staff and security are trained to make everyone feel welcome and safe. Elevator access is available, but some tables are on raised flooring, so please reach out if you have accessibility needs and we’ll make sure you’re well looked after.
Heads up:
This is an R18 event. Expect colourful language, cheeky antics, and wholesome masculinity served with a side of mischief. Consider yourself warned.
Follow me for more nonsense:
Find me on Instagram at @homerneurotic for a peek behind the scenes and more of the drama, glitter and tears.

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!

description:
After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay, What does the future hold for local businesses in Aotearoa - and how can you take advantage of the opportunities on your doorstep? Join us for a special After 5 at Bunnings Lyall Bay, where we’ll look at new ways to grow, train, and connect as a business community.

You’ll hear about the exciting potential of the 2026 New Zealand Trade Expo, designed to open doors for business investment and international partnerships. You’ll also learn how the MBIE Management Capability Development Voucher Programme can provide funding and support to build your business skills and capability.

From a local perspective, we’ll showcase how Bunnings partners with businesses, schools, and community organisations - and how Chamber members can unlock exclusive savings and benefits with the Bunnings Power Pass.

Popular suppliers including Ryobi, AEG, and Ozito will also be in-store to answer questions and share product advice, making this session a rare and practical opportunity to get info that gets you ahead.

Most importantly, this After 5 is a chance to network with fellow Chamber members in a fresh setting, and take away practical opportunities to strengthen and grow your business.
label: Business & Networking

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Behind the Scenes with VicASA: BDO Wellington, 🔥 Behind the Scenes with VicASA x BDO 🔥
Exams are coming - so why host events now?
Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.
Exams test your memory, but these events sharpen your career. While exams last weeks, the connections you’ll make at BDO last a lifetime.
Here’s the truth: top firms don’t just recruit; they provide support, advice, and insider tips to help you thrive as a student and future professional. These events aren’t distractions - they’re an investment in your success.
Therefore the VicASA exec made sure these events (just like the rest) are taking you beyond the lecture halls and giving you exclusive access inside the most influential firms in the accounting world. And yes, it’s all completely free.
Wednesday 24 September – BDO Open Office & LinkedIn Headshots from 2:30pm to 3:30pm! Arrive at 2:15pm to get the full experience!
Join us for an hour long experience to talk one-on-one with the most professional bodies from both the capital and international offices. And of course, 🍴 free food — because good conversations happen best over kai.
✨ What makes this event different from any other?
Most student events stop at surface-level networking. This goes further:
At BDO, you’ll step into an open-office tour led by BDO reps, chat one-on-one with professional buddies, and even get a professional LinkedIn headshot for free by selecting the "BDO - LinkedIn Headshot" option alongside your ticket (first in, first served!) to boost your personal brand.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
First-in, first-served — spaces are extremely limited
Genuine behind-the-scenes exposure you won’t find at standard info sessions
Practical takeaways: real answers, real connections, and a polished LinkedIn profile
💡 These are not your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic inside look at the top firms, preparing you for your next steps in a way that’s practical, personal, and powerful.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Best Practice Guidelines Workshop - Porirua, This interactive session will help you effectively manage volunteers at your organisation. The Volunteer Best Practice Guidelines provide a framework to consider and review your own practice, and learn from others.
The session includes insights into managing challenging behaviour and problem solving, and is aimed at novices right through to experts in volunteer management.
We will explore the practice areas:
Recruiting and engaging volunteers
Welcoming and onboarding volunteers
Volunteer support, leadership, and management
Train and grow volunteers
Feedback and recognition
Celebrate volunteer impact
Exiting Volunteers
We will be learning from everyone in the room, including you!
The workshop will be based on the Volunteering New Zealand's 'Best Practice Guidelines.' You can access these on our website here.
We will provide you morning tea and a light lunch. You'll be asked your dietary requirements when you register.
Registration is from 9:15am. Entry to venue from Pātaka Art + Museum.
What previous attendees have said:
"I just wanted to say thank you for the opportunity to attend that workshop. It was lovely talking to other people in the charity sector which I haven’t had the chance to do yet. Great discussions and ideas."
"I am very much enjoying your workshops, and have implemented some of the learnings already."

About your facilitator:
Alison Marshall is about helping others build capability through learning and development.
Ali has over 25 years’ experience in learning and development at a senior level. She has worked in a broad range of industries that includes oil and gas, professional services, retail, education and hospitality. She has worked for large global organisations, start-ups and government. Her talent is being able to build relationships across all levels of the organisation.
Alison Marshall
label: Business & Networking

Become a Cashflow King, In a shifting economy, one thing remains constant: cash is king.Whether you’re a sole trader or small business owner, if your cashflow isn’t under control, everything else suffers.
Join GoAccounting for this practical, insight-packed webinar designed specifically for NZ business owners navigating uncertain waters.
You'll walk away with:
A plan to handle reduced customer spending and economic pressure
Tactics to drive revenue and increase cash reserves
Tools to track, measure, and strengthen your business health
A roadmap to achieving long-term cashflow freedom
🎁 BONUS: Every attendee receives our Cashflow Freedom Guide + Cashflow Health Check Toolkit
Spaces are limited. Secure your seat now and take control of your cashflow future.

description:
Build your Professional Board of Directors, You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Crime and Punishment, Meeting place is the Bolton Street Cemetery Museum.

Hear stories about the jailers, judges and policemen who were dealing with the city's criminals, as well as some of the villains and murderers that shocked earlier generations in Wellington.


Find out about the duelling pistol that was involved in the deaths of a lawyer and a magistrate; and about an unsolved murder on a quiet farm road. There’s several lawyers, but even a criminal or two.

Children 12 & under: free (no ticket required).

Well-behaved dogs on leads welcome.
label: Community & Culture

description:
StudyTime NCEA Revision Workshops, The upcoming October school holidays are a golden opportunity. While rest is important, these two weeks can also be used wisely to build momentum, fill knowledge gaps, and reduce stress heading into exam leave.
That’s where our holiday workshops come in. After a hiatus, Inspiration Education, in collaboration with StudyTime, is running NCEA Level 2 and 3 revision workshops from 1-3 October at Wellington Girls’ College.
Each session is two hours long and covers an entire external/topic, giving students the chance to:
Go over all the key content they’ll need for the exam
Learn exactly what the exam will be testing
Pick up strategies for tackling the harder Merit and Excellence questions
Receive a workbook to use in the session and keep for revision afterwards
Ask questions and get support from experienced tutors who’ve been through it all before
Why Attend?
These workshops are designed to:
Fill any gaps in knowledge
Build exam confidence
Kickstart motivation heading into Term 4
Spaces are limited and workshops often sell out quickly. Register now to secure your spot and head into exams feeling prepared, confident, and ready to succeed.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Business Strategy & Growth Planning Interactive Seminar, Are you ready to take your business to the next level?
Join us for an interactive seminar designed to help business owners like you create clear, actionable strategies for growth without the guesswork.

Your Speakers:
Ron Lal – With over 25 years of experience across entrepreneurship, consulting, NGO, governmental, and corporate sectors, Ron has helped business leaders solve complex challenges, discover new customer segments, and achieve 7-figure results through innovative Design Thinking strategies.
Learn more about Ron: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ron-lal-20168041/
Maria Pooley – A business operations and management expert with over 20 years of international experience across eight countries, Maria specialises in identifying business obstacles and delivering practical solutions that drive sustainable success.
Learn more about Maria: https://www.linkedin.com/in/pooleymaria/

In this 3-hour session, you will:
Learn actionable strategies that have worked for other business owners
Discover fresh perspectives to tackle your biggest growth challenges
Connect with like-minded business owners in a supportive environment
Leave with new insights and ideas to implement into your business

What’s included:
Hot beverages and snacks
Free parking
Networking opportunities with fellow business owners

Activities:
Networking & Icebreaker – A chance to connect with like-minded business owners.
Business Session – Ron and Maria share insights and strategies for sustainable growth.
Strategy Insights Session – Gain strategic ideas tailored to your business, learn the difference between strategy and planning, and understand how to identify the right strategy for your goals.
Closing & Networking – Share ideas, ask questions, and connect with potential collaborators.

Late bird: $35*
Normal price: $50

NEVER2LATEWLG (Wellington ticket purchases)

description:
Careers on the Move, Careers on the Move
What’s next for the world of work in Aotearoa New Zealand?
Careers no longer follow a straight line - they’re portfolios, pivots, and possibilities. From flexible work to non-traditional paths, success today looks very different from the past, and so do the expectations of employers and employees alike.

Why be part of this session?
We’ll explore the major shifts shaping the job market in Aotearoa New Zealand and share practical insights on the hiring journey: where hidden talent is, what inefficiencies are costing you, and smarter, more human ways to connect with future employees.
Whether you’re building your own career or building the teams of tomorrow, this is a conversation you won’t want to miss.

This event is part of a new 3-part series: Future Fluent - Navigate What’s Next.
A practical, thought-provoking speaker series for professionals who want to stay ahead - not just keep up.

Who are the speakers?
Nicole Williams – Head of Jobs, Trade Me
Ben Stevenson – Managing Principal Consultant, JacksonStone & Partners
Final speaker to be announced

What’s in-store:
4:00pm – Arrival/networking
4:30-5:15pm – Speaker session
5:15-5:30pm – Q&A
5:30-6:00pm – Networking with drinks & nibbles

This series is brought to you by event partner JacksonStone & Partners - one of the most experienced executive search, recruitment and contracting agencies in New Zealand.

Attend other events in the series:
4 November: Resilient Leadership - Real talk on leading well without losing your spark
25 November: Culture Shake-Up - Leading across generations with clarity and connection

description:
Free BBQ and chat with Council & Kāpiti Mountain Bike Club, Council staff and Kapiti MTB club have been around Waikanae Park hill, checking out some of the do-it-yourself bike tracks that have been popping up. We’ve been walking the hills (and jumping into a few of the holes!) to get a real sense of the terrain, the steep drops, and the jump locations, and yes, photos never quite do the scale justice!
While some of the current tracks and features are unsafe and need to be removed, we get it, this isn’t about shutting down fun. It’s about ensuring the space can work better for everyone, now and in the future, through best practices.
That’s why this Sunday, we’re inviting local young riders and their whānau to come down for a Free BBQ and kōrero.
Meet the crew, share your thoughts, and be part of the conversation about what mountain biking in the park could look like moving forward, using the NZ MTB guidelines to inform good track-building practices.
Where: Waikanae Park, end of the rugby fields
When: Sunday, 5 October at 12pm

description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams, This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.

Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration
By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.

Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.

Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Scott Simpson, Join us on Tuesday 7th October for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Scott Simpson, Minister for ACC and Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs.
The newest Minister in the coalition Government, but not a first time Minister – Minister Simpson brings 13+ years of experience in politics to his new roles.
As the Minister of Commerce and Consumer Affairs, Minister Simpson sits at the heart of some of the most significant economic questions facing the business community and the country - regulation, financial markets and of course, competition, are all areas in the spotlight for which he is responsible for.
From Minister of Statistics to Chief Government Whip, to his current portfolios - Minister Simpson is more than well equipped to bring the insights of the Beehive to Business.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

8:10am- Q&A

Can't make it? Click here to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
Dungeons and Demons: We're All Going To Super Hell, Dungeons and Demons: We're All Going To Super Hell
Hell is empty and all the devils are playing DnD

It’s time to face your demons. Wellington-based Dungeons and Dragons podcast Last In Initiative is back, and this time, things are getting spooky.

Come hell or high water, the team is locked in and ready to bring you two all new hellarious, hellish, and almost certainly heretic filled adventures. Join our four budding demonologists as they stumble their way into a summoning ritual, argue with a devil and, if they aren't careful, face the heat of hellfire.

Each night brings an all new adventure and new challenges, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp to hell and back (handbasket not included).

This show follows the success of Dungeons and Delinquents, Dungeons and Da Vinci, and Dungeons and Decades, shows that had TTRPG nerds and novices alike laughing along.

description:
Dealing With Difficult People & Situations, Transform conflict and difficult situations with co-workers and customers into opportunities by equipping your staff with the skills and techniques required to manage these situations with confidence, professionalism, and pride. Learn ways to resolve conflict with customers and co workers, influence successful outcomes and develop a peaceful workplace. We have all experienced the stress that comes from having unresolved conflicts with our customers and co-workers. Conflicts that are ignored or resolved poorly don’t go away, they cause people to feel resentful and to avoid each other. The effects on the business are a loss of productivity, turnover, and absenteeism. Wherever two or more people come together, there is bound to be conflict. This workshop will give participants a six-step process that they can use and modify to resolve conflicts of any size.

Participants will also learn crucial conflict resolution skills, including dealing with anger and using the Agreement Frame. Key Learning Outcomes: - Transform conflict into opportunity - Develop constructive strategies for dealing with difficult behaviour - Develop communication skills to diffuse the situation - Increase confidence and assertiveness in dealing with difficult behaviour - Manage your emotions and deal with stress - Understand the power of words and how to use them to your advantage Workshop Overview: - What are the behaviours that we find difficult to deal with? - Develop an understanding of how flight or fight reactions prompt difficult behaviour - Controlling your reactions and choosing how you respond - Strategies for staying calm and keeping your cool when dealing with difficult behaviour - How attitudes play a part – What’s it like being on the receiving end of me? How do I come across? - Dealing with the situation/problem, not the individual - Dealing with anger, your own and others – Be able to use basic anger management techniques - Developing communication skills, such as the agreement frame, active listening and open questions - Applying techniques to deal with difficult behaviour - Understand what conflict and conflict resolution mean - Understand all six phases of the conflict resolution process -Understand the 5 main styles of conflict resolution and be able to adapt the process for all types of conflicts - Speak up assertively and confidently when dealing with difficult behaviour To book: email info@biztraines.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking
