description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Empowering Aotearoa New Zealand’s Digital Future, You’re invited to the launch of NZTech’s latest landmark report: Empowering Aotearoa New Zealand’s Digital Future – Our National Data Centre Infrastructure.
Data centres are the backbone of our digital lives, powering everything from essential government services and healthcare to banking, e-commerce, and artificial intelligence (AI).  As data centre demand rises, so does the need for a resilient and sustainable energy supply. This sector is playing a pivotal role in New Zealand’s transition to a low-carbon future and helping to future-proof the electricity grid.
Discover what’s really happening with New Zealand’s booming data centre sector and what it means for our economy, communities and our digital future. Meet the data centre operators and electricity providers driving this transformation, and hear directly from Hon Simon Watts, Minister for Energy and Climate Change, and Graeme Muller, CEO, NZTech.
 Join us and find out:
how data centres power our everyday lives and the scale of New Zealand’s data centre sector
how the sector is fuelling economic growth and generating thousands of jobs
why New Zealand’s data centres are global leaders in energy efficiency and driving investment in new wind, solar and geothermal projects
how New Zealand is uniquely positioned to become a regional hub for sustainable digital exports.
the importance of collaboration between government and industry to ensure renewable energy supply can keep pace with digital growth. 
Learn more about how the digital economy and energy sector are working together to unlock new value for all New Zealanders, ensuring our country thrives in a rapidly evolving digital world.
label: Business & Networking

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Entrepreneurship in the Age of AI with John Chow, Join John Chow — entrepreneur, investor, and co-founder of Stonewood Group — for an evening of real-world insights into entrepreneurship, innovation, and the future of business in the AI era.

Whether you’re a founder, freelancer, investor, or simply AI-curious, this is your chance to hear directly from one of New Zealand’s boldest business leaders and walk away inspired.

What to Expect:
Keynote: “Lessons from the Past, Eyes on the Future: A Founder’s Take on AI”
John shares his entrepreneurial journey and how he’s thinking about AI as a tool for the next wave of business growth.

Fireside Chat: “The Future of Business with AI”
A live podcast-style conversation between John Chow and Bin Wang (Head of AI, Stonewood Group), unpacking how real companies can embrace AI without the hype.

Networking + Giveaways
Mix and mingle with fellow professionals, founders, and AI enthusiasts. Enjoy drinks and enter the draw to win prizes!

Presented by:
Urban Hub Wellington
Workspaces built for entrepreneurs, growing teams, and professionals who want to do more with their day.

description:
Family Trusts in 2025: what business owners must know, Are Family Trusts still working the way you need them to?
Join us for a complimentary seminar designed for business owners and sole traders who want clarity around the real role of trusts in today’s environment.
We’ll cover:
Recent tax and legal changes impacting trusts
Rising compliance costs (lawyers, accountants, admin)
Common hassles in day-to-day trust operations
Where the tax benefits really lie—and where they don’t
Succession and wealth planning essentials
Asset protection pros and cons
Smarter alternatives for managing business and family wealth
While this seminar focuses on existing trusts, it’s also valuable for those considering establishing one in the future.
Event Details:
📅 Date: Thursday, 7 October
⏰ Time: 9:30am
📍 Location: GoAccounting HQ
🎤 Presenter: Nathan Silcock
Seats are limited - secure your spot today and take the guesswork out of Family Trusts.

description:
Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening, The Wellington Rowing Club Annual General Meeting (AGM) and opening of the season will be held on Sunday 24 August 2024, 12 noon, at the WRC Function Centre.
We look forward to seeing you all at the Club at 9:30 for Lotto 8’s (weather permitting).
Following the meetings, a light lunch will be provided. This is also WRC’s opportunity to unveil the Function Space renovations to the membership.

Information about the AGM
The WRC AGM will commence at 12noon, in the WRC Function Centre. There will be provisions for online attendance.
At this year’s AGM, we have several board and committee positions that we will be seeking to fill. Many hands make light work, and we all depend on volunteers to keep the club growing and thriving. A variety of experience levels, skill sets, and perspectives are needed for a well-functioning club.
The positions to be filled this year are:
-Club Captain (2-year term, Officer role)
-Vice President (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Treasurer (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Secretary (2-year term, Officer role)
-3 Committee roles (1-year term, non-Officer role)
-3 Board members (2-year term, Officer role)
Officers of the must consent in writing to being an officer and certify that they are eligible and not disqualified from holding office as described under section 36B of the Charities Act 2005.
The Club by-laws outline the current role descriptions, can be found here, note that the roles can be tailored to suit individuals’ skill sets and experience. Mentoring and support can be provided to develop individuals in these positions.
If you are interested, but have further questions- please reach out to the people holding the current role or any of the board or committee members to discuss.

description:
Foundations of Leadership - Extended, The purpose of this course is to provide you with a solid foundation in leadership principles and practical skills to apply in real-world situations. 
By understanding these fundamental aspects, you will be better prepared to take on leadership roles and inspire your people. 
The course spans two days, covering eight modules that focus on the most important knowledge a new leader requires. These modules deliver hands-on skills rooted in leadership theory. 

Key audience
This course is suitable for people who are new to leadership and would like the theory and practice that provides a foundation for a successful leadership career. It is also beneficial for those who have been in a new role for a while that requires some leadership expertise. 

Learning outcomes
Understand the basic concepts of leadership
Develop effective communication skills as a leader
Learn how to confidently empower your people and build effective teams
Demonstrate good decision-making and problem-solving skills
Identify effective ways to manage conflict as a leader
Understand the importance of self-awareness and continuous development

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: Two day, in person course.
Time: 9am–4pm, both days

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Export Ready: Strategies and Lessons for International Growth, Whether you're exploring new markets, refining your export strategy, or preparing to scale globally, this practical workshop will equip you with the tools, insights, and confidence to take your business international
What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz
Agenda
Tuesday, 7 October 2025 | 9:00 – 11:30 am | Focal Point Cinema, 223 Cuba Street, Palmerston North
Registration & Morning Tea
Workshop Session
Q&A and Networking
Cost
ExportNZ / Business Central/ Manawatū Chamber Member: $59 +gst
Non-Member: $89 +gst
Spaces are limited – secure your spot today and start your export journey with confidence.
Register Now!
Coming soon to Hawke’s Bay, Nelson, and Wellington! If you're based in one of these regions, keep an eye out, this workshop will be rolled out in your area in the coming months.

description:
From Bookings to Bottom Line: Accommodation Roadshow 2025 - Blenheim, Practical strategies from industry leaders to improve every step of your guest journey Hospitality New Zealand invites you to our Regional Accommodation Roadshow, designed especially for hotel, motel, and boutique accommodation providers across the Upper South Island. This focused event brings together some of the industry’s most innovative and trusted suppliers—sharing practical tools, expert insights, and real-world strategies to help you improve your guest experience, streamline your operations, and grow your bottom line.
Why Attend?
Hear from the Experts – Presentations from leading providers in pricing, operations, marketing, payments, tech, and insurance.
Get Practical Advice – Walk away with actionable strategies that you can put into practice straight away.
Regional Focus – Tailored insights designed to meet the challenges and opportunities of operators in our regions.
No Sales Pitches – This is an education-first forum, giving you clarity and confidence without the pressure.
Connect & Collaborate – Network with peers, ask questions, and explore trusted solutions—all in one place.
What to Expect 20-minute educational presentations from each partner Open Q&A sessions for your burning questions Networking & light refreshments to wrap up
Featured Partners Mews – Cloud-based PMS to modernise your operations
RoomPriceGenie – Automated pricing to maximise occupancy & revenue
Booking.com – Tools & insights to increase online bookings
Other Key Partners – Additional solution providers offering insights and support for your business

description:
Health and Safety Essentials for Small Business, The purpose of this course is to give you the oversight you need to ensure your business health and safety systems and processes reflect a best-practice approach. Each session comes with practical templates for you to use in your business to comply with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015. It also supports your understanding of the core elements of a health and safety system.

Key Audience:
This course is suitable for people who own a small business and want to ensure they comply with health and safety best practice requirements. It is also good for those businesses without a health and safety committee and anyone who is required to be involved in health and safety in a small business.

Learning outcomes
Understand the core elements of a health and safety system.
Understand the key duty holders and their respective duties under the Act.
Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.
Understand practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your health and safety system.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Places are limited, so register today.

Course details
Duration: One day, in person.
Time: 9am - 4pm

Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.

To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Johnsonville Business Networking, Johnsonville Business Networking
Do you want to network with genuine businesspeople in a supportive, fun environment?

Meet with others in a positive, high-energy, and invigorating business meeting. Set goals, celebrate successes, create awesome opportunities and hear from some really great speakers.
Every Wednesday from 8:00 am to 9:00 am, we’re meeting in the Rimu Room at the Collective Community Hub - 1/33 Johnsonville Rd.

BYO coffee (Zampelles is a great option) pop in to the Collective and see what The Networkers is all about! Create awesome local opportunities as you meet other positive businesspeople and hear from some great speakers.

We offer a 2-week free visitor policy, allowing you to explore the meeting and decide if it's right for you before making a decision.

If this sounds like you, let us know as we’d love to meet you.

Register your interest on - https://www.thenetworkers.co.nz/visit-group or email

description:
Rainbow Elders: Our Aspirations, Our Well-Being, Our Rights - a panel discussion, Rainbow Elders: Our Aspirations, Our Well-Being, Our Rights - a panel discussion
Te Kāhui Tika Tangata Human Rights Commission is proud to host this discussion for International Day of Older Persons in partnership with Kawe Mahara Queer Archives Aotearoa (formerly LAGANZ).

Panelists from the Wellington rainbow community - 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗶 𝗠𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗹, 𝗞𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗮𝘂𝗻𝘂𝗶 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗟𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝘄𝗮𝗻 - will join Chief Commissioner Dr Stephen Rainbow for the discussion and a brief Q and A session. 🌈🎙️💫

Prudence Walker, Disability Rights Commissioner and Rainbow rights spokesperson will host the panel.

𝗣𝗿𝗲-𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗲𝗲 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗱𝘂𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗹𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴. Pre-register here: https://events.humanitix.com/rainbow-elders-our-aspirations-our-well-being-our-rights-a-panel-discussion 🎟️🎟️🎟️

The discussion runs from 10.30am to 11.30am.

NZSL will be available. The venue is accessible.

Light refreshments will be available.

A recording of the discussion may be made available afterwards via the Commission's website.
❤️🧡💛💚💙💜🩷

description:
Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference, Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.

description:
Young Enterprise Scheme National Awards 2025, Celebrate the amazing achievements of young entrepreneurs from across New Zealand. Hear from the next generation of business stars, and find out which teams will take home a share of over $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships.
The Lion Foundation Young Enterprise Scheme National Awards evening is a showcase and celebration of the entrepreneurial successes of our students, bringing together the top YES companies from across New Zealand.
Join us at the awards dinner as we hear from the next generation of business leaders, changemakers and disruptors, where we’ll find out who will take home a share of more than $20,000 in prize money and tertiary scholarships and who will be named YES Company of the Year.
Pre-dinner drinks and product display from 5:45pm with the evening events commencing at 6:30pm.
The evening will include a 3-course menu and complimentary mocktail on arrival. A cash bar will be available throughout the night.
Dress code: Business/cocktail
If you would like to cover the cost of one of our fabulous YES students attending this year awards, we have included a Gift-a-Ticket option in our ticket section. 

Tickets can be purchased by credit card or by invoice at checkout

Any other queries can be directed to support@youngenterprise.org.nz

description:
'Capital Trees' walking tour with author Susette Goldsmith, Susette Goldsmith, author of 'Capital Trees' is your guide to significant and meaningful trees that have shaped our capital and its arboreal legacy.

As part of the wider Wellington Heritage Festival, this 2-hour author-led walking tour of the CBD guides you through highlights from the new Te Papa Press book, 'Capital Trees'. The book and tour trace the living legacies of the city’s rich tree heritage, including arguments around heritage tree listing, the native versus exotics debate, biodiversity, trees as monuments and more.
Starting at the Supreme Court, the tour takes in Parliament grounds, The Terrace and Plimmer Steps before ending up at Unity Books.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.

The Kapiti Coast Pipes and Drums is proud to present our 2025 concert, REVIVAL on Sunday 23 November at 2pm. We will be joined by our special guests from the Strathspey Highland Dance School. Come along for a great afternoon of pipes, drums and dance. Email to reserve a ticket.

description:
Intro to Product & UX Design, Good design is more than making things “look nice” — it’s about solving problems and creating experiences people love.
Join us for an hands-on workshop where you’ll learn the basics of Product & UX Design, get experience with practical tools, and see how design thinking can transform everyday services and products.
👥 Who’s it for?
Startups, small business owners, and professionals curious about UX.
Students keen to break into the design world (free tickets available).
Anyone who’s struggled with bad digital or service experiences and wants to know how to fix them.
📚 What you’ll get:
A crash course in UX & product design.
Fun group activities to redesign common real-world experiences.
A peek behind the scenes at how design improves outcomes.
Networking with other professionals and students.
🎯 Why come?
You’ll leave with fresh skills, practical frameworks, and maybe even an idea for your next project. Businesses will walk away with insights into their customer challenges, and students will get a taste of real-world UX.
✨ Limited spots — grab your ticket today!

description:
Leadership and Management Part 3, Leaders today are expected to be the driving force of their teams. They are constantly under pressure to lead effectively in a business environment that is characterised by constant change. Our leadership and management courses offer participants the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to embrace this challenge and lead their teams through these times with confidence and pride.

Our Leadership & Management - Part 3 workshop is a practical skills training course designed for people already in a leadership/management position, or those about to take up a new role, who want to explore the latest thinking and models for effective management and leadership and build on the techniques acquired in our Part 1 and 2 workshops.

In today’s world, emotional Intelligence is a critical and powerful component of effective leadership. This 2-day course will equip leaders with the skills to become more ‘people smart’ by developing ways to lead with emotional intelligence. Participants will also learn how to inspire their people with a shared vision and align teams to company goals, along with the tools to lead and manage change, ways to become a more influential and persuasive leader and the tools to raise awareness and manage unconscious bias in the workplace.

To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790

description:
Health and Safety Essentials for Small Business, The purpose of this course is to give you the oversight you need to ensure your business health and safety systems and processes reflect a best-practice approach. Each session comes with practical templates for you to use in your business to comply with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015. It also supports your understanding of the core elements of a health and safety system.

Key Audience:
This course is suitable for people who own a small business and want to ensure they comply with health and safety best practice requirements. It is also good for those businesses without a health and safety committee and anyone who is required to be involved in health and safety in a small business.

Learning outcomes
Understand the core elements of a health and safety system.
Understand the key duty holders and their respective duties under the Act.
Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.
Understand practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your health and safety system.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Places are limited, so register today.

Course details
Duration: One day, in person.
Time: 9am - 4pm

Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.

To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

description:
Learn how to build a Unicorn with Mahesh Muralidhar!, Join us as Mahesh Muralidhar shares his insights on 'How to build a Unicorn'. Hear stories from his Canva days and the journey he has had with the Phase One founders - Kiki, NextWork, Ivo, and Kiwifibre.
Mahesh has been a founder, was part of the early leadership team at Canva and has held senior roles in a variety of major startups. He came back home a few years ago and nurtured the Phase One founder community, with 80% of the portfolio backed by institutional venture capital.
Friday 12 September
1:00pm - 3:00pm

This is an incredible opportunity to gain valuable insights and understand the journey of successful founders. Don't miss out on this chance to elevate your entrepreneurial journey! 
Places are limited so register today to secure your spot.

description:
Kāpiti Tech Cluster September Meetup, Join us for the September Kāpiti Tech Cluster meetup!
We're thrilled to have two incredible guests for our September 2025 meetup.

Sunit Prakash (MNZM) is a well-known face in Wellington with extensive knowledge of the Indian market and is the founder and Director of the NZ Centre for Digital Connections with India. Sunit will provide an overview on some of the many facets of the India opportunity.

Anna Guenther is renowned for her contribution to the New Zealand Startup scene and is co-founder of PledgeMe. Anna returns to Kāpiti to share her expertise on effective pitching and talks of her lived experience as one of New Zealand's successful founders. Learn how you can navigate PledgeMe to grow your business or kickstart it!
Snacks and light refreshments will be available. Alcohol can be purchased at the venue.
About KāpitiTech:
KāpitiTech is here to connect the local Kāpiti tech network. With the support of Kāpiti Coast District Council, we’re working to develop the local Tech Cluster to collaborate, share knowledge, and grow.  

If you have an idea for an event, have feedback, or would like to learn more, get in touch by emailing kapititechnz@gmail.com. We would love to hear from you!

description:
Meet Wellington, We honestly cannot believe we are inviting you all to the Grand Hall, in Parliament. For our next Meet Wellington event with unparalleled prestige, in the heart of New Zealand's democracy. HuiHui will host us at the Parliament Buildings in Wellington.
Parliament, as a venue, boasts four distinctive and elegant spaces and the team:
Banquet Hall
Grand Hall
Galleria
Legalisative Council Chambers
The HuiHui Function team will host 100 Wellington Event Professionals in the Grand Hall. With an early evening Panel discussion to kick us off. Join us and take the opportunity to #MeetWellington event professionals as we get to know some of those familiar faces, we see and hear from through socials and Wellington event news.
Enjoy expert event management from the Huihui team, premium catering, professional AV, and 24/7 security. You never know we might get a tour of these unique spaces perfect for weddings, conferences, gala dinners, awards nights and more.
Please note: Please enter the Beehive, Parliament building through the main doors and be prepared for security screening of your bags and coats upon arrival.

Dance in the fairy rings, complete some crafts, watch your little ones showcase their coordination in the Keepy Uppy challenge, a delightful game that's as fun to play as it is to say. Don't forget to watch out for the falling Sticky Geckos!
Immerse yourselves in the spirit of Bluey™ as we bring the animated series to life! Come along and share in the joy of Bluey™ inspired games.
For tamariki aged 3+ with their caregivers.

description:
Meet the Buyer Te Whanganui a Tara, Ehara taku toa i te toa takitahi, engari kē he toa takitini
Kia ora koutou, Noaˈia ˈe mḁuri, Kia Orana, Ni Sa Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Mālō e lelei, Malo le soifua, Malo nī, Faka talofa atu, Kam na mauri.
After some very successful Meet the Buyer events in both Porirua and Fielding, we are taking Meet the Buyer to the Capital.
The mission of Amotai is – Building sustainable wealth for Māori and Pasifika. One of the most important ways we do this is through our mission – to unlock opportunities for Māori and Pasifika businesses through supplier diversity.
We are very excited to engage Māori / Pasifika businesses in our nations capital in the second half of our Meet the Buyer programme for 2025. We have some great relationships with Wellington City and Greater Wellington Regional Council, as well as Tier 1 businesses. We are look forward to providing this awesome platform for our Amotai Buyers to connect with Māori and Pasifika businesses to all Amotai suppliers throughout the Wellington region, nau mai, haere mai.
Nau mai, hoki mai ki tēnei whakangahau whanaungatanga. Nau mai, haere mai ki te hono, ki te koorero me te mahi tahi a Suppliers me Buyers o Amotai.

description:
NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape, NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape
This Forum brings a wider range of people involved in critical infrastructure resilience to learn and discuss the latest developments.

About this Event

Welcome to NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape!
This Forum brings together people delivering infrastructure resilience to discuss the latest developments and opportunities.
We welcome attendees from critical infrastructure organisations, regional Lifelines Groups, CDEM Sector, research agencies and others, working to improve New Zealand’s infrastructure resilience and the wellbeing of our communities.


Feature Sessions:
National Resilience Perspectives.
The First ‘R’ - Reducing Risk
Enhancing Resilience – Regulatory and other Levers
Community Resilience to Lifelines Failures
Engineering more Resilient Infrastructure
Intelligence for Readiness and Response
National Planning for Lifelines Readiness and Response.

Interactive Sessions:
• Opportunities for discussion and networking.

Keynotes:
• Political and executive leaders influencing infrastructure resilience.


Associated Forum Events
Wednesday 15th October 2025, 12.30pm - 4.30pm, Lifeline Utility Coordinator Forum (invite only).
Thursday 16th October 2025, 5.30pm – 7.00pm
Social Event tbc. All attendees invited.
Friday 17th October 2025, 7.15am – 8.45am: Breakfast meeting for Programme Managers and Chairs of regional Lifelines Groups (invite only)

description:
NZ Make Tomorrow Chapter Summit, 𝗡𝗭 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁
The Educate Plus NZ Chapter is thrilled to invite you to our 2025 Summit taking place on Tuesday 19 & Wednesday 20 August at Victoria University of Wellington for the 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁. This professional development opportunity will bring together Advancement Practitioners from across New Zealand, in Tertiary Institutions and Schools, all dedicated to shaping the future together.
The Summit, with sessions in Admissions, Alumni & Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing & Communications, Leadership and People & Culture, will be more than just a learning experience—it will also be an opportunity to connect, collaborate, and share insights with professionals who, like you, are passionate about building a better tomorrow.
Through these engaging sessions, meaningful conversations, and shared ideas, you’ll gain the tools and inspiration to create the future you envision, supported by the collective wisdom and energy of the New Zealand Chapter community.
Don’t miss this opportunity … Let’s Make Tomorrow —together.

description:
NZ Make Tomorrow Chapter Summit, 𝗡𝗭 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁
The Educate Plus NZ Chapter is thrilled to invite you to our 2025 Summit taking place on Tuesday 19 & Wednesday 20 August at Victoria University of Wellington for the 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗧𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄 𝗖𝗵𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗦𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁. This professional development opportunity will bring together Advancement Practitioners from across New Zealand, in Tertiary Institutions and Schools, all dedicated to shaping the future together.
The Summit, with sessions in Admissions, Alumni & Community Relations, Fundraising, Marketing & Communications, Leadership and People & Culture, will be more than just a learning experience—it will also be an opportunity to connect, collaborate, and share insights with professionals who, like you, are passionate about building a better tomorrow.
Through these engaging sessions, meaningful conversations, and shared ideas, you’ll gain the tools and inspiration to create the future you envision, supported by the collective wisdom and energy of the New Zealand Chapter community.
Don’t miss this opportunity … Let’s Make Tomorrow —together.

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.

description:
New Zealand Vocational Education and Training Research Forum, Rebuilding together.
Ngā mihi nui ki a koutou katoa

Skills Group and BCITO are delighted to join forces to return NZVETRF as a unique national event to showcase and disseminate new and emerging research and innovation in Vocational Education and Training.
Since 2004, the NZVETRF has been the must-attend event for policy makers, researchers and practitioners engaged in vocational education, across all parts of the tertiary sector and industry.
The vocational education sector is transforming through both policy and technological change. Knowing 'what works' and what is emerging is more critical than ever as a new network of provision for vocational education and training is established.
Over a day and a half you'll hear from international and national keynote speakers, government and sector stakeholders, the learner voice, and debates on the hot topics, along with curated and competitively selected research and evidence presentations.

Places are limited - register now to secure your place at Aotearoa's pre-eminent cross-sector vocational education event.
Call for Abstracts Now Open
We now invite researchers, practitioners, and policy makers to submit abstracts for presentation at the Forum. As part of New Zealand's premier VET research platform, your contributions will help shape New Zealand’s future as our sector moves forward.
Submission Guidelines
Abstracts should be no longer than 300 words and outline your completed research and intended presentation. We particularly welcome submissions that address one or more of our key conference themes:
·       Workplace learning and Industry Training
·       Diversity, Access and Equity
·       Developing our Future Workforce
·       Technology and Innovation
·       Learner Journey and Outcomes
·       Collaboration and System Approaches.
Your research should demonstrate evidence-based outcomes, share good practice, support high-quality research networks, and inform policy development. We encourage submissions that honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi and incorporate Māori perspectives in VET innovation.
Submit your abstract here
Submission Deadline: 5pm, 17 September 2025
An assessment panel comprising representatives from Skills Group, BCITO, and an independent assessor will evaluate all submissions. Successful presenters will be notified by the end of September 2025.
Keynote Speaker Announcement
We are delighted to announce that Kathryn Rowan, Executive Director of Switzerland-based Global Apprenticeship Network will address the Forum.

Kathryn is a seasoned leader with a background in human resources and corporate social responsibility, who brings a wealth of experience from her previous role as Vice President of Human Resources, Zone Latin America, and Global Youth Lead at Nestlé. Throughout her career, Ms. Rowan has consistently demonstrated a passion for harnessing the power of business to drive positive change in society. During her tenure at Nestlé, in national, regional, and global roles, she promoted initiatives to strengthen leadership and capability building, diversity, and corporate reputation, while spearheading youth-focused efforts, including the Global Alliance for Youth.
The Global Apprenticeship Network was established in 2014 by ILO, the International Organisation of Employers (IOE), the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and Business at OECD. GAN is governed by a private-sector led, multi-stakeholder coalition representing major global corporations and international organisations, GAN's primary role is to encourage businesses to implement apprenticeship and WBL programs and support the creation of an enabling policy environment.
Further programme details and speaker announcements will be made in coming weeks, so register now!
Your Co-Hosts
Skills Group is New Zealand's largest Private Training Establishment, supporting 17,000 learners and training across 33 industries, through both work-based and provider-based learning, across 15 campuses nationwide.
BCITO is New Zealand's largest provider of Apprenticeships, having qualified 55,000 tradies and counting, across 15 construction and allied trades.

Skills and BCITO gratefully acknowledge Ako Aotearoa, the Centre for Tertiary Teaching Excellence, for support and permission to carry this event forward. We acknowledge Ako's enormous contribution to VET research and this event over many years. NZVETRF is a taonga, and as co-hosts we are committed to upholding the mana of the event.

Partner with us.
NZVETRF is all about walking the talk on sector collaboration. We warmly invite interest from interested education and industry partners to join on as event supporters. Sponsorship and event supporter packages are available. Contact nzvetrf@skills-group.org for details.

NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape, NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape
This Forum brings a wider range of people involved in critical infrastructure resilience to learn and discuss the latest developments.

About this Event

Welcome to NLUF 2025: Infrastructure Resilience in a Shifting Landscape!
This Forum brings together people delivering infrastructure resilience to discuss the latest developments and opportunities.
We welcome attendees from critical infrastructure organisations, regional Lifelines Groups, CDEM Sector, research agencies and others, working to improve New Zealand’s infrastructure resilience and the wellbeing of our communities.


Feature Sessions:
National Resilience Perspectives.
The First ‘R’ - Reducing Risk
Enhancing Resilience – Regulatory and other Levers
Community Resilience to Lifelines Failures
Engineering more Resilient Infrastructure
Intelligence for Readiness and Response
National Planning for Lifelines Readiness and Response.

Interactive Sessions:
• Opportunities for discussion and networking.

Keynotes:
• Political and executive leaders influencing infrastructure resilience.

description: Exhibition Opening - In Each Other's Pockets, In Each Other’s Pockets opens on Friday 24 October 2025 at Toi Pōneke Gallery, Te Aro, Wellington. Through playful installation, contemporary jeweller Louise Hill examines the politics of pockets; the private spaces that shape the way we move through the world. Through her interactive installation Hill, explores what it means for some bodies to be equipped with tools they need, while others are not.

description:
Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille, Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

description:
SPANK, SPANK
SPANK is happening — and it’s going to be something special!

This isn’t your average dance party — it’s a kinky night with dancing, a dark room, the St. Andrew’s Cross, and more. We’ll have kinky costumes, a spectacular VJ, and a great DJ setting the mood all night long. description:
Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly., Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.
At MOX, we're a small, family-run business based in beautiful Aotearoa, New Zealand. Founded and led by two partners who've shared life's journey for over 25 years, we bring a unique blend of personal commitment and professional expertise to every interaction.

We're not your typical consultants. Instead, we're hands-on experts in procurement and contract management, driven by a desire to create real, lasting change. Our mission is to empower businesses of all sizes, helping you secure the best deals, avoid pitfalls, and gain the kind of commercial protection usually reserved for the big players. We believe in enabling your success by ensuring your contracts and purchasing processes truly work for you.

Procurement & Contract Myths – The Good, The Bad & The Ugly.

Procurement Case Studies - The Bad: How things can go wrong and cost you $$$.
Contract Myth Busting - The Ugly: Why we should embrace contracts; they aren’t “ugly”.
Best Practice - The Good: How good procurement & contracts will “save the day” and protect your business.
Contract Counselling: Tell us about your “bad(s)”. We will guide you on how you can make it “good”.
We have an amazing new innovation that we want to introduce at the session (during the Best Practice part) called Kitset Contract. Kitset Contract is going to empower sole traders & small to medium sized enterprises to truly be able to create and use their own contracts; Allowing them to better protect their business and their hard earned $$$.

Everyone who attends the session will receive a discount code meaning their first contract will be only $49.99 (a $100 discount).

RSVP Here: https://www.kapitichamber.org.nz/events#!event/2025/8/5/l-d-procurement-contract-myths-8211-the-good-the-bad-the-ugly

description:
Pōneke Leader Learning & Doing Day (Sep 2025), Often, the best folk to learn from (and commiserate with) are other leaders. But since we're so busy in the doing, we don't often have the time or ability to take a full day off from work to dedicate to learning new things.... and sometimes conferences can be hit and miss on content.
Last year we created a Leader Learning & Doing Day, where you can come and co-work in the same space as a bunch of other founders and leaders, and also go to mini unconference sessions during the day that are set by you. You share/learn/discuss the things that matter to you most - with other folk that are going through it. We had sessions ranging from how to use AI in your org, founder transitions, and even a photographer taking new head shots for folk. 
The price of the ticket covers a koha to the venue and for some coffee/snacks. You can choose to come to all the sessions, or just one or two of them, and you'll have access to coffee and wifi throughout the day. 

Below is our plan for the day:
9:30am - Arrival & coffee
9:45am - Welcome, Introduction round & Agenda Setting
10:30am - Session 1
11:30am - Session 2
12:30pm - Lunch
1:30pm - Session 3
2:30pm - Farewell/head out for a drink (or home - you choose!)
Co-hosts
Anna Guenther - helps Kiwi fund the things they care about. Co-founder of PledgeMe and Cheese Cartel, co-instigator of Women Who Get Sh*t Done Unconference
Ash Holwell -  creates spaces enabling care and connection towards a socially and sustainably just world. Co-founder of oneonesix, oneonethree and two/fiftyseven they believe deeply that safe places are fundamental to thriving communities, therefore everyone should have access to them.

description:
Self Promotion for Business Owners, First impressions count! 
Present yourself as an approachable, confident and competent business owner to attract new clients.
Overview:
Highly interactive in-person workshop, ensuring you action and refine your learnings immediately amidst a safe supportive learning environment.
Our goal is to make a natural strong first impression and spark further conversation with potential clients. We will cover crafting a compelling narrative, identifying a target audience, and practicing impactful delivery.
Key learnings:
Understand basic sales skills and the psychology around self-promotion
Manage your nerves
Refine your message
Become savvy in articulating your USP (unique selling proposition)
Learn what to say when and how using powerful words and body language
Receive on the spot expert coaching and feedback
Work on your voice modulation, posture, and gestures to ooze professionalism
 Previous Workshop Attendee:
"Big thanks to Angelika Barnes for her course on "Self Promotion'. I would highly recommend her. We learnt so much and had a great time doing so! The workshop helped me immensely in developing a clear, concise & compelling way of presenting and promoting myself in future business environments. Angelika is a great presenter."
Luke Swart, Nelson
Presenter Bio:
With a background in sales and communication as trainer for the Banking Academy in Cologne, Germany and roles in both operational and people management, Angelika has maintained her focus on empowering people through highly engaging experiential workshops and 1:1 coaching sessions.
Angelika empowers people to express themselves with confidence and is looking forward to sharing gems that help others succeed.
To register - visit https://www.abcangelikabarnescoaching.com/funded
You could be eligible for up to75% funding through the Regional Business Partner Network (RBPN) Growth Advisors, e.g. Rose Ryan call 03 577 9575 or email rose@mcoc.org.nz o

description:
Live & Work in Japan! Q&A Evening with JET Programme Alumni, Have you ever wanted to live and work in Japan?
Come talk
to some people who've done it!
Every year, a diverse range of New Zealanders representing a variety of backgrounds, ages, interests, and cultures start a life-changing adventure in Japan-and next year that could include you!
With applications for the New Zealand JET Programme around the corner, you may have questions about what it's actually like to be sent off to live and teach in Japan for a year or more!
The JET Alumni Association of Wellington, in coordination with The Embassy of Japan, have organised a casual evening event for prospective applicants to ask those questions, and hear some stories to help you make a better decision about if the JET Programme is right for you.
Q&A event details
Date: 6th October 2025
Time: 17:30 - 19:30
Location: Yoshi Sushi & Bento (Press Hall, Willis Street)
Doors open from 5:30, with Q&A starting from 6:00.
Enjoy free
courtesy of Yoshi Sushi & Bento.
(Drinks, including Japanese
will also be available for purchase).
Admission to the event is FREE!
So come along and bring your friends
to this great opportunity to meet a handful of the thousands of Kiwis who've taken part in this programme over the past 40 years
Anyone interested in applying is welcome to attend!

What is the Japan Exchange Teaching (JET) Programme, you ask?
The JET Programme is an overseas employment opportunity to live and work in Japan for a year or more! You could soon head abroad on the adventure of a lifetime, and get paid for it!
Programme criteria includes the following-are you:
A New Zealand citizen?
Already graduated?
Or will have your Bachelor's Degree/Teaching Diploma conferred by early July 2026?
Interested in international activities?
Interested in teaching English to young people and living in Japan?

Positions available:
Assistant Language Teacher (ALT)
ALTs help the Japanese foreign language teachers in class and help prepare teaching materials and class activities. They may assist in English language clubs and other extra-curricular activities. Knowledge of Japanese is not required to be an ALT.
Coordinator for International Relations (CIR)
CIRs work in local government offices and are involved in international activities, which might include editing publications, translation work, advising on the planning and implementation of exchange programmes, and interpreting at international events. A functional knowledge of written and spoken Japanese is required to be a CIR.
For more information about the New Zealand JET Programme, visit:
https://www.nz.emb-japan.go.jp/itpr_en/jet.html
https://www.facebook.com/JETProgrammeNZ/
We hope to see you there!
