description:
Wellington Timebank Spring Clothes Swap!, All welcome!
Wellington Timebank will be hosting a fun social event for Spring - a clothes swap! Come along to meet and hang out with other Timebank members, and take this opportunity to sustainably refresh and/or clear out your wardrobe for Spring!
Sunday 19 October
10am-1.30pm
Te Aro Zero Waste Centre
2 Forresters Lane, Te Aro
--
How it works:
10am-11am:
Drop off your clothes/accessories etc to swap (washed and in good condition please!).
We welcome clothes and accessories from/for everyone - including kids clothes and pet clothes (?)!
~ Have a hot drink while our team sort out the clothes
~
11.30am-1.30pm:
Swap is open! Go and get yourself a whole new wardrobe!
--
Timebankers receive 1 time credit for bringing clothes, or spend 1 time credit to pick up some new (to you) clothes (if you do both, it's free!).
Non-timebankers can attend for koha, so please feel free to bring your friends and whānau. And encourage them to join the Timebank
All clothing remaining after the swap will be donated to charity op-shops - Aunty Dana's and Opportunity for Animals.
If you would like to do some baking or volunteer (we need some clothes sorters!) for this event, your support would be very much appreciated! Please send me a message/email me on info@wellingtontimebank.org.nz.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Spring Container Planting Workshop, Grow Your Own Kai - In Containers From Your Own Compost

Want to grow your own fresh kai but only have a balcony, patio, or courtyard? This hands-on workshop will show you how to grow spring vegetables and herbs in containers - a flexible, low-cost way to turn even the smallest space into a productive garden. Following on from our winter edition, this is the second workshop in our seasonal container growing series, with a focus on getting your spring garden thriving using your own compost.

This workshop will cover:
- What to grow in spring, including leafy greens, herbs, and root vegetables
- How to set up containers - choosing the right size, drainage, potting mix, and using your own compost or bokashi soil
- Feeding your plants with DIY fertilisers, spotting nutrient gaps, and refreshing tired soil
- Creating ideal growing conditions with sunlight, watering tips, wind protection, and natural pest control
- Keeping your garden productive by harvesting, replanting, and rotating crops throughout the season

Please bring your own container(s) - buckets, storage bins, flexi tubs, or old drawers all welcome. We will show you how to safely repurpose them.

Spaces are limited, book now to get growing this Spring!

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival: Tales from the Vaults Tour, Tales from the Vaults.
Find out who is in and who is out of some of Karori cemetery’s most substantial dwellings. Note: tours do not enter vaults or try them out for size. 
The tour duration is 1 hour 45mins.
This tour is suitable for people with moderate fitness. The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required. This tour involves approximately 2km of walking, with some slow paced but uphill stints

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes long
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Sterling Silver Earring Workshop, Sterling Silver Earring Workshop
Make your own Sterling Silver summer earrings – Saturday 13th September at Square Edge Art Centre, Palmerston North

Looking for a fun workshop to get your creative juices flowing after a long week in the office? Then come join us on Saturday 13th September at the Square Edge Art Centre in Palmerston North where you will make your own pair of sterling silver earrings in 4 – 5 hours.

When: Saturday 13th September, starts at 10:00 for about 4 – 5 hours (or until you’re done)
Cost: $120 - $150 pp (depending on if you add a gemstone to your design or not. See more info below)
Space: Only 8 spaces available ( book at https://www.rholenesingleton.com/product-page/summer-earrings-workshop )


What to expect:
• Friendly, expert guidance by local metalsmith Rholene Singleton. She will assist you every step of the way ensuring you leave with a beautiful pair of earrings at the end of the day.
• Design your own earrings to create something uniquely yours, or make use of the templates available, which you can embellish as you like.
• You have the option to add a semi-precious cabochon gemstone to your design.
• A selection of refreshments will be available, but you are welcome to bring a light lunch if you feel like the day will get too long without it.
• Relaxed and fun morning enjoyed in the beautiful iconic Square Edge Art Centre in the heart of Palmerston North. View the current artist exhibitions currently on show in the center for free.


Practical Details:
Come and learn the ancient art of silver jewellery making through demonstrations and then giving it a go yourself while you create your own beautiful new summer earrings, using a jewellers saw, blowtorch, gemstone setting tools and more.

• Two options for this workshop:
1. Plain sterling silver earrings - $120 pp
2. Add cabochon gemstones to your design - $150 pp

• 4 – 5 hours of guidance as you create your own piece
• All tools and materials included
• A selection of gemstones to choose from

Your space will be confirmed once payment is received. This workshop is first come, first serve. Space is limited.

To book please go to https://www.rholenesingleton.com/product-page/summer-earrings-workshop
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Sweat Reflect & Connect with Carolyn Patchell, Sweat – get those endorphins going!
Reflect – review our movements!
Connect – spend time with our classmates!
Sessions:
All Day 10.15am to 4pm $55
Morning 10.15am to 1pm $30
Afternoon 1.15pm to 4pm $30
Our day will start with a 30-minute Dance Fitness session that will include warm-ups but no cool down as we’ll head straight into a Tips and Tuition session. We’ll break down movements, go over cues and choreography, and look at how to increase or decrease intensity (or manage any injuries we might be carrying). We’ll take a break together and some healthy snacks will be provided along with hot drinks. We’ll then head into another Dance Fitness session where you can put your newfound knowledge to use (or just have some fun and party like it’s Friday night)! After a stretch and cooldown, we’ll do a bit of a wrap up over lunch (bring your own) and spend some time relaxing and chatting. Hot drinks will be available, or you can pop out if you need a barista made flat white!
If you’re not staying for the full day, we’ll say farewell after lunch and the rest of us will prepare to greet those coming in for the afternoon session.
The afternoon will start with a Strong Fit session which will contain elements of our Thursday night class. We’ll then move straight into a Tips and Tuition session which will look at all elements of our Strength Based Combo class. This will include form, technique, options, and how to maximise your weekly workouts. We’ll then take a break with some healthy (and easily digested) snacks before we power into a final Strong Fit session. Following the session, we’ll have a decent stretch and take the time to review what we’ve learned, chat amongst ourselves, and say farewell before our day concludes at 4pm.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: Community Service Day: Serving Our City, A day of service where we come together to serve our community. Projects will include cleaning up local parks, helping at a local food bank, and visiting a nursing home. This is a great opportunity to live out our faith and make a tangible difference in the world. All are welcome to join us.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description: Floral Therapy - A Wild Bouquet Workshop, Join us for a hands-on floral workshop where nature, creativity, and intentional design come together. Led by Jade — a floral designer with a background in natural health — you’ll learn how to create a garden-style hand-tied bouquet using seasonal blooms and healing herbs. We’ll explore bouquet-building techniques, flower symbolism, and how to work with nature’s rhythms in your design process. No prior experience needed — just bring your curiosity and love for flowers.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Sustainable Spring Clothing Repair & Workshop - Gold Coin Donation, Sustainable Spring Clothing Repair & Workshop - Gold Coin Donation
Give your clothes a second life!

Drop in anytime between 10-2pm for a relaxed, hands-on session where you’ll learn simple ways to repair and refresh your clothing. Whether it’s sewing on a button, fixing a hem, or trying your hand at visible mending, we’ll guide you through easy techniques that keep your wardrobe going strong.

✅ Drop in anytime – no bookings needed
✅ All materials provided
✅ Bring a garment to repair or upcycle — or just come to learn!
✅ Gold coin donation

Let’s make mending part of everyday life — good for the planet and your clothes.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Storytelling On Stage, Do you love storytelling shows like The Moth? Come join the growing art of live storytelling. Learn how to find ideas from your life, craft a compelling narrative, and deliver your story in a confident and entertaining way.

Description
Live storytelling is an artform unto itself, requiring different skills and techniques from standup comedy or prose writing. In this four-part workshop, you’ll learn:

- Creative writing exercises and daily practices to to find meaningful stories from your life
- Tools for crafting a compelling personal narrative
- Techniques to build suspense, drama, and humour into your stories
- Stagecraft and performance skills to heighten and polish your delivery

By the end of the class you'll have
- One or more polished 5-10 minute stories to showcase on stage
- Dozens of ideas to expand upon for future stories
- Writing practices to improve your life as a creative
- Less stage fright and more confidence as a speaker

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Textured Rings - Welcome Spring!, Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Rafa Ferrer Noel's: AFROKAN - Wellington Jazz Festival, Led by New Zealand’s foremost exponents of Cuban music, Afrokan marks the latest project from veteran percussionist Rafa Ferrer Noel.
This premiere performance offers audiences a vibrant and
rhythmically rich exploration of cross-cultural musical dialogue.
A central figure in Wellington’s Cuban and Latin music communities for over two decades, Rafa leads an accomplished octet performing a sophisticated fusion of Afro-Cuban rhythms and contemporary jazz.
The ensemble features Rafa Ferrer Noel, Mikey Trujillo and John Rae (percussion), Jacqui Nyman (bass), Ben Wilcock (piano), André Paris and Ben Hunt (horns).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden, Victorian Photography Workshop with Brian Scadden
DATE: Sunday Sept 28
TIME: 9:30am-1:30pm
LOCATION: Cobblestones Museum, Greytown
AGES: Over 18
COST: $135 per person. Max 5 people.
Come and have a go at wet-plate collodion photography, using authentic materials to produce your own heirloom image as were made 170 years ago. This almost lost art produces one-of-a-kind images on tin or glass plates, which you create and have an image you’ve crafted to take away.

Brian Scadden will be your instructor for this workshop. Brain has been passionate about photography for over 40 years, beginning his career at the National Film Unit in the 1970s before joining Park Road Post Production as Head of Laboratory, Head of Picture, and Restoration Manager. His work in film sparked an interest in early photographic techniques, prompting him to master wet-plate collodion photography. In 2006, he was invited to assist leading wet-plate experts in the USA and has since taught many New Zealanders this challenging process. Jane, who attended Brian’s workshop in 2014, later married him in 2019 and completed a photographic project in Carterton in 2016.
Although Brian retired in 2015, he returned for short-term assignments at Park Road Post and part-time work at Archive NZ, supporting film archiving until mid-2023. Both Brian and Jane continue to shoot with 35mm and 120mm film using vintage cameras from their collection.

NOTE: Link for booking tickets coming soon.

Email:
www.greytownarttown.com

description:
Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night, Top of the South Film Festival Red Carpet Screening & Awards Night
The Top of the South Film Festival (TSFF) returns for it's 11th annual edition. With three days of celebratory events throughout Nelson & Marlborough, this is a chance to walk the red carpet, share food and drinks, and mingle with the celebrities before premiering the 2025 selection of the best short films created both in the Top of the South region and throughout the rest of the country. From thrillers and dramas to westerns, animated comedies and documentaries—this year’s screenings contain entertainment for all.

SUNDAY 19 OCTOBER
10:30am-12:30pm - Bus Tour: Join locations manager & scout Dylan Poihipi in a tour around Marlborough as we discuss the art & technicalities of locations for film. Departing from ASB Theatre Marlborough.
2-3:45pm - Regional Screening: a curated collection of short films produced within the Top of the South region. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.
5:30pm - Red Carpet screening & awards night. Doors open at 5:30pm with canapes in the foyer, followed by a curated collection of national and local short films at 6:30pm. The presentation of awards begins at 8:30pm. The Anderson, ASB Theatre Marlborough.

All festival proceeds are donated to the Top of the South Film Production Society, which provides financial support to its members who pursue the art of filmmaking in our Top of the South region.

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1, This course is for beginners who have no prior knowledge of te reo Māori or Māori culture. (NZ Citizens and residents pay $109 with ID, all others pay $199).

Description
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

• Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them
• Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns
• Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context
• Identify and respond to phrases in the classroom including basic commands/instructions
• Confidently describe the day/date, time, and the weather

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Fundamentals of Drawing for Tweens and Teens, In this course you will learn the basics of structure and perspective so you can draw anything you like. Returning students are assigned additional challenges in order to promote continuous development of their drawing journey.

We'll be drawing on paper with pencils and pens. There's a strong emphasis on learning structure and perspective drawing, with the aim to feel more confident in drawing anything - real or imagined. We will be drawing things from real life, from photos and from our imagination.

What you will learn in the class.
- Perspective - learning the basics to help draw forms and spaces convincingly.
- Using perspective to draw organic forms.
- The structure of human faces - Constructing the face to understand it.
- The structure of human figures - Drawing the body from the skeleton out.
- The structure of animal and creature bodies - Seeing the similarities to humans.
- Shading and shadows - Understanding light as it hits objects.
- Composition - Arranging elements in your picture.
- Using different B&W mediums like pencils, pens, inks.

This course is catered to ages 10 years or older. Materials included.

Tuesdays after school, 14 October - 2 December, 3:45 - 5:15 pm.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Water Casting - Spring, This is a super quick 3-hour session, and is great fun to do with family or friends.
Water casting is a really hands-on low-tech casting method that results in surprising and fun little forms that can be turned into pendants with amazing textures and shapes.
You will be guided through melting silver and pouring it into water to create little charms.
Experiment with pouring at different heights to create different shapes.
Choose one or a few of your favourites to have drilled and turn into simple pendants or earrings, or new charms for your bracelets!
We will use hardened jump rings to attach your water-cast pieces to either colourful cord or you can choose sterling silver chains which you can purchase for extra.
The technique will be demonstrated with important health and safety practices, then students will be guided to do at least a couple of casts, and should expect to have at least one successful item to clean up and finish in the class.
A basic amount of metal allowance of a small amount of silver is included in your course costs, and if your projects go over that amount you can pay for the metal you use on the day via internet banking or cash.
This course is open to complete beginners and advanced makers. Extra materials such as chains and findings are available to purchase.
For health and safety reasons class participants must wear sturdy, closed toe shoes and have their hair tied back.
Workshop fee $128, Early bird $115 till 17 August.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
NIGHT 2 Paul Ubana Jones Plays The Shed, NIGHT 2
Doors open 7.30pm for an 8PM start.
Don’t miss Paul up close and personal in this intimate 35 seat venue.
An intimate soulful performer, an acoustic guitar sensation, winner of three New Zealand Music Awards.
Paul has shared the stage and toured with the best: BB King, Bob Dylan, Taj Mahal, Keb Mo, Crowded House, Tuck and Patti… He has delighted festival audiences at the Dublin Blues Festival, Byron bay Blues festival, Vancouver Island Folk Festival, Blues at Bridgetown and many others in Europe.
“A national treasure; Paul Ubana Jones is so much more than one man with a guitar. He is a conjuror of unique and original songs, rooted in primal Blues and Soul”
“The most exciting Electro Acoustic Artist to visit our shores”
Good Morning News, Santa Monica
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Techno Taster, Techno Taster
This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.

We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.


ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM

Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.

Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com


HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven

Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.

https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9


LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective

Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.

https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s-rizzo/416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus


SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands

Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.

Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.

https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/album/ech009-bracing-set-pace-u-dont
https://soundcloud.com/1shli
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025, Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025
Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.

This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.

We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.

This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.

Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit

www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.

For questions, email .

Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice

description:
Ōtari Raranga Hōngongoi 2025 - Intermediate, Ma te mōhio ka roa, ma te ora ka mōhio
Through learning there is life, through life there is learning

Nau mai haere mai, welcome to Ōtari Raranga Wānanga - Intermediate level

After completing about 6 beginner classes (close together) as well as practice at home you may be ready to move up to our intermediate classes. We will let you know.

We will be planning projects in advance to keep all on similar taonga.

PRojects may include new closes for your kete timata, kete waikawa, puritanga, pīkau and pōtae. We will teach you preparation, preservation and storage of harakeke - important especially over winter months.

Additionally, we will induct you to the Ōtari Pā Harakeke when ready.

With regular attendance you will deepen mātauranga gained from beginner classes and share you learnings with others. (Refer to below for a reminder).

What’s included in your intermediate ticket?
- Three hours+ weaving class with our tuakana weavers and raranga rangatira.
- Limited access to tools as you are expected to be have your own kete mahi (tool kit).
- You are expected to bring your own harakeke.
- We encourage you to harvest for yourself but if you are unable to harvest for class, we have ‘Please harvest for me’ options in addition to your ticket at least three days before class.
- Light refreshments are provided and we encourage you to bring kai to share

Led by our raranga Rangatira; Frank Topia (Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Haua) with Linda Lee (Ngāti Huia, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kurī, Te Rarawa, Te Aupōuri), and Anna Lees (Te Āti Awa, Kāi Tahu). Supported by our kaiāwhina; Anita Murdoch (Ngāti Kahungunu and Waikato-Tainui), Sarah O’Sullivan (Ngāi Tahu), Te Kāhui Tapsell (Te Arawa, Tainui), and Frankie Stewart (Tangata Tiriti).

Important information
- It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia.
- At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable.
- If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class.
- We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
- It is important to us that our classes are accessible to all. If ticket costs are a barrier for you please visit our website to enquire about our reduced cost or free tickets.

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers

For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz

TICKETING INFORMATION
Tuakana = Older sibling
Intermediate / Tuakana - General Admission: $25
Intermediate / Tuakana - Concession Admission: $20
Intermediate / Tuakana - Koha Admission: $15
Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $45.00

ADD ON - Harvest for me: $20 + eventfinder fees (10 rau only) - 3 days notice required
ADD ON - Harvest for me: $40 + eventfinder fees (20 rau only) - 3 days notice required

Note: Eventfinda fees apply

We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

With regular attendance you will:
- Learn tikanga (protocols) and karakia for hauhake (harvesting) and preparing harakeke
- Build your mātauranga (knowledge)
- Use kupu Māori appropriate to raranga practice
- Develop your pūkenga (practical skills)
- Create taonga (treasures) for your whānau
- Build hononga (connections) within our raranga rōpū (group)

Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting
- We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust. This enables us to continue to offer subsidised and free events to the community.
- Shared Lines Trust is registered with Charities Service; Shared Lines Trust (CC61762)
- All donations over $5 made to The Trust are tax-deductible
- For corporate gifting or individuals requesting tax credits please email SharedLinesTrust@gmail.com
- Visit www.sharedlines.org.nz for more information

description:
2nd Anniversary Party, Jungle Juice: 2nd Anniversary Party
FRIDAY 29TH AUGUST • 9PM–3AM •
THE GARDEN HOTEL - WELLINGTON
We’re turning 2 years old, and we want to celebrate with all of you! We’ve been bringing you beach parties and raves for 2 years and we’re not slowing down. It’s also DJ By Accident’s birthday, so we’re throwing a massive jungle rave filled with our multicoloured line-up from house to techno at The Garden Hotel.
LINE-UP:
• NOT MY SISTER - House
• DJ BY ACCIDENT - Afro-Latin House
• GASPAR - Bounce Singalong Techno
• MALWARE - Hard Techno
Dress code: Party Animals (think jungle creatures, leopard, snakeskin, zebra, cheetah. Get wild!)
See you in the jungle!


***Please Respect the Venue***
*** Important Information ***
• At Jungle Juice we will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
• Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
• Remember we all come from different walks of life and we don’t know what others have/are going through. Never judge anyone by who they are.
• We share our time with you in a loving and respectful way and we want everyone to feel this every minute they are at a Jungle Juice event.
• Consent is key – always.
• Have fun and please find us on the decks if you have any issues.

description:
Raw Meat Monday, Raw Meat Monday is back for 2025! Wellington's longest-running open mic comedy night.

Comedy gold and comedy coal, each night is a guaranteed gamble. If you’re trying comedy for the first time, Raw Meat is the safest place to start. Featuring a guest MC and a changing lineup of first-time acts, seasoned pros, and everything in between.

Interested in performing? Email the Humorous Arts Trust at contact@humorous.co.nz to book a spot.

Please be advised, the show may contain adult themes and strong language

Thanks to Cameron Harrison Butchery and Delicatessen for sponsoring the raffle!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Alzheimers Marlborough Art, Crafts and Collections Trail 2025, Alzheimers Marlborough Art, Crafts and Collections Trail 2025
Coinciding with World Alzheimers Month our 4th Annual Art, Crafts & Collections Trail is once again bringing art to your community and showcasing some of our local, wonderfully talented artists, while helping us provide services for people living with dementia and their families and carers.

We have a large selection of artists, craftspeople and specialty collectors displaying their art in their own studios, or in shared spaces in the Marlborough Alzheimers Centre and a selection of galleries around Blenheim.

Whether you're an admirer of visual arts, handcrafted masterpieces, or unique collectibles, this weekend promises an inspiring array of works to explore. Visitors can engage directly with artists, gaining insights into their creative processes and the stories behind their works. Families and friends are encouraged to come together to celebrate creativity while supporting a meaningful cause. This very special fundraising event helps us meet the increasing demand for the range of services we offer to support local people affected by dementia, and their families.

The Art Trail is a self-drive event with tickets available for just $30 per person, on sale from 19th August at the following places:

- Marlborough Alzheimers Centre, 8 Wither Road, Blenheim - Monday to Friday, 9am-3pm
- Scenic Hotel Marlborough, 65 Alfred Street, Blenheim - Open 7 days 9am - 9pm
- Agrivit Ltd, 29 High Street, Renwick - Monday to Friday, 8am-4.30pm
- Marlborough Art Gallery, Library Building, 15 High Street, Blenheim - Tuesday to Friday, 10am – 4pm, Weekends, 1pm – 4pm

Tickets are valid for both days of the Art Trail. The tickets show where to find each exhibitor, a brief outline of their style and an illustration showing the amazing talent on display.

Devonshire Teas will also be available at the Marlborough Alzheimers Centre, 8 Wither Road for $5 per person during the event.

We are encouraging our very supportive Marlborough community to gather their friends together and enjoy a special weekend out and about. It’s a great opportunity to see some amazing art and talk to some of our wonderfully talented artists living and working here Marlborough. You may even be able to purchase a favourite piece of art as a gift or for your own enjoyment.

All funds raised from our Art Trail remain in Marlborough.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Baby Rock & Rhyme, Join us in PlayHQ for these Tuesday sessions.
Baby Rock & Rhyme with Wellington City Libraries & Nōku te Ao Capital E
Ideal for babies and tiny tots, Baby Rock & Rhyme is a weekly drop-in programme for you to spend quality time with your baby through rhymes, fingerplays and stories.
Delivered by an experienced facilitator, you and your baby will have fun exploring their first introduction to literacy and music, set inside the inspiring and ever-changing PlayHQ.
Best suits ages 0-2, Baby Rock & Rhyme is part of our E Tipu E Rea term-time programme.
Free, donations appreciated.
Nōku te Ao Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf. Pram parking and accessible bathrooms available.
Learn more at: https://www.capitale.org.nz/event/baby-rock-n-rhyme/
label: Family Friendly

description:
Art and AI: Brit Bunkley in Conversation with Megan Dunn, Art and AI: Brit Bunkley in Conversation with Megan Dunn
Artist and filmmaker Brit Bunkley discusses the pragmatics and politics of making art with AI. Join us for a discussion in the Gallery, with insights into the making of his latest work Archive, commissioned for Messengers.

--

Brit Bunkley is a New Zealand-based artist and videographer whose practice spans sculpture, installation, and digital media. A recipient of the US National Endowment for the Arts fellowship, two NY state grants, and the Rome Prize Fellowship, his work explores the intersection of physical and virtual spaces, often blending surreal imagery with themes of history, politics, and environmental concerns. He has exhibited at the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa and internationally at Rencontres Internationales Paris/Berlin, FILE São Paulo (including 2025), and the Athens Digital Arts Festival. Recent exhibitions include Visions in the Nunnery, London (2022), Cybersculpture 2024 at Collège des Bernardins, Paris, and The Torrance Art Museum, LA (2025). In 2024, he won Best Art | Experimental Video/Film at the New York City Independent Film Festival. His work continues to evolve, embracing new technologies and alternative methodologies to challenge perceptions of reality and imagination.

Learn more here > https://citygallery.org.nz/events/art-and-ai-brit-bunkley-in-conversation-with-megan-dunn/

IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Archive, single channel video, 2025
label: Community & Culture

description:
Wild Spring Lunch in Haewai Houghton Valley, Please note the change of date!! - this is now happening on Sunday 19 October
Haewai Houghton Valley is kicking off this year’s Seeds-to-Feeds local food festival with a lunch that celebrates the fresh kai that is springing up wild in our gardens and on the hillsides. Come and enjoy a delicious vegetarian meal (vegan and gluten free available too). 
The menu includes soup, bread and spreads, foraged salad, vegetable savouries, cakes and tea and coffee.
Tickets are $15 plus a small booking fee. The first $5 will go towards the wonderful work that the Seeds-to-Feeds team continues to do for us. The $10 plus any more you wish to donate on top of that will go towards Haewai Houghton Valley community projects.
label: Festivals

description:
Book Reading: Noho Tahi 和平共處 by Noho Tahi Collective, We're thrilled to host this event to celebrate Noho Tahi | 和平共處 by Noho Tahi Collective, with 5ever Books.
Noho Tahi | 和平共處 is the inaugural residency project for The Dan and Una Chan & Laywood and Joyce Chan Residency at Wai-te-ata Press. The Residency’s focus is on “projects that enhance understandings of and engagement with Chinese Aotearoa, whether historical, social or cultural.
Speakers on the night are: Etienne Wain 黃義天 , Juhyeon 주현, brenda wang, Brecon Dobbie 布雷肯.
This multimedia collection reflects on noho tahi | 和平共處, peaceful co-existence between cultures — an emerging invitation for Hainamana/NZ Chinese communities to reorient ourselves towards Tangata Whenua in ways that uphold Tikanga Māori, Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and the diversities and complexities within Hainamanatanga (Chinese ways of being in Aotearoa).
Nau mai, haere mai! 入嚟坐!
label: Community & Culture

description: Sermon Series: The Parables of Jesus, A sermon series exploring the parables of Jesus Christ and their timeless wisdom. Each week, we will delve into a different parable and uncover its meaning for our lives today. This series is suitable for all ages and levels of faith, and will provide practical insights for living a more Christ-like life. All are welcome.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Bride Of The Year 2025, For 55 years, Wairarapa Bride of the Year has been a mainstay in the events calendar in the region. The event returns to the Wairarapa Events Centre for 2025, where brides who were married between 1 July and 30 June and were married in the Wairarapa, and/or have lived or are living in the Wairarapa, and/or whose spouse has lived in the Wairarapa, will get the chance to relive the magic of their big day, donning their gowns again, all while raising much needed funds for Te Awhina Plunket Wairarapa.

This event is unique in its focus on Wairarapa’s flourishing wedding industry. It is a great opportunity for couples planning their own weddings to look for inspiration from other local couples, for friends and families of brides to reminisce on the weddings. It is also an excellent opportunity to support Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.

In 2024, the funds raised through Bride of the Year went towards purchasing equipment for use for Plunket rooms across Wairarapa along with purchase .

A ticket to Bride of the Year provides you with a night of glamour and celebration of love, all while supporting Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Writing For Children, Want to write for children but not sure where to start? Be guided through exercises to generate and expand your ideas and find out more about children's book genres and publishing.

Award-winning children’s author, Helen Fletcher, will take you through a series of writing tasks to generate ideas for children’s short stories, picture and chapter books, will help you take your own ideas further, as well as provide information about the requirements of different children’s book genres.

By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Complete writing exercises to generate and expand ideas for children’s books
- Identify the requirements of different genres of children’s books
- Follow publishers’ formatting guidelines, and prepare scripts accordingly
- Identify the next steps for your own writing, including possible publishing opportunities
- Bring pen and paper and lunch (tea and coffee provided).

Presented by Helen Vivienne Fletcher.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Putting the Fun in Funding, Do you have some questions about your NZ Fringe 2026 Kākano and Fatu Funding applications and Budgets?
Join Vanessa and Katie at Te Auaha on Tuesday, 14 October at 6 p.m. for some helpful and insightful tips and or to answer any funding questions and support you with both your applications and event budgeting.
The Kākano and Fatu Funding Portal will be open from 9 am on the 14th of OCT and will remain open until 5 pm Tuesday the 18th of NOV. This funding applies to all registered NZ Fringe 2026 artists and events and is supported with thanks by the Wellington City Council and the CNZ Pacifica Strategy Team.
All successful funding recipients will be notified by the 1 of Dec 2025
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
CFs 20th Birthday Party (Placeholder), On the 10th of October 2005 Rafael Ferrer Noel arrived in New Zealand and CUBAN☆FUSION - Wellington's Cuban Salsa Specialists - was born.
Coincidentally the 10th of October is also Cuban Independence Day (a.k.a. El Dia del Grito de Yara) - on this day in 1868, Carlos Manuel de Céspedes, "Father of the Homeland", gave freedom to his slaves and started the independence war against the Spanish colonial power, which led to the Ten Years' War
So we've got lots to celebrate and commemorate today!
A BIG GRACIAS to our teachers and assistants present and past (Rogelio Enrique Carles-Rosas, Nina Baranenko, Niki Boolieris and Jenny Beech), and all our students, dancers and supporters over the years. Without you we would not exist!
label: Community & Culture

description:
CUBAN☆FUSION's Annualish PINK Cuba St Salsa Party Breast Cancer Fundraiser's 9th Anniversary - KOHA, CUBAN☆FUSION's Annualish PINK Cuba St Salsa Party Breast Cancer Fundraiser's 9th Anniversary - KOHA
On the 9th of October it will sadly be 9 years since our little sister Wilhelmina died of a particularly aggressive form of breast cancer just 3 weeks short of her 50th birthday and a week before her eldest of 4 girls' 16th birthday, which we bought forward a week so she could be there to celebrate it. She took her last breath at 6.06pm the next day while our father (RIP) and I held her hands and my brother played his guitar at her feet.. with Charles Humphreys at her head and our Mum and her girls looking on, and while Rafael and Sjaak held the fort and kicked off Sunday Salsa at The Cross.. in my absence.

***

PLEASE JOIN US DRESSED IN AS MUCH PINK AS POSSIBLE IN CUBA MALL ON FRIDAY 1 NOVEMBER @ 6PM - THE DAY BEFORE OUR SISTER'S ("MINA'") WOULD HAVE BEEN 58TH BIRTHDAY - TO CELEBRATE LIFE IN PINK 🩷 LA VITA IN ROSA 🩷 LEVEN IN ROZE 🩷 LA VIDA EN ROSA 🩷 LA VIE EN ROSE 🩷 ORA I ROTO I TE MAWHERO 🩷 AND TO RAISE AS MUCH AS WE CAN FOR BCFNZ.

***

CUBAN☆FUSION - Wellington's Cuban Salsa Specialists' famous Cuba Street Salsa Party is going PINK this November for a very good cause - The Breast Cancer Foundation NZ.

What better place to dance Salsa than in the street, Cuba Street to be exact.

Don't worry if you don't know how to dance, we'll teach you!

Dress Code: PINK!

Help us raise awareness and funds for a very good cause and have a good time at the same time.. the Cuban way.. dancing the night away under the stars!

Suggested Koha/Donation: $5

Aiming to fund-raise $1,000 this year.. that's only 200 people @ $5 dancing Salsa in Cuba Street all PINKed up. We can do it!

EFTPOS available - 1.1% surcharge applies.

Alternatively, (or if you can't make it to the event, but would like to contribute) you can also donate on-line to our dedicated Pink Party account:

02-0343-0003801-007

ALL donations will go directly to The Breast Cancer Foundation NZ to help them in their mission to educate and find better cures.

Please give generously.

LOCATION: You will find us in "La Plaza" - the open space between the Bucket Fountain and the Left Bank Lane in Cuba Mall.

NB: This event is weather dependent. Decision to relocate or postpone will be made by 4pm at the latest on the day.

RAIN DATE: TBC

***

This event annualish (thanks to COVID) is dedicated to the memory of CUBAN☆FUSION's Co-Founder Rosina van der Aa's little sister Wilhelmina van der Aa, who died three weeks short of her 50th birthday on 9 October 2016 of very aggressive secondary breast cancer leaving behind four gorgeous girls and one loving husband.

#because_we_need_a_cure_not_a_miracle
#dontwalkby
#takeaction
#donate
#dancesalsa
#wearpink
#keepcalmdancecuban

Today 8 women will be diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Yet 30% of eligible women are not enrolled for free screening

This year 600+ will most likely die from Breast Cancer

And 60% of women do not know the signs beyond a lump

Knowledge is power… and knowledge helps beat breast cancer. Get knowledgeable here: https://www.breastcancerfoundation.org.nz/breast-awareness

Remember if you are 45-69 and not enrolled for free mammograms you can enrol by calling BreastScreen Aotearoa on 0800 270 200.

To find out more about CUBAN☆FUSION, its dance classes and upcoming dance and music event please visit our website.

CUBAN☆FUSION © 2005 - Wellington's Cuban Salsa Specialists | www.cubanfusion.co.nz | | 021-621-245

description:
Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography, Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Saturday 23 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required. The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship, TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship
Entry form is live:

Back again for 2025, the TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship! This year, we are doing it a little differently - each class will take part in four heats as usual, but two of these will be 'Quick Fire Sprints' (5 laps) and two will be 'Super Sprints' (9 laps). That is over 40km of racing, for bugger all cost!
Entry fee: Adult Classes $50 / KiwiTrucks $30. Spectator entry by gold coin donation.
Be part of an action-packed day of short course racing at everyone's favourite offroad racing track!
This event gets bigger each year with drivers descending on Feilding from across the North Island. Will a local regain the title, or will another out-of-towner take it away in 2025?
One thing is for sure - you've got to be in it to win it!
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Celebrating Mahuru Māori: He wheako reorua o He Tohu and Pipitea walking tour — Mahuru Māori 2025, This Mahuru Māori, join a reorua (bilingual) He Tohu experience and hīkoi around Pipitea to celebrate te reo Māori and the unique hītori (history) of Pipitea. Deepen your understanding about ingoa tūturu (original place names) and the wāhi where He Tohu currently sits.
A reorua | bilingual tour of He Tohu and Pipitea
Join us and embark on a haerenga (journey) together to connect to the ancestors and our shared past. The tour will begin at He Tohu — a permanent exhibition of three iconic constitutional taonga that shape Aotearoa New Zealand.
* 1835 He Whakaputanga o te Rangatiratanga o Nu Tireni — Declaration of Independence of the United Tribes of New Zealand
* 1840 Te Tiriti o Waitangi — Treaty of Waitangi
* 1893 Women’s Suffrage Petition — Te Petihana Whakamana Pōti Wahine.
These taonga are significant because they shaped who we are as a nation and will shape what we become in the future.
"Ka mua, ka muri | Walking backwards into the future"
A hīkoi around Pipitea
After the He Tohu tour, join us on a half-hour bilingual hīkoi (walk) around key sites in Pipitea of cultural significance.
There are slight inclines in places, but we will be walking on the pavement for the tour. If the huarere (weather) is looking inclement, please bring warm clothing, a raincoat, or an umbrella. If the weather is too bad, we will postpone the event, so please register so that we can notify you about the cancellation.
Shared kai
During the kaupapa, knowledge, pātai (questions), and reflections will flow between us. At the end we’ll have kai timotimo (snacks). You are welcome to bring snacks to share.
This event is suitable for all ages. Please meet at our waka reception desk on the ground floor before the tour starts.
Nau mai, haere mai!
Book your spot
Places are limited so email us to book your spot.
Please include your contact details and the number of people in your party.
Email — events.natlib@dia.govt.nz
Celebrate te reo Māori
Reorua (bilingual) speaking kaimahi will host your taenga mai ki te whare, visit. Some will be kaimahi tangata whenua and some will be kaimahi Pākehā, Tauiwi rānei. Like us all, this mahi (work) is for us and our descendants — mō tātou, me ō tātou uri, haere ake nei.
Toi te kupu, toi te mana, toi te reo Māori! | Hold fast to the word, to the mana and to the Māori language!
Image: Kaiārahi leading the hīkoi through Pipitea. Photo by Mark Beatty
label: Community & Culture

description:
Community Evening Trimester 2 2025, About Ignite:
Ignite Consultants is a student-run charitable organisation that provides free and creative advice to charities and social organisations across Aotearoa. All of our consultants are passionate and talented student-volunteers who are driven by their desire to foster social change. Our vision is to help organisations to maximise their impact through harnessing the fresh perspectives of university students. 
We run two project cycles per year which coincide with the university semesters, each lasting for a duration of 9 weeks. Each team consists of a local charity, 5-6 students, a project manager (a person who has been through the Ignite Consultants experience before) and a professional mentor who has experience in consulting and/or the industry the organisation works in. 
About the Event:
Ignite's Community Evening is a special occasion where our consultants share what they have learnt, created and experienced over the past nine weeks. This event is an opportunity to learn about the remarkable charities we have collaborated with this semester, to enjoy delicious food and to extend our heartfelt thanks to all our supporters. 
This semester, attendees will get to hear presentations from the teams who have worked with WELLfed, Take10, Orange Sky, PACE and The Charitable Recycling Trust. 
To join us virtually, please click on the link below:
label: Community & Culture

description:
DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp 2025, Kia ora DEBRA New Zealand whanau !
Save the dates - DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp, Wellington, Friday 22 - Sunday 24 August 2025.
We are very happy to announce that we are planning a get-together for the NZ EB whanau and a few Aussie families in Wellington in August. We really hope you can join us - it will be wonderful to see you!
This event is a great opportunity to meet other families, connect with old friends and make wonderful new ones, learn from each other and from valuable talks about EB issues, and have time to relax and enjoy a couple of days in Wellington city - the creative capital! We're keen to hear about any particular topics you would like to hear about.
Everyone is welcome including extended family and friends, caregivers, and healthcare professionals.
Dates: Friday 22nd August (check-in from 3pm with informal meet and greet from 5.00pm), to Sunday 24th August (finishing 2pm after a farewell lunch)
Event location: Wellington City, venue to be confirmed
Registration will be launched in early May - please stay tuned for further details!
Your registration fee will cover the conference, meals and children’s activities from Friday evening to Sunday lunch time, but it does not cover accommodation (amount to be confirmed), travel or airport transfers.
DEBRA NZ will provide some limited assistance with accommodation and travel costs if needed, subsiding flights for the person attending with EB.
Please contact debra@debra.org.nz if you would like to apply for this support.
There will be more information soon.
We need an idea of numbers so please get in touch as soon as possible!
Email: debra@debra.org.nz with any questions and let us know if you are interested in attending.
Nga mihi nui,
Anna, Lea and the DEBRA NZ team
debra@debra.org.nz
label: Community & Culture

description:
Creative Futures: Arts, Economy and System Shifts, Join celebrated artist and cultural leader Teremoana Rapley MNZM for a powerful wānanga exploring the role of creativity in shaping local economies and systems. From local identity and wellbeing to economic growth and policy influence, this workshop invites artists, community leaders, and changemakers to reimagine the power of the arts in our region.
Through kōrero and shared storytelling, we’ll unpack how artistic practice can drive systems change and strengthen Lower Hutt's inclusive, culturally rich creative economy, one that reflects indigenous and local voices of communities across Te Awa Kairangi.
Teremoana Rapley MNZM is a pioneering artist, broadcaster, and cultural leader whose work spans music, television, and indigenous creative advocacy. Of Kiribati, Rarotonga, Aitutaki, Mangaia, Cuba, Jamaica, and Suriname descent, she first rose to prominence with Upper Hutt Posse and Moana & the Moahunters. Her practice is rooted in indigenous storytelling, systems change, and mentoring, often acting as a “Matriarchitect” to uplift others. With accolades including the Pacific Music Awards Lifetime Achievement Award and induction into the Aotearoa Music Hall of Fame, Rapley continues to shape Aotearoa’s creative landscape through collaboration, education, and community engagement.
In partnership with Toi Rauwhārangi College of Creative Arts, Massey University.
Light refreshments provided.
label: Community & Culture

description:
DRAG BINGO with Felicity Frockaccino! @DLS, Darling, This is not your grandma's Bingo! the original bingo b*tch is back! FELICITY 'THE FROCK' FROCKACCINO
Brace yourself for an evening dripping with glamour, sparkle, and a whole lot of cheek as you soak in the skyline of Wellington's most unique rooftop hideaway
DIRTY LITTLE SECRET!
Slip into something fabulous, grab your favorite drink, and get ready for an extravagant night of DRAG BINGO! We've got cocktails that'll make you blush, and more laughs than you can shake a feather boa at!
Expect live drag performances to make your heart race, dad jokes that'll have you in stitches, and beats from our fabulous local DJs that'll keep you moving all night long! Book your table for 7.00pm, balls dropping 7.30 at the latest!
Event Highlights:
Hold onto your wigs, honey, because it's FREE to enter! And we have well over $200 worth of PRIZES to be won! including our grand prize... $100.00 BAR VOUCHER! odds not in your favour? we have SPOT PRIZES up for grabs!

description:
Echoes of Home - A Musical Journey Across Time, (Ticket Required)
Tuesday , 2 September 2025
Doors open: 4:30 PM | Performance begins: 5:15 PM sharp
Hunter Council Chamber, Hunter Building, Kelburn Parade, Wellington
Free Entry | All Welcome
In celebration of 80 years of Vietnam’s National Day (2/9), join us for a powerful evening of music, memory, and connection.
Through traditional and contemporary Vietnamese songs, Echoes of Home takes you on a heartfelt journey — honouring the past, embracing the present, and looking to the future. Performed by a diverse group of community members, this special event celebrates identity, culture, and the spirit of resilience.
What to expect:
• A beautifully curated musical programme honouring Vietnam’s story
• Performances of folk and modern Vietnamese music
• Dance, piano, harp, pipa, guitar, and more
• Multilingual storytelling to connect all audiences
• A welcoming, cross-cultural experience for all backgrounds
Please note: Doors close at 5:15 PM for the stage programme. No entry will be permitted during performances.
With thanks to our generous supporters:

description:
FRISKY FORBIDDEN FOREST, FRISKY FORBIDDEN FOREST
FRISKY is celebrating HALLOWEEN a week early this October 18th! Join us for FRISKY FORBIDDEN FOREST - a magical dance party deep in the woods.

Enter the FRISKY FORBIDDEN FOREST, where the magical world comes alive after dark. This dance party invites all creatures to enter the forbidden forest and lose themselves in a night of spellbinding beats and untamed revelry.

THEME & DRESS CODE: “HALLOWEEN” ✨ Magical, Mysterious, and a Little Bit Mischievous ✨
Costumes are mandatory.

DJS: DJ Jimmy Fade (Wellington), DJ Harry K (Brisbane), DJ James Johnson (Auckland)

COAT CHECK: $5 (Please bring your own bag for loose items)

FRISKY Parties are queer, genderqueer, trans & non-binary friendly parties where all are welcome to join in the fun.

Follow us on social media for updates: @djjimmyfade, @wellington_partyboys and @friskyeventsnz

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents ROCHELLE (2024) + BELLBIRD (2019), Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019) – Double Feature | Wairarapa Cinematheque
✨ Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.
🎥 Rochelle (2024)
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.
🎥 Bellbird (2019)
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.
📅 Date & Time: Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm
📍 Location: Regent 3 Cinemas, Masterton
Tickets:
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night, you’re covered — just show your card at the door.
Single tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.
label: Film & Media

description:
Fareham Journey Free Cohousing Information & Tour, Fareham Journey is building a sustainable cohousing community in Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston and they are looking for people who share their kaupapa to create this with us. The Fareham property has extensive grounds which includes a historic home, and established organic gardens, an orchard, and fields. It even has an arts community on site.

We run these free cohousing information and tour events on the third Sunday of every month, from noon until 2pm at Fareham, 80 Underhill Road, Pae Tū Mōkai, Featherston in the South Wairarapa.

Learn about the Fareham Journey and our vision to create a sustainable and supportive community and how you can get involved. We invite you to bring a plate of vegetarian food to join us for a shared meal in the historic homestead, Fareham House, followed by the tour.

Ensure you RSVP to attend at https://farehamjourney.nz/rsvp/
label: Community & Culture

description:
Gordo And Teej Present: Craigslist, Craigslist are a party, record label and DJ outfit operated by Colter Carson (Public Possession) and Raffeal Hamblett. Since humble beginnings in 2020, the project aims to create shared moments of joy with an aesthetic centred on obscure records. The success of this manifesto is reflected in the consistently positive response gained from partygoers and label supporters alike, year after year.⁣
⁣
In the DJ booth, Colter and Raffy (Craigslist Soundsystem) strike a delicate balance between eclecticism and danceability that denotes a deep understanding of musical traditions and club culture. Defying the confines of genre and era, the pair bring a refreshing and joyous sound to the dancefloor.⁣

Gordo & Teej are proud to present iconic Ōtautahi due Craigslist, after dancing to these guys all summer at Flux, Smash Palace, Electric Ave and Two Minds festivals we just had to fly 'em up to show the Pōneke whānau how these guys get the dance floor cranking. Expect nothing less than the finest Italo disco grooves, chunky house beats and uptempo club music to transport you to a sun soaked festival light years away from the welly winter.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival: Gallows Tour, Crime, Justice, and the Final Walk.
Delve into the complex history of capital punishment in Wellington with this thought-provoking tour through Karori Cemetery. Gallows shines a light on the people behind the process. Discover their roles in shaping justice, the cases that defined their careers, and the human stories behind a system of ultimate consequence.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions.
While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Fluid Art Workshop, Fluid Art Workshop
Spend an evening unwinding with paint, good food, and good company. This beginner-friendly class is designed for everyone—you don’t need to be an artist to enjoy it. All the materials will be ready for you, and you’ll get to explore blacklight-reactive and glow-in-the-dark paints, experimenting with marble and swirl effects to create something completely your own.
Since the paint takes a few days to fully dry, your artwork will stay safely with us—you’ll be able to come back on Sunday to pick it up.
It can get a bit messy, so come in clothes you don’t mind getting paint on, and tie your hair back if it’s long.
After the painting, relax over a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, the perfect way to finish a creative and relaxed night.
Meet your host, Alannah
Alannah has been fascinated by blacklight art since she was 15 and has been exploring different mediums to find what really stands out for 20 years. She takes inspiration from all the wonderful artists she encounters in the real world and online. She noticed that this particular type of fluid art hadn't really been done the way she does it, so she has developed her own unique style utilising blacklight reactive and glow-in-the-dark paints. Let her colour your world and explore the possibilities of fluid art together.
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.
...............................................................................................
Bhakti Lounge
1/175 Vivian Street
Wellington

description:
Father's Day Quiz, Put your general knowledge to the test while supporting a great cause at the Father's Day Quiz!
Join us for a belated celebration of the fathers and father figures in our lives. We welcome everyone to join us, including students and mothers, so make sure to get everyone a ticket.
Date: Monday 8 September
Time: 6:30pm-9pm
Cost: $25 per person, which includes a pizza dinner and a drink
Please bring gold coins for some exciting games to be played throughout the evening.
This event is part of the 2025 Middle School Challenge fundraiser for Blind Low Vision NZ. Our Middle School Leaders have the unique opportunity to sponsor the development and training of a Guide Dog named Cooper, which costs about $25,000. Your generous donations are greatly appreciated and make a significant difference. Once Cooper is fully trained, he will be placed with a visually impaired person for the rest of his working life. We believe that as the Scots Community bands together, your support can change a life.
To learn more or to make a donation, visit our Givealittle page.

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival: Our Fair Ladies (April 2025), Our Fair Ladies Tour
Embark on a captivating journey through the history buried in Karori Cemetery with our tour showcasing the remarkable lives of Wellington's women.
This tour offers a unique opportunity to celebrate the resilience, creativity and empowerment of women at a time when a woman couldn't have a bank account in her own name.  You'll hear the stories of women who had a range of interesting occupations. 
Be inspired by the incredible impact of these women's lives in early Wellington.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page.

Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
We will meet before the tour at the Shelter (listed as Historic chapel on the map)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026), Come and hear stories of those who met sad, shocking and untimely ends. This tour traverses some of the older parts of the story where historic headstones mark the stories of lives lost too soon: accidents, murder, misadventure and those who fell by their own hand.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.

description:
From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday, From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday
Marking 250 years since Austen’s birth this romp through her irreverent Juvenilia is spliced with deliciously pompous gems from Aotearoa’s earliest newspapers.

From the drawing rooms of Georgian England to the dusty streets of Victorian Wellington – the pretensions of polite society never change.

To mark 250 years since the birth of Jane Austen, her wildly funny Juvenilia is brought to life, including The Beautifull Cassandra, The History of England, Love and Friendship – and more.

Between Austen’s sharpest barbs you’ll hear genuine gems from New Zealand’s early newspapers, courtesy of Papers Past: gossip, pomposity, early etiquette advice, and scandalous society mishaps.

The result? A sparkling, one hour romp proving that the absurdities of status, marriage and manners travel across oceans, continents and centuries.

Performed as a series of readings with lightning character swaps, sly narration, and just a hint of scandal, this is Austen as you’ve never heard her: young, bold, and perfectly at home in 19th century Wellington!


Booking is REQUIRED.
Cost: $25
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/from-pemberley-to-pipitea-celebrating-jane-austens-250th-birthday/


Health & Safety
Please contact the event host for health & safety information.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever (Wellington Heritage Festival), Georgina Beyer – Diamonds are Forever (Wellington Heritage Festival)
STARTS: 1pm, SUNDAY 2 NOV

In 2004, Georgina Beyer, the first openly transgender Member of Parliament in the world, famously confronted members of Destiny Church during the Enough Is Enough rally on the grounds of Parliament.

Never a bystander, Georgina faced down the bigots, telling them straight, “Your hatred is totally intolerable!” This was just one of many significant moments that shaped the life of the extraordinary Georgina Beyer.

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 2 November 2025

Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street

Ends: Vivian Street

Duration: 90 minutes

Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register here: https://walktoursnz.wordpress.com/book/

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

This tour is part of the amazing Wellington Heritage Festival - https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz
label: Community & Culture

description:
Futuna Lecture Series 2025: Francis Kéré, The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years. It is the Futuna Chapel Trust’s major fundraiser each year and attracts a large audience of architects, architectural designers, technicians, architecture and design students and interested members of the public. The Trust exists solely on koha/donations as well as financial support from selected sponsors and donors.
Our sponsors, Dulux NZ, APL, Plytech, Warren Trust and the Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington NZIA branches have continued their support for the Futuna Lecture Series 2025.
This year the Trust welcomes three new sponsors being Roofing Industries Limited, AGP and Big River Panels. The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust. Please register using the ticket types of $10, $15, $25 or $30 GST inclusive. Booking fees are in addition to the ticket prices.
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when purchasing Architect tickets

Born in Wellington, Georgina went on to have an unprecedented local, national and international impact through her commitment to equality and her desire to give everyone the opportunity to reach their full potential in society.

Join us for this special 90-minute walking tour as we pay tribute to the late Georgina (1957–2023) by visiting locations around central Wellington that shaped her journey. Along the way, we’ll honour some of her heroes and listen to first-hand archival audio clips that showcase her humour and resilience.

Georgina’s story is defiantly optimistic – confronting hardship and using her lived experience to change the world for the better.

Time/Date: 1pm, Sunday 2 November 2025

Starts: meet outside St Peters Church, 211 Willis Street

Ends: Vivian Street

Duration: 90 minutes

Cost / Bookings: the tour is free but you do need to register here: https://walktoursnz.wordpress.com/book/

Accessibility information: the tour is on flat public footpaths. Tours are limited to approximately 20 walkers.

Image courtesy of the amazing Kym Strathdee

This tour is part of the amazing Wellington Heritage Festival - https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz
label: Community & Culture

description:
From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday, From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday
Marking 250 years since Austen’s birth this romp through her irreverent Juvenilia is spliced with deliciously pompous gems from Aotearoa’s earliest newspapers.

From the drawing rooms of Georgian England to the dusty streets of Victorian Wellington – the pretensions of polite society never change.

To mark 250 years since the birth of Jane Austen, her wildly funny Juvenilia is brought to life, including The Beautifull Cassandra, The History of England, Love and Friendship – and more.

Between Austen’s sharpest barbs you’ll hear genuine gems from New Zealand’s early newspapers, courtesy of Papers Past: gossip, pomposity, early etiquette advice, and scandalous society mishaps.

The result? A sparkling, one hour romp proving that the absurdities of status, marriage and manners travel across oceans, continents and centuries.

Performed as a series of readings with lightning character swaps, sly narration, and just a hint of scandal, this is Austen as you’ve never heard her: young, bold, and perfectly at home in 19th century Wellington!


Booking is REQUIRED.
Cost: $25
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/from-pemberley-to-pipitea-celebrating-jane-austens-250th-birthday/


Health & Safety
Please contact the event host for health & safety information.
