description:
Carterton Daffodil Festival 2025, Carterton Daffodil Festival 2025
The Carterton Daffodil Festival is back for 2025!

Iconic daffodil field | Heritage train | High Street markets | Street performers | WAI ART SHOW | Library crafts + MORE... Here's a snippet of what's in store:

Your Daffodil Flyer experience (that's the train between Carterton to Masterton) has been revamped with new one-way options! Book you seat now: https://steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/daffodil-festival-flyer/

Wander through the golden daffodils at Middle Run. Access is by free bus only – no private vehicles permitted. Pick-your-own, bunches are $5 with proceeds going to Plunket and Wellington Free Ambulance.

Enjoy music, dance, and live acts throughout the day. From main stage performances to roving entertainers, there’s something for the whole whānau.

Visit the Wai Art Show at the Events Centre and browse a wide variety of art by talented local artists. A must-see stop for art lovers and collectors.

This year, the Carterton Library will be open with simple crafts for kids, a display from the Wairarapa Herb Society, and a free talk from Aratoi about our collaborative POP-UP museum.

Te Wiki o Te Reo Māori also begins on September 14 - to celebrate we invite you to come in and browse our Māori Collection and pick up a flyer – listing 50 of our resources to help you on your te reo journey.

We can't wait to see you at one of Carterton's biggest and brightest days of the year!

Big thanks to our event sponsors; Carterton District Council, Stuff Wairarapa Times-Age, and TSC Traffic Management.

Dancesplash 2025, ArtSplash is a week-long festival, held every two years, that celebrates tāmariki and rangatahi experiencing performance on the big stage in dance and choir concerts. This year, we have two separate groups performing – one at ArtSplash and the other at DanceSplash.
Mrs Long and Mr Graff have a hard-working troupe of dancers training to perform on Thursday 28 August at the 5pm show, held at the Opera House.
This is a new venue for the show, what a treat! This group will be heading into town by 8:15am for the dress rehearsal, before returning to school to catch their breath. They’ll head back in together on the bus and will be ready to head home with their spectator parents at the conclusion of the show. Watch this space for more details and how you can help.
Tickets are now on sale. You can purchase them via the Ticketmaster website. NOTE: Due to limited seating and a high number of schools involved, there is a limit of TWO tickets per performer. Don’t miss out!

description:
Day of the Dead Celebration - Dia de los Muertos, Join Claudio for this special occasion we will be celebrating one of the most important holidays in Mexico, the day of the dead or “Dia de los Muertos”.

The Day of the Dead is one of the traditions that has remained alive throughout the centuries; the main holidays are November 1 & 2, which UNESCO designated and cataloged as an Intangible Heritage of Humanity in 2003.

This special celebration dates back to prehispanic times before the arrival of Europeans to America, and has been alive and widely celebrated over the years.

Expect:

Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.

An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.

History of the day of the dead celebration.

Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.

Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).

Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged)

Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones

Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot

Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments

Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

description:
GARDEN RAVE, ⚫⛓️ The Garage x Jungle Juice: Wellington ⛓️⚫
Two worlds, one night.
Born in Auckland, The Garage has become one of the most recognised names in the local techno scene, creating parties that blend high-level production with an authentic underground sound.
In Wellington, Jungle Juice has built a vibrant community where everyone feels like family, connected through music, colour and the energy of every gathering.
Now, both forces come together to bring you a truly unique experience.
📍Location: The Garden Hotel, 63 Courtenay Place, Wellington
On the dancefloor, feel dark, driving beats and unstoppable energy. In the garden zone, enjoy a vibrant and glowing atmosphere filled with colour, lights and nature.
🎧The Lineup (A-Z)
ANDRETG
DJ BY ACCIDENT
MALWARE
VNESS
The Garage and Jungle Juice unite to deliver an unforgettable techno celebration in the heart of the capital. Secure your ticket now on Humanitix and be part of this special night.
⛓️🖤
*** Important Information ***
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.

description:
FRUIT LOOP FESTIVAL, Fruit Loop Festival
Marlborough’s freshest music festival!
About the Festival
Fruit Loop Festival is Marlborough’s juiciest new summer gig! A full-blown celebration of music and dance, kicking off under the sun and well into the night. Think open-air energy - blending Marlborough's summer magic with a full-scale music festival. An insane line-up of DJs and live performers with production to match! From the first drop to the final track, it's where the beat hits harder and the drinks taste sweeter.
Fresh, wild, fierce - Fruit Loop is the party Marlborough has been waiting for.
The Line-Up
DICK JOHNSON: The heart of NZ’s electronic scene, Dick Johnson is a true house music heavyweight. With remixes for global icons like Fatboy Slim and Claude VonStroke, plus Kiwi favourites L.A.B and Tiki Taane, he’s spent over two decades electrifying dancefloors worldwide. A relentless force behind the decks - and music director for Synthony - Dick brings the fire every time.
SIN: Co-host of George FM Drive, Sin is plugged into the pulse of the dance scene and has quickly become a revered authority on all things electronica. She’s torn up stages at Rhythm & Vines, Homegrown, Hidden Valley, and international festivals from Fiji to the UK. With supports for legends like Fatboy Slim, Groove Armada, and Netsky, Sin brings high-energy house, techno, and ravey curveballs to every set.
KITA MEAN: Kita Mean is New Zealand’s award-winning drag superstar, known for her infectious charm, razor-sharp wit, and high-camp aesthetic. With a career spanning 15+ years across stages and screens worldwide, she’s wowed audiences from Aotearoa and Australia to London, Canada, the USA, and beyond. Winner of the very first RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under and co-owner of the iconic Caluzzi Cabaret, Kita continues to dazzle with colourful looks, flawless mug, and hilarious timing. Quirky, kooky, kitsch, and quick - Kita Mean isn’t just a queen, she’s an experience.
PETE GREEN: Originally from the UK, Pete is part of the vinyl-digging collective Rare Specimens. His love for deep, worldly electronic sounds brings low-end warmth and an infectious energy to the dancefloor. Along the way, he’s supported artists such as Crazy P, Psychemagik, Audio Jack, and Christopher Tubbs, playing festivals and parties from Creamfields and Rhythm & Alps to Tempo Schmempo. Expect a set seasoned with Italo, ambient, and deep house flavours, dusted with disco, and finished with a splash of techno.
Event Details
Date: Saturday 28 March 2026
Time: 2pm - 10pm
Location: The Fancy Cow, Marlborough
R18 event - Photo identification will be required.
Return Bus Service:
Getting to and from the festival is easy with our return bus service. Pick-up points will include Redwoodtown Woolworths, Seymour Square, and Countdown Springlands. Purchase a return bus ticket when you nab your ticket.
A full timetable and bus information will be announced closer to the event.
Parking is strictly limited at the festival. Drop off recommended.
Tickets
Tickets are limited — don’t wait. Secure yours now!
Door sales may be available.
Have your ticket open and ready to be scanned at the gate.
Kaupapa
Fruit Loop is a safe, inclusive space where everyone belongs. If you can’t celebrate diversity, respect others, and bring good vibes, this festival isn’t for you.
Harassment or discrimination of any kind will not be tolerated. Anyone behaving this way will be removed.
Refunds and Cancellations
Fruit Loop Festival is a rain or shine event. The festival will proceed regardless of weather conditions, except in circumstances where safety is compromised or conditions make it impossible for the event to continue.
No refunds will be given for changes to the programme, line-up, or advertised performers.
Stay Connected
Follow us for line-up drops, updates and key event information: @fruitloopfestival on Instagram
label: Festivals

Sunday Jazz - Julien Wilson, The Rogue's regular Sunday afternoon jazz. Funky, jazzy, soulful jazz. Beer, hangs, and jazz, on a Sunday, perfect!

This week featuring Australian saxophonist Julien Wilson

Get ready for an unforgettable outing of jazz as Australian saxophonist Julien Wilson teams up with Wellington’s own jazz drummer Mark Lockett for a special trio performance at The Rogue.

Having collaborated for many years, both locally in Australia and on international tours, Julien and Mark bring a wealth of experience and a deep musical connection to the stage.

Joining them is talented and melodic Wellington mainstay bassist Seth Boy.

Don’t miss this dynamic collaboration that promises to deliver a vibrant and captivating musical experience!

Music from 5pm, FREE ENTRY

description:
Grompage 25', Grompage 25'
Get Lost Cycling are excited to announce the 3rd edition of GROMPAGE™, Wellington's premier mountain bike movie festival 🔥 An opportunity to showcase some of NZ's up-and-coming talent, both in front of and behind the lens!

Entry is free and the opportunity to walk away with glory is priceless. An independent jury will be awarding prizes for "best riding" and "most creative edit" and we'll be running a "people's choice" award as well. Prizes will be announced on the night 🎁

Everyone is welcome to come and watch on the night, doors will be open from 6.15pm and movies will be showing from 6.30. All winners will be announced on the night.

Can't make it on the night? Don't worry, all movies will be available to watch online the following week

description:
Heritage Festival - Self-guided Tour of Truby King Park, Discover the hidden history of Truby King Park—scan, stroll, and uncover stories with your smartphone.

Step into a garden full of stories, some inspiring, some surprising. From cherry trees and hospital wards to the people who shaped New Zealand’s early healthcare, follow the QR trail to uncover the layers of Truby King Park’s past.

Health & Safety
This is a self-guided experience. Please explore within your limits. Wear good shoes and dress for the weather.

Parts of the park may be cordoned off for your safety. Please respect the cordons. Paths and steps may be slippery when wet.

Any time during the festival
18 Oct - 9 Nov 2025
Daily, dawn til dusk
Free

The world’s biggest family-friendly rave just got haunted… and Wellington, we’re coming for YOU! 👻

This is not your average Halloween party – it’s a full-blown Halloween rave for the whole family, packed with banging beats, dazzling performers, and spooky surprises at every turn. Whether you’re a mini-monster or a grown-up ghoul, get ready for an afternoon of music, mayhem, and memories you’ll never forget. Costumes are highly encouraged – the more outrageous, the better!

Date & Time: Saturday 15th November, 1PM – 4PM
Location The Hunter Lounge

🎟 Tickets
First Release - SOLD OUT!
Second Release - ON SALE NOW

👉 https://megatix.com.au/events/FGDWELL25


👻 WHAT TO EXPECT:

🧛‍♀️ All-Ages Family Rave – Dress to impress in your spookiest costumes for maximum Halloween fun!

🏢 Prime City Venue – The Hunter Lounge is easy to get to with great parking and public transport links.

🎶 Club DJs & Performers – International DJs dropping trance, techno & nostalgic bangers, plus stilt walkers, jugglers, and spine-tingling roaming performers!

⚡ Spots are limited – secure your tickets before they vanish into the night! ⚡

You’ll receive expert guidance in cake decorating techniques and leave with your own delicious 6-inch round cake (serving 8).
Enjoy complimentary drinks and tasty nibbles as you create your masterpiece.

Where: Ten O’clock Cookie Bakery & Cafe

Spaces are limited to just 20 attendees, so don’t miss out!

description:
Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025, Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025
The Annual Hutt Valley Diwali, organised by the Wellington Punjabi Sports and Cultural Club Inc. (WPSCC Inc.), is a vibrant, family-friendly celebration of light, culture, and community. Held each year in the heart of the Hutt Valley, this non-profit event brings together people of all ages and backgrounds to enjoy the rich traditions of Diwali.

The festival features a colourful mix of cultural performances, traditional and modern music and dance, delicious food, local art and craft stalls, and engaging activities for children and families. It offers a unique opportunity to experience the diverse cultures that make up our region while celebrating the universal values of light over darkness, hope, and togetherness.

WPSCC Inc. proudly hosts this event to promote unity, cultural understanding, and community spirit in the Hutt Valley and beyond.
label: Festivals

description:
Greytown Through the Ages, Greytown Through the Ages
DATE: All Weekend
LOCATION: various retail shops & eateries in Greytown Main St.
AGES: All
COST: Free
Step back in time with Greytown Through the Ages, a unique, immersive event where visitors can explore the town’s rich history simply by strolling along its charming Main Street and local shops. Participating businesses throughout Greytown will display historical photographs — some dating back as far as the 1850s.

Wander into cafés, boutiques and eateries to discover black-and-white snapshots of rarely seen archival images showing what Greytown once looked like. From dusty horse-drawn streets to early main street storefronts of eras gone by, each location offers a different window into the past.

Many photographs will be matched with the current buildings so visitors can compare then and now, sparking conversations and nostalgia and soak in the legacy of one of New Zealand’s most historic towns.

www.greytownarttown.com
label: Festivals

description:

Time to celebrate the festival with our furry friends!
Pack up a picnic with your whānau and join us at the Puppy Pride Dog Show!

At 1pm on Sunday 26th October bring along your furry friend in their best rainbow or fancy dress to Campbell Park Playground to have a paws-itively wonderful afternoon!

Bring a koha to enter your pup, with prizes from the wonderful Animates Paraparaumu to be won!

Come and join us and give our pups a round of a-paws!

description:
Hutt Japan Day 2025, Hutt Japan Day 2025
Hutt Japan Day is back!
Join us for a vibrant celebration of Japanese culture at the Hutt Japan Day festival, held at the Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & Dowse Art Gallery on Sunday, 9 November.

Celebrating 30 Years of Friendship
This year's event is extra special, marking 30 years of partnership with Minoh City, our sister city in Osaka, Japan. The festival is organised by the Hutt Minoh House Friendship Trust, with support from the Hutt City Council and the Embassy of Japan.

What’s on offer?
• Be captivated by an array of Japanese performances and demonstrations
• Engage in hands-on activities and workshops
• Immerse yourself in the exhilarating rhythms of taiko drumming
• Indulge in delectable Japanese cuisine from one of our food vendors/stalls
• Explore our market area for unique Japanese treasures

Get Involved!
To participate in this special celebration as a performer, artist, cultural group, demonstration, market or food vendor, please visit our website for more details and registration forms: https://www.huttminoh.org.nz/participate-in-hutt-japan-day-2025

Save the Date - Sunday, 9 November 2025
Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & The Dowse Art Museum

We look forward to celebrating the richness of Japanese culture with you!
label: Festivals

description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026, Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

description:
Heritage of Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush – The Gardens and Gardeners, Ancient native forest and botanic garden excellence — uncover the unique history of Ōtari-Wilton's Bush on this engaging tour for the Wellington Heritage Festival. Join us and explore!

From forest to farm to internationally acclaimed native botanic garden - let us walk you through the fascinating story of Ōtari-Wilton's Bush. Learn about the visionary people involved. Join us to hear the rich history of this special garden while enjoying the beautiful surroundings.

Meet at Tāne Whakapiripiri Ōtari Visitor Centre. Most walking is on gentle paths, some slightly steeper trails are optional.

Photo credit: Wellington City Council Archives, 00291-5801-7

description:
Its in the Ballot-GWRC-Te Upoko o te Ika a Māui Māori Constituency Instudio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

description:
Alex Trask Presents | Coltrane's Soprano, Alex Trask presents a special tribute to John Coltrane, performing tunes that he played on soprano saxophone. ‘Coltrane’s soprano has been hugely influential to me as an alto player and musician. His sound on the instrument is so unique and special, it’s been a touchstone for me for years. I remember being absolutely captivated by his playing on the untitled originals when Both Directions at Once came out, when I was still a beginner player. My Favourite Things is one of my most loved albums, and Everytime We Say Goodbye from that record is some of my favourite saxophone playing ever.’

The band will play classics such as My Favourite Things and Greensleeves, as well as tunes from the albums Both Directions at Once, Duke Ellington & John Coltrane, and Impressions.

Personnel:
Alex Trask – soprano saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
Rick Cranson – drums

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
NZ Brewers Fest, NZ Brewers Fest is moving to April!
Lining up with Fresh Hop season, we will be bringing the all the incredible beers, outstanding entertainment and delicious kai you expect, with a fresh hop twist!
Save the date and watch this space for more info, coming soon!

TICKETS ON SALE SOON!

Drinks!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!
Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!
New for this year! Step into our cocktail bar for some seriously scrumptious spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some delicious drops just for you.
We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.
Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy every craving.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

Entertainment!

Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling.
Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint.

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
label: Festivals

description:
NZ Drum & Dance Camp, NZ Drum & Dance Camp
Join us this 24th to 27th October for a West African musical immersion at our annual NZ Drum Dance Camp.

Set amidst 38 acres of native bushland just a short drive from Wellington, this weekend is a celebration of unity, rhythm, and the soul-stirring power of African drum and dance, curated for the NZ African drumming community.

We are excited to announce that Epizo Bangoura will be back to join us again in 2025!

Epizo Bangoura is a celebrated master musician from Guinea, West Africa, known for his extraordinary versatility on the Kora (African harp), Balafon (African tuned percussion), and Djembe/Duns.

Epizo will be joined by Ghanaian Master Drummer Yaw Asumadu and special guest Jimi Dale.

Camp Highlights:

♪ Djembe and Dunun Workshops: Suitable for all skill levels, from enthusiastic beginners to advanced drummers, guided by our awesome team of teachers.
♪ Traditional Dance: with the effervescent Epizo Bangoura.
♪ Group Jams and Musical Sessions: Strengthen communal bonds through captivating group jams and impromptu musical sessions.
♪ Tranquil Setting: Enjoy the native bushland environ - build mind, body and spirit whilst enhancing our weekend of music and togetherness.
♪ Catering – Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included on Saturday and Sunday, as well as breakfast Monday. Please bring a shared (pre-prepared) plate for Friday evening kai.

Featured Instructors:

Epizo Bangoura: A master of the djembe and traditional dance, Epizo brings profound knowledge and vibrant energy, embodying the essence of West African music and dance.

Yaw Asumadu: A Master Drummer from Ghana, Yaw has performed globally and taught African drumming for 25 years, collaborating with legendary artists.

Jimi Dale: A pioneer of African music in NZ, Jimi has been teaching African Drum and Dance classes since 1995 and formed the world music and dance group, Tamani. We are excited to have Jimi back again teaching us a dun dance piece.

Pricing Details:
♪ Early Bird: $450 (Reserve by Sunday 31st August 2025)
♪ Adult rate: $495
♪ Kids 9 – 14 years old: $250
♪ Kids 8 and under: $175
♪ Family Packages available on request
♪ Single Day & night $220 (includes 3 meals and full day tuition)
♪ Drum Hire: $15

Event Schedule Snapshot:
♪ Friday, 24th October: Arrive from 4pm - A warm welcome sets the stage for a weekend filled with rhythm and learning.
Bring a share plate for dinner.
♪ Saturday, 25th October: Engage in enriching drum and dance workshops. Participants will be grouped into their appropriate levels.
♪ Sunday, 26th October: Continue your musical journey with drum and dance sessions, leading to a group performance that encapsulates the weekend’s shared experiences.
♪ Monday, 27th October: Morning All in Drum & Dance ceremony, then it's time to hit the road.

FAQs
♪ Getting Ready: Bring your drum (if available), snacks for the weekend, dance-appropriate shoes, sleeping gear (pillowcase & sheet, sleeping bag/ doona), warm clothes, and an eager spirit.
♪ Beginners are warmly welcomed – our camp is a nurturing space for newcomers to discover the joy of African drumming and dance, bolstered by a supportive community.

For more information and tickets -
https://africandrumming.co.nz/tours-and-retreats/nz-drum-dance-camp/

More questions?
Contact - Tulletha at or call: 028 474 1123

description:
NZ Mountain Film Festival 2025 - Award Night, A collection of New Zealand-made mountain films - brought to you by the Vic Uni Tramping Club, Wellington Tramping and Mountaineering Club, and of course the New Zealand Mountain Film and Book Festival!


Footprints on Katmai (22 mins) Max Romey, USA. Following his grandmother's footsteps to one
of the most remote and bear-strewn beaches in Alaska, painter Max Romey discovers that an
ocean of problems is closer to home than he could have imagined. BEST FILM ON THE ENVIRONMENT
Alone Across Gola (20 mins) Jude Kriwald, UK, NZ Premiere. Stranded in Liberia’s Gola
rainforest, filmmaker Jude Kriwald faces hunger, isolation, robbery and disappearing trails. A raw
tale of one man’s solo, self-filmed journey chasing a childhood dream. With only a bike and a
tent, Jude pushes the limits of survival and self-discovery. BEST ADVENTUROUS SPORTS & LIFESTYLES
Zahir (36 mins) Julien Nadiras, Switzerland, subtitles. Katherine and Eline take on an iconic rock
route, accessing it by bike. Their all-eco ascent tests endurance, nerve, and friendship, with long
runouts and tiny holds pushing them to the edge.
Body of a Line (10 mins) Henna Taylor, subtitles, USA. A cleverly animated short film that
morphs into real life as Madaleine undertakes an intimate and creative journey to climb a difficult
rock route, with original music and poetry. BEST SHORT FILM
Trango (46 mins) Leo Hoorn, USA. After a two-year attempt, ski mountaineers ski the first
descent of the Great Trango Glacier. They navigate risk, grapple with grief, and face physical
danger as they push the limits of human experience. Unspoken trust and support within their
expedition team allows them to face the unimaginable together. GRAND PRIZE FILM


Total running time: 120 minutes + 15 minute intermission.
label: Festivals

description:
Oktoberfest at Heyday, Oktoberfest at Heyday
Join us at Heyday for Oktoberfest on 20th September for a day filled with German brews and entertainment

About this Event

Guten Tag! Grab your lederhosen and join us at Heyday Beer Co to celebrate Oktoberfest in style!

Oktoberfest is back at Heyday and bigger than ever! This year we're going all out with German beers, great food, live music from The Steinbenders, and an unbeatable atmosphere.

Early bird tickets are on sale now for $30 and include your very own Heyday branded stein to use throughout the day plus your first fill!

Where Heyday Beer Co

description:
Oktoberfest, Celebrate Oktoberfest in true Bavarian style at Copthorne Hotel & Resort Solway Park in Masterton on Saturday, 11 October 2025, from 6:00 PM. Enjoy an evening of lively music from The Steinbenders, who will bring the authentic sounds of Oktoberfest to life.
Eventfinda

Don your best lederhosen or dirndl and join us for a festive night filled with traditional German fare, steins of beer, and dancing. Whether you're a seasoned Oktoberfest enthusiast or new to the celebration, this event promises fun for all.

Don't miss out on this unforgettable night of music, merriment, and German hospitality. Gather your friends and secure your tickets early for a night to remember!

$68pp

description:
Newtown Festival 2026, Rātapu, Tuawaru o Poutū-te-rangi
Waiata | Kai | Ahurea | Mahi Toi
Aotearoa’s biggest and best free music festival and street fair returns for its 32nd year! A shining calendar highlight, Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most colourful suburb invites everyone to come along to their favourite street party. From dawn to dusk, the streets are packed with people of all ages, stages, backgrounds, cultures, locals, visitors, whānau and friends. The beloved Newtown Festival brings you more than 420 stalls, 200 artists, 1000 performers, 16 stages, and heaps of activities for the whole whānau. Join us in a celebration with a mass concentration and extravaganza of local cultural identity, creative expression, and a day of community togetherness and joy.
label: Festivals

description:
Playcentre Open Week, If you have tamariki aged 0-6, you’re invited to your local centre during Playcentre Open Week to experience early childhood education with a difference.

Come along for a free visit and support your tamariki to learn through play, while you meet
other whānau in your community. From sand and water play, arts and music, to outdoor and messy play, there will be a range of resources and experiences on offer.

With over 400 centres across Aotearoa there is one near you. You get three free visits before enrolling, so why not try a few centres in your community to see what suits you.

To make a booking at Kelburn Playcentre please email kelburn@playcentre.org.nz
label: Family Friendly

description:
Intro to Self Defence Workshop, Our Intro to Self Defence workshop is designed for anyone who wants to learn effective defensive skills and escapes from grabs and holds.
Our Intro to Self Defence workshop is designed for anyone who wants to learn effective escapes from grabs and holds as well as simple self defence skills that could save your life.
We encourage parents and children to do this workshop together so you can reinforce the learning at home. You get to benefit from the skills Sensei Patricia has gained from over 40 years training in karate delivered to you in a fun package!
You will learn how to:
- Stay safe
- Build awareness and confidence
- Defend yourself effectively
Cost: $29
NOTE: Family concessions available on request to patricia@familyfitkarate.co.nz. Ask about our gift vouchers for our Self Defence workshops and Karate memberships.
Time: 12:15PM to 3:15PM.
Venue: Brooklyn Community Centre Hall, 18 Harrison St, Brooklyn

description:
Paekākāriki Pride Party, Paekākāriki Pride is back for the 8th year... this year's dance theme is 80s Dance Party!

Get decked out with your biggest hair, widest shoulder pads, and get your strut on in a power suit as we dance the night away.

DJ tunes from Vinyl & Proud. Cash bar and yummy treats by Paekākāriki School PTA.

This year's proceeds from Paekākāriki Pride Festival 2024 will be donated to Wellington Pride as they navigate their court case against LAVA. For more information follow this link: https://www.wellingtonpridefestival.com/news-1/an-update-on-the-hrrt-case

Our kaupapa:
Paekākāriki Pride exists to support Takatāpui and Rainbow communities in the Kāpiti Region and beyond.
We firmly hold the position that trans women are women and trans men are men, and that non-binary identities are valid. We recognise the harm caused by colonisation to Takatāpui communities. As an organisation we work to become better Treaty Partners
label: Festivals

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Island Bay Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.
label: Festivals

description:
Sip the Sky: Paint, Sip and Stargaze, Paint:
Begin the evening with a night sky-inspired painting session at Ventana Art Space - 7 Kitchener Street. Whether you're a seasoned artist or picking up a brush for the first time, this relaxed, hands-on experience invites you to create under the spell of twilight tones and celestial charm.

Sip:
Then head next door for a guided wine tasting from the passionate team at The Good Way (located beside the Martinborough Brewery on Ohio Street), showcasing a selection of their elegant, small-batch wines. Find your favourite and grab a bottle to take home—perfect for gifting or continuing the magic later.

Taste:
Indulge your senses with a chocolate tasting hosted by Elly from be happy chocolate. Sample her handcrafted, ethically made bars and select your favourite block to take home. Please advise any dietary requirements when booking. Warm your hands around a velvety be happy hot chocolate and...

Stargaze:
Head outside for a gentle stroll to Considine Park with Charlotte from Wairarapa Dark Sky. Walk in the Dark while sipping hot chocolate. A chance to understand the benefits of the dark sky and finish with some star gazing.

Timing is flexible to allow for moving between locations, if you'd like to order food from The Social Kitchen food truck at the Brewery, etc. The latest finish time would be 8.45pm.

Date: Saturday, 30th August

Doors: 6:00 PM

Event Overview
Get ready for Wellington's ultimate tribute party as RIOT FEST brings together the most explosive tribute acts under one roof! This high-energy night celebrates the biggest names in rock, metal, punk, and grunge with authentic performances that will transport you straight to the mosh pit.
Featured Tribute Acts:

Plus Special Guest DJs:

Experience the raw energy and iconic sounds of legendary bands brought to life by Wellington's finest tribute musicians. From Slipknot's crushing metal to Nirvana's grunge anthems, Green Day's punk rock energy to The Prodigy's electronic chaos - this is one night that promises to deliver non-stop headbanging action.

description:
Sisterhood Sanctuary 💜, Sisterhood Sanctuary 💜

Sisterhood Sanctuary


Join our women's group, "Sisterhood Sanctuary," every Sunday at the end of the month at 6:30 pm.


This gathering is a safe and welcoming space for women to connect, heal, and find support.

The evening will include:
* Meditation: Guided meditation to help you find inner peace and clarity.

* Soundbath: A deeply relaxing experience using crystal singing bowls to promote healing and reduce stress.

* Sharing and Support: A confidential space to share your experiences and support one another on your journeys.

Entry is $20 with shared kai (food). We look forward to welcoming you to our sanctuary.

Private message me if you’d like to join or for more information .
Starts in September.

description:
Puku Rangi Tea – Rapa Nui Music & Dance Tour in Marlborough, Experience the vibrant culture of Easter Island as Puku Rangi Tea tours for the first time in Marlborough to closing the Welcoming Week Celebration!
Since 2012, they have been dedicated to preserving and showcasing traditional Rapa Nui music and dance. Their vibrant performances include the Hoko warrior dance, resonating with the spirit of the Māori Haka, storytelling through Takona body painting and ancestral narratives, Kai Kai string games and the rhythmic sounds of Tahitian ukulele and drums.
Puku Rangi Tea currently performs three shows a week at the Tahatai Hotel in Hanga Roa, Rapa Nui, and has participated in various festivals throughout its history, including:
Indigenous festival 2023–2024, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
World Gathering of Folkloric Associations 2020, Lima, Peru.
International Festival 2018–2019, Málaga, Spain.
Chapultepec Forest Festival 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Second Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2018, Mexico City and Morelia, Michoacán, Mexico.
First Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Indigenous festival 2016–2020, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
Cultural Market 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
12th Pacific Arts Festival 2016, Hagåtña, Guam.
Carnaval 2016, Arica, Chile.
Summer Festival 2016, Valdivia, Chile.
Oktoberfest Chile 2015–2017, Malloco, Chile.
Gala Puro Chile 2015, Miami, United States.
The tour holds significant cultural importance due to Rapa Nui deep ancestral connections with Aotearoa, offering a unique opportunity for cultural engagement and community connection.
Their itinerary includes high-profile engagements, such as:
Music Workshop on Friday 12 at 4pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Dance Workshop on Friday 12 at 6pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Concert: Live music and dances on Sunday 14 Spetember. Doors open at 3:30pm, Event start at 4pm
Koha - Entry - RSVP Required (Limited Capacity)
We are also excited to feature the local guest band "Matices", who will open the concert with a vibrant performance of live Andean and Latin American music.

description:
Round The Vines 2025, Round The Vines 2025
Join us for Martinborough School’s iconic fundraiser fun run & walk through scenic vineyards!

Date: 1st November 2025

Location: Martinborough, New Zealand

Distances: 10 km Run or Walk | 21 km Run or Walk

Bring your friends and family for a 10 or 21km fun run or walk around vineyards that are only open to the public for Round The Vines 2025.

Wear your best activewear or fancy dress and enjoy the live music and themed hydration stations dotted around the course. Then head to the prize-giving for delicious food & wines, live entertainment and amazing prizes generously donated by local businesses.

Stay the weekend for great eateries, cellar doors, boutique shopping and more!

New course for 2025
We are planning a new course for 2025 that will take you through vineyards never seen by the public before! Keep an eye out for the new course map coming soon.

Visit our website for more information and to register: www.roundthevines.org.nz

📸 Follow us for the latest updates and share your Round the Vines moments using #RoundTheVines

#RTV2025 #RoundTheVines #MartinboroughRTV #FunRun #MartinboroughSchool #VineyardRun

description:
Introduction to Energy Healing, Introduction to Energy Healing
Curious About Energy Healing? You're in the Right Place.

Have you ever felt drawn to energy healing, but weren’t sure where to begin?

Maybe you’ve always been curious—something inside you has been nudging you toward it—but you’ve never had the guidance or space to explore.

Now’s your chance.

We invite you to join a warm, supportive group of fellow learners as we step into the world of energy healing together. Whether you’re completely new or just beginning to explore, this is a safe and inspiring environment to learn, connect, and grow.

You’ll be guided by Tania Smith - Angelic Reiki Master Teacher and skilled and intuitive practitioner with years of experience. Her grounded approach and deep knowledge make the learning journey both empowering and accessible.

Come with an open heart and a curious mind. Let’s begin this healing journey together.

Booking essential. Email Tania:

Phone Tania: 021 030 6507

Cost: $25 per

Venue: the studio @ the art and living space, 17 Bradey Road, Pauatahanui

description:
Rave to the Grave - Fund-Raise the Dead for BATS and RadioActive.FM, 30+ DJs - 3 Stages - 1 Fundraiser

Two epic Wellington institutions – BATS Theatre and RadioActive.FM – are teaming up this Halloween to deliver an unforgettable night of music, energy, and community spirit, all while raising essential funds to keep these local legends alive.

Rave to the Grave – Fund-Raise the Dead for BATS Theatre and RadioActive.FM will transform the Kent Tce into a pumping, all-night celebration on Halloween night. With three unique dance spaces across all of BATS’ venues, ravers can choose their vibe, from blissed-out chill, to deep grooves, to high-energy bass.

TICKETS ARE STRICTLY LIMITED SO BE QUICK!

VIP tickets include a free drink and snack on arrival, plus a mystery goodie bag!
More than 30 RadioActive.FM DJs will be behind the decks, from all your favourite shows, including The Jewel School, Midnight Marauders, The Floor, Homebass, The Session, and more!
Following the resounding success of last year’s fundraiser, Flight of Fancy – BATS Turns 35, hailed as one of the city’s most exhilarating parties, the need for ongoing community support remains critical.

That event raised significant funds for the theatre, highlighting the essential role Wellingtonians play in sustaining the city’s arts and music scene.

Both BATS and RadioActive.FM, as charitable organisations, must continually raise funds to keep their doors open and their creative voices alive, ensuring that audiences can continue to enjoy bold, independent theatre and iconic local broadcasting.

description:
Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025, Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025
Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.

This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.

We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.

This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.

Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit

www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.

For questions, email .

Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

description:
Tartan Up The Green, Tartan Up The Green
Gather up the clan and join us here at Brewtown Upper Hutt – Tartan Up The Green is back for 2025!

Are you ready to be blown away by the power of the Pipes and Drums as Tartan Up The Green returns this October 4th for another rousing rendition of Bagpiping, Highland Drumming and Dancing!

Our mates from RNZPBA Wellington Hawkes Bay are back to curate their all-new take on traditional pipe and drum comps with some of the finest musicians in the country.

Join us on The Greenspace for our very own family friendly, FREE to attend salute to those earth-shaking instruments of war (literally) and all things Highlands and Islands!

It won’t just be Pipers and Drummers competing for glory. Brewtown is delighted to welcome some bonnie boogying in the form of Scottish Highland Dancing, as dancers from up and down the country wow the crowd with traditional dance.

A true showcase of strength and stamina, Highland Dancing is highly technical and recognised as a sport by the Sport Council of Scotland…waltzing this aint!

So, get behind these incredible young athletes and show your support at this years Tartan Up The Green!
label: Festivals

description:
Child First Aid Course, Child First Aid Course
*This course is now fully booked. Please enter your details if you would like to go on the waitlist. Ngā mihi*


This half-day course is ideal for people who are looking after children in their own home or for those needing to renew their Child First Aid certificate.


In this course, in-depth lessons and scenario-based activities will give you:
- the skills to identify and deal with serious illness and life-threatening medical emergencies
- the confidence to be able to offer vital assistance before more experienced help arrives
- a Child First Aid certificate valid for 2 years upon successful completion.

Training provided by Hato Hone St John. This course has been generously funded by the St John Area Committee for the Wairarapa.

Please register your interest in attending by filling out this form: https://form.jotform.com/252087575168871.

Spaces are strictly limited. A waitlist will be in place once we reach capacity.

description:
Tyaan Singh presents the Music of Studio Ghibli, Join us for a beautiful evening celebrating the magical worlds of Studio Ghibli, brought to life by a vibrant 12-piece ensemble blending both jazz and classical orchestral instrumentation.
We’ll journey through the music of eight classic Ghibli films, performing inventive arrangements of their iconic main themes intertwined with other musical moments from throughout each soundtrack.
The soundtracks have been reimagined in a jazz context while staying true to the original cinematic sound, so the music will have something new for seasoned Ghibli fans and newcomers alike.
Featuring:
Tyaan Singh - Arranger, Alto Saxophone, Clarinet
Will Hanlon - Tenor Saxophone, Flute
Eilish Wilson - Baritone Saxophone
Jack Harré - Trumpet
David Codd - French Horn
Julian Kirgan Báez - Trombone
Mana Waiariki - Violin
Hayden Nickel - Violin
Joanna Dann - Cello
Hector McLachlan - Piano
Seth Boy - Bass
Shaun Anderson - Drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series From Scratch, New Zealand’s oldest and most avant-garde chamber music ensemble, From Scratch, has been performing nationally and internationally since 1974, principally under the leadership of sound and intermedia artist Phil Dadson.

From Scratch have developed an original and innovative sound/performance style that includes large sculptural invented instruments (primarily percussion), and innovative hocket-style rhythms – where the performers’ individual parts interlock to create complex rhythmic and melodic structures.

The current collective core-group consists of Adrian Croucher, Shane Currey, Phil Dadson, Darryn Harkness and Chris O'Connor.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music, The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music
Join us under a canopy of trees for an unforgettable afternoon that blends flavour, sound & celebration. Set against the stunning backdrop of Martinborough’s rolling hills and vines, this curated gathering brings together our favourite makers, movers, and shakers - ready to pour, plate, and play their hearts out.

Sip iconic artisan wines, swirl small-batch gin and savour signature gourmet bites by culinary legends.

On stage we welcome the soulful stylings and powerhouse vocals of Hollie Smith, the retro glam and infectious energy of The Beat Girls, and the genre-spinning magic of Sweet Mix Kids, interspersed with sets from DJ Takas. The only thing smoother than the wine is the soundtrack.

Our Saturday session promises an elevated, intimate atmosphere - where the wine flows, the beats drop, and the good vibes carry you through an afternoon of dancing, right into sunset.

With invited friends: Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Escarpment, Ata Rangi, Schubert, Palliser Estate, Halite Wines, Lighthouse Gin, Mt Difficulty, Vavasour, Martinborough Brewery, Antipodes Water, The Crab Shack, Wharekauhau Estate, Shed 5, SOUL Bar & Bistro and Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon.

Elevate your festival experience with VIP hosting at The Runholder Cottage. Indulge in premium and library wines poured by the winemakers themselves, impeccably paired with gourmet food offerings from Auckland Viaduct’s iconic SOUL Bar & Bistro. As a VIP guest, you’ll enjoy all-inclusive food and beverage with menu service for any onsite vendor, exclusive access to the dedicated VIP area with priority stage sightlines and premium hosting amenities for your comfort and convenience.

Take advantage of easy transportation options with return bus add-ons from Wellington, Masterton, Carterton, Greytown & Featherston ($30-$60), and free shuttles to and from Martinborough Square, so you can sip responsibly.

description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show, Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

On land, the iconic boatsheds and Mana Island backdrop set the vibe with music, food, and good times. The Hui is about more than just competition — it’s about celebrating the Bay and bringing whānau and friends together.
Save the date – Saturday 11th October 2025.
Registration will be available soon via LiveHeats.
Follow, like, and share our Facebook page to stay up to date with comp news, registration, and event updates.
Keen to support? We’re welcoming local sponsors — reach out if you’d like to get involved.

description:
Valley Day - NZ, NZ, Australia & Asia
Hop heads and hazy fans this ones for you - Valley Day returns in 2025!
Brewed in collaboration with the legendary Trillium Brewery from Canton, Massachusetts, USA. to create something to highlight the newest Valley we have found and bring back some of those nostalgic classics.
This event is not just a celebration of the best of craft beer but a highlight of the hops terroir.
Our travels over the years have taken us from the valleys of New Zealand, the natural beauty that is Derwent Valley Tasmania, to some of the most fertile hop fields of the U.S. Yakima Valley, all on the quest for that perfect valley hop.
More details to come!

description:
Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK), Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK)
SYLC & Ghost Media Presents: WAREHOUSE RAVE FT. COKI
Friday 5th September
Secret Central Wellington Location (TO BE REVEALED ON EVENT DAY)
Powered by Banshee Soundsystem
8pm-2am
R18
Strictly limited capacity

Get ready Welly, because this one is about to be serious. We have secured the one and only COKI for an intimate warehouse rave at an inner city location.

This legend of bass needs no introduction, but we’ll give him one anyway. As one half of DIGITAL MYSTIKZ, Coki has made sine waves move like no other, architecting much of the sonic blueprint that modern dubstep has become known for. Alongside Mala, he helped forge the DMZ sound and is now making his way to Wellington for a rare showcase of pure low-frequency warfare. Expect heavyweight pressure, bone-rattling subs, and that unmistakable Coki wobble - this is dubstep in its rawest form.

On support we have drawn for the best of the best. Opening up proceedings we have BABETECH, champion selector and vibe master. Since murking opening slots for Loefah, Filth and Kahn & Neek as well as spreading the gospel of bass for countless evenings on RadioActive, we can’t think of a better opener for this night.

Following that, we have dubstep extraordinaire DUSTY warming things up with his signature and gruelling take on the classic dubstep sound. With releases on Infernal Sounds and Leather Kennel, Dusty has proven himself to be a force to be reckoned with, and is surely one of the most exciting young producers in the game today.

On closing duties we have the Support Your Local crew going b2b with Young Gho$t to round out the night with a bit of silliness.

We’ve managed to secure an all-new inner city warehouse location for this one, and its Further Sound on soundsystem duties this time, heating things up with their BANSHEE SOUNDSYSTEM, preparing for only its second full rollout after Cuba Dupa this year.

We’re unbelievably excited to share this space with you all for a dance and are expecting this to be one for the books.Secure your tickets now and don’t miss out on this momentous and legendary dance music event!

Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/coki-uk-warehouse-rave

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival - Building by the Water, Take a closer look at the history of Porirua’s harbourside, from early Māori settlements to cutting edge contemporary engineering developments.

As part of the 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival, Kai Tahi presents a visual exhibition in celebration of Porirua’s unique harbourside heritage.

Building by the Water brings together archival images courtesy of the Alexander Turnbull Library Collection and recent photographic works by Jason Mann. Seen collectively, this visual record aims to place the Kai Tahi development into the wider history of construction along Te Awarua-o-Porirua Harbour.

The exhibition traces a history of harbourside settlement from Māori pa sites, to whaling stations, early settler communities, harbour reclamation, big box retail and now, in 2025, the next community-focused iteration of harbourside settlement, as exemplified by Kai Tahi and the reuse of existing industrial forms.

Kai Tahi has a simple but powerful mission: to transform the traditional idea of a food-court into a cultural and creative harbourside hub for the Porirua Community.

Historic images on display include aerial photographs from Whites Aviation, 19th century engravings and 20th century paintings.

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival in the Wairarapa 2025, Experience the People, Places, & Stories of Te Upoko-o-Te-Ika-a-Māui, the Greater Wellington Region, and discover over a dozen events in the Wairarapa alone.

Wellington Heritage Festival 2025 will run from Saturday the 18th October until Sunday 9th November, spanning from the Kāpiti Coast to the Wairarapa.

On the 8th and 9th of November, the focus will be on the Wairarapa, with a variety of events taking place all across the valley. Come to discover local history, visit historic marae, or delve into some of the delicious food that this magical area has to offer.

Visit our website to discover over 140 culture and heritage themed events across the wider region, from walking tours to wagon wheel making courses. There's something for everyone!

Some events require booking. Please visit our website to learn more about booked events. www.wellingtonheritagefestival.nz/events

Organised by the Wellington Heritage Festival Trust and the Rotary Clubs of Greater Wellington. Sponsored by the Wellington City Council, Hutt City Council, Trust House Foundation, Historic Places Wellington, Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, and Hiamo Ltd.

description:
FREE GIG - Andrew Grayson - farewell show, The sound of Wellington band fFolks (pronounced simply, "Folks"), ranges from alt-country to angular punk-pop to atmospheric soundscapes. Members Achilles Botes, Bret Thurston and Andrew Grayson weave together a spectrum of instruments including drums, effects-driven bass and mandola, tenor guitar, keys, autoharp, xylophones and harmonica to create music that is sometimes floating, sometimes driving and sometimes all of these things at once.
Free gig - Koha - anyone is welcome to attend.
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible

A wonderful range of exhibitors, 'Ask an Expert' sessions, latest trends, innovations and exclusive show specials it’s the place to be for inspiration for indoors and out.
For more information visit homeandgardenshow.co.nz or 'Like us' on Facebook.
We are working very hard to keep our events safe and we ask that you please stay home if you are unwell.
Show opening hours: Friday & Saturday 10-5pm, Sunday 10-4pm
FAQs
1. What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Parking is available at the venue, at a cost of $10. Please note parking is card payment only (entry to the Show is card or cash).
2. What is the best time to attend?
Peak visitor times are normally between 11am - 2pm so the crowds are less outside of these times.
3. What days is the ticket valid for?
General Admission entry tickets is for one entry only and is valid for any one of the 3 event days.
Gold Card Special 1/2 price tickets valid for Friday only.
4. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
A printed ticket or showing the barcode on your phone to the entry staff is required.

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 28 Oct, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
A History of Violence, Details
Directed by David Cronenberg
Starring Viggo Mortensen, Ed Harris, William Hurt, Maria Bello
--- When a pair of petty criminals attempt to rob his small-town diner, Tom Stall (Viggo Mortensen) quickly and easily kills them both. In the flush of news coverage of Tom's seemingly heroic actions, a threatening stranger named Carl Fogarty (Ed Harris) comes to town, fingering the unassuming family man as long-missing Philadelphia mobster Joey Cusack. To the horror of his wife, Edie (Maria Bello), and teenage son, Jack (Ashton Holmes), Tom finds he must confront his violent past. ---

Screening on 35mm

description:
All That Heaven Allows, Details
Directed by Douglas Sirk
Starring Rock Hudson, Jane Wyman
70th Anniversary

--- Cary Scott is a well-to-do widow gradually re-entering a social life amongst her mostly dull country club peers. Her only apparent enjoyment in life comes from weekend visits from her college-age children. Cary then meets a handsome younger man, Ron, who owns a small landscaping business. A follower of Henry David Thoreau's Walden, Ron enjoys a life focused on nature and is deliberately uninterested in the gossipy opinions of others. Their romance causes clashes and tensions between Cary, her children, and the country club. ---

This is a TEA TIME TALKIE screening where a delicious Devonshire Tea* awaits for upgraded tickets holders (a cup of tea and traditional homemade scones with cream and jam). This is served upstairs in the Grand Lobby during the intermission.

Admit only tickets are available for $15 or you can upgrade to include a Devonshire Tea for $24.

*No dietaries catered for.

3:15pm – Intermission, Devonshire Tea available for collection upstairs in the Grand Lobby
3:30pm – Feature resumes

description:
Live & Work in Japan! Q&A Evening with JET Programme Alumni, Have you ever wanted to live and work in Japan?
Come talk
to some people who've done it!
Every year, a diverse range of New Zealanders representing a variety of backgrounds, ages, interests, and cultures start a life-changing adventure in Japan-and next year that could include you!
With applications for the New Zealand JET Programme around the corner, you may have questions about what it's actually like to be sent off to live and teach in Japan for a year or more!
The JET Alumni Association of Wellington, in coordination with The Embassy of Japan, have organised a casual evening event for prospective applicants to ask those questions, and hear some stories to help you make a better decision about if the JET Programme is right for you.
Q&A event details
Date: 6th October 2025
Time: 17:30 - 19:30
Location: Yoshi Sushi & Bento (Press Hall, Willis Street)
Doors open from 5:30, with Q&A starting from 6:00.
Enjoy free
courtesy of Yoshi Sushi & Bento.
(Drinks, including Japanese
will also be available for purchase).
Admission to the event is FREE!
So come along and bring your friends
to this great opportunity to meet a handful of the thousands of Kiwis who've taken part in this programme over the past 40 years
Anyone interested in applying is welcome to attend!

What is the Japan Exchange Teaching (JET) Programme, you ask?
The JET Programme is an overseas employment opportunity to live and work in Japan for a year or more! You could soon head abroad on the adventure of a lifetime, and get paid for it!
Programme criteria includes the following-are you:
A New Zealand citizen?
Already graduated?
Or will have your Bachelor's Degree/Teaching Diploma conferred by early July 2026?
Interested in international activities?
Interested in teaching English to young people and living in Japan?

Positions available:
Assistant Language Teacher (ALT)
ALTs help the Japanese foreign language teachers in class and help prepare teaching materials and class activities. They may assist in English language clubs and other extra-curricular activities. Knowledge of Japanese is not required to be an ALT.
Coordinator for International Relations (CIR)
CIRs work in local government offices and are involved in international activities, which might include editing publications, translation work, advising on the planning and implementation of exchange programmes, and interpreting at international events. A functional knowledge of written and spoken Japanese is required to be a CIR.
For more information about the New Zealand JET Programme, visit:
https://www.nz.emb-japan.go.jp/itpr_en/jet.html
https://www.facebook.com/JETProgrammeNZ/
We hope to see you there!

description:
Film screening: GAGA, Film screening: GAGA
Join us for a special screening of the 2022 Taiwanese comedy-drama film GAGA, featuring a Q&A with the award-winning Director, Laha Mebow

About this Event

Gaga《哈勇家》(2022)
Directed by Laha Mebow 112 mins, Mandarin/Atayal/Taiwanese, English subtitles
Among the Atayal indigenous people of Taiwan, gaga is the traditional law and custom, the way of living with the land and organising society, the source of values. When Hayung, the patriarch of an Atayal family, and the senior knowledge-keeper, dies, his oldest son Payang decides to run for election as head of the local district. The film Gaga follows this election, in its raw democratic, and occasionally corrupt, form and the ways – sometimes serious, sometimes hilarious – that it affects the extended family. A groundbreaking film, Gaga is mostly in Atayal language and presents the life and social interactions of these contemporary indigenous Taiwanese people unsentimentally, with humour, with compassion, and with the sharp eye of a brilliant film-maker.
Gaga won Best Director and Best Supporting Actress at the 59th Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival in 2022. Beyond Taiwan, it won the Best Director at the 2022 Singapore International Film Festival - Asian Feature Competition and has been screened at film festivals in Hawaii, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Auckland and New York.

Q&A with Film Director Laha Mebow
We are delighted that Film Director Laha Mebow, Taiwan's first indigenous female director, will be attending the screening and take part in Q&A afterwards.


Laha Mebow is the first female director from Taiwan to win Best Director at the Golden Horse Awards, the most prestigious film award in the Chinese-speaking world. An Indigenous filmmaker of the Tayal people, she is also the first Indigenous woman in Taiwan to direct a narrative feature. Her films explore spiritual inheritance, family trauma, and Indigenous identity through a deeply personal yet cinematic lens.
She has directed three feature films. Finding Sayun (2011) reimagines a colonial-era legend from an Indigenous perspective. Lokah Laqi! (2016), a coming-of-age tale of three Indigenous boys, was selected as Taiwan’s official submission for Best Foreign Language Film at the Academy Awards. Her third feature, Gaga (2022), won Best Film at the Singapore International Film Festival and delves into generational shifts and cultural survival within an Indigenous family.
Laha’s body of work continues to break new ground for Indigenous representation in Asian cinema. Her unique voice bridges traditional storytelling and contemporary filmmaking, making her one of the most important and anticipated directors from Taiwan today.

https://cdn-az.allevents.in/events10/banners/8cd1bb10-7456-11f0-994e-1dce379af11a-rimg-w570-h740-dc090807-gmir.jpg

description:
Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington, Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington
Two nights, one ticket, endless Halloween chaos in Wellington. Join both crawls with drinks, music, and costume madness.

About this Event


🎃🍺 Halloween Madness Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington 🎃🍺

Two nights of crawls. One ticket. Zero excuses.
Halloween in Wellington isn’t just one party — it’s a whole weekend. With the Halloween Madness Weekend Pass, you’ll unlock access to two epic bar crawls:
Friday, October 31st → Haunted Halloween Bar Crawl
Saturday, November 1st → Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl

Double the venues, double the specials, double the fun. Whether you’re into pumpkin brews, tequila shots, or just want an excuse to rock your scariest (or funniest) costume twice, this pass is your best deal for Halloween weekend.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
✔️ Entry to both Friday & Saturday night crawls
✔️ No cover charges at participating bars & clubs
✔️ Crawl-only drink deals at every stop
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your night
✔️ DJs, themed parties, and Halloween vibes until 2 AM
✔️ Two big finale parties — one each night


HOW THE WEEKEND FLOWS
👉 Wristband Pickup: Check in between 7:30–10:30 PM each night at the opening venue to collect your pass.
👉 Bar Hopping: From 8:30–11:30 PM, explore multiple walkable venues — pubs, clubs, and breweries — all offering specials.
👉 The Last Stop: Each crawl closes at a featured nightclub from 11:30 PM–2:00 AM with DJs and dance floors packed.




WEEKEND VIBE
👻 Costumes aren’t required but highly encouraged — expect the streets to be packed with zombies, witches, superheroes, and some of the funniest DIY outfits you’ll see all year.
⚡ Early bird tickets start at just $25 for the full weekend. Prices rise as Halloween gets closer — secure your spot now.


PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.




⚠️ EVENT RULES & DISCLAIMER

ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
18+ Only: All guests must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued photo ID. No exceptions.
Wristbands Required: Your wristband is your ticket. Present your Eventbrite ticket/QR code at check-in to claim it. Wristbands must be worn the entire night for access to crawl venues. If you miss the pickup window (before 10:30 PM at the listed check-in), you forfeit entry.


CRAWL GUIDELINES
On-Time Check-In: Arrive during designated hours (7:30–10:30 PM). Late arrivals cannot be accommodated.
Proxy Pickup: If you can’t make it, you may authorize a friend to collect your wristband.
Venue Timing: Specials and entry are only valid during the timeframes listed on the Digital Bar List.
Day-Of Updates: Always check the Digital Crawl Map on event day for the latest venue info, changes, or closures.
Self-Guided Crawl: No hosts will lead groups. Use the crawl map to navigate between bars.
Venue Capacity: If a location is full, you may have to wait. Access is not guaranteed at every bar.


VENUE POLICIES
Right to Refuse: Venues may deny entry or remove anyone due to intoxication, dress code violations, offensive costumes, or inappropriate behavior.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not exempt you from ID or bag checks. Standard venue security applies.
Drink Specials: Offered at the discretion of participating bars; they may change or end without notice.
Venue Awareness: If staff aren’t aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the crawl map. If unavailable, proceed to another participating venue.


TICKET & EVENT TERMS
All Sales Final: No refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled outright (without reschedule), refunds excluding fees will be processed automatically.
Rain or Shine: Crawl will proceed regardless of weather. Venues and lineup are subject to change.
Late / Wrong Venue: Tickets are valid only during scheduled crawl hours. No refunds for late arrivals or showing up at the wrong check-in.
Costume Policy: No weapons or weapon-like props. Offensive costumes are prohibited and may result in denied entry.


LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge that participation is at your own risk. Risks include but are not limited to: injury, illness, property damage, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death.
You hereby release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, affiliates, and participating venues from all claims or liability, whether caused by negligence or otherwise, for any injury, loss, illness, or death occurring before, during, or after the event.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any expenses, claims, or legal costs arising from your actions during the crawl.
By attending, you confirm you’ve read, understood, and agreed to these terms in full.

description:
CTRL_ALT_DEL, CTRL_ALT_DEL
Can we CTRL ourselves? ALT our reality? Or must we DEL everything else?

About this Event


Strap in for this emotional rollercoaster! Let voice, music and movement take you through a journey of resilience and self-discovery, to a wild, high-energy house party, to a powerful exploration of love, grief, and revenge. Three stories; one powerful connection.

Note to God - Jjohn Nickle
Note to God follows five individuals in therapy, each facing personal struggles. As they bond through shared pain, healing begins — until a twist tests their trust. A moving musical about connection, resilience, and finding hope in life’s darkest moments.
My House - Olivia Watts
My House is a high-energy show that takes you on a Saturday night and shows the heart of a house party. From the first guest to the final beat, experience explosive choreography, unforgettable characters, and music that moves your soul. It’s more than a party, it’s My House.
No Way Back? - Bryce Blackmore
No Way Back? explores one man’s experience with loss and what it means for his humanity. When everything is ripped away, how do we respond? In the wake of tragedy, we all face a choice: confront the pain and move forward or let it consume us.

From September to November, a selection of Thursday nights will be your chance to slow down, sink into a beanbag, sit back in a chair, and lose yourself in the magic of cinema. Bring your own pillow and blanket if you wish!

KNEECAP Synopsis:

When fate brings Belfast school teacher JJ into the Orbit of self confessed ‘low life scum’ Naoise and Liam Og, the needle drops on a hip hop act like no other. Rapping in their native language KNEECAP fast becomes the unlikely figurehead of a civil rights movement to save their mother tongue. But the trio must first overcome police, paramilitaries and politicians trying to silence their defiant sound - whilst their anarchic approach to life often makes them their own worst enemies.

In this fiercely original sex, drugs and hip-hop biotic KNEECAP play themselves laying down a global rallying cry for the defense of native cultures.

Stay for a chat afterwards where we talk all things activism and what that means today.
