description:
The Healthy Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community - Auckland, Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand are excited to invite you to…
The Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for resilience, energy, and performance?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, this is your chance to reset, recharge, and equip yourself with the tools to stay calm and in control when things get busy.
Join Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand for a unique experiential workshop designed just for hospo. Across this 2-hour session, you’ll experience:
·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
Together in Dialogue: Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Pacific Partnerships, Talanoa Tai Learning is a new collection of learning experiences. They're designed to help you build your cultural responsiveness and improve your ability to engage meaningfully with Pacific communities. Talanoa is a Pacific style of deep dialogue, with a focus on how we connect to each other and strengthen relationships, while still being able to share honest and effective insights. If you want to strengthen your capability in this space, to create transformational change, and to enhance your relationships with people from different communities - this workshop is your chance to grow.
What will I gain from Together in Dialogue?
In Together in Dialogue, you will share meaningful conversations around Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the role and responsibilities of Pasifika as allies. By engaging in deep talanoa, you will explore cultural, historical, and contemporary implications of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and how Pasifika people can strengthen this unique relationship and promote cultural awareness.
This is a 3.5 hour in-person learning experience. The day will begin with a Pōwhiri, to welcome you into the space.
Who is this workshop for?
These learning experiences are for both Paciﬁc professionals and those from other communities. You don’t need to have prior knowledge or experience in this area - we’ll meet you where you are and provide a welcoming, supportive environment for you to learn.
Cultural responsiveness is for everyone. Whether you’re in social work, education, government, community sectors or beyond, these learning experiences have been designed to help everyone build their skills. If you think this professional development might be right for you, it is!
Cost
When work is busy and budgets are tight, cultural responsiveness can often take a backseat. But this is an aﬀordable investment that will help you address the challenges that so many of us share, like how to build engagement and trust, and avoid relationship missteps. It’s not a buzzword; it’s a vital skill if you want to better meet the needs of the people you serve. Price: $170 (inc GST) per person, including morning tea.
Facilitator
Our team’s extensive research and experience feed into these sessions, with a focus on interactive activities and practical, real-life examples. Our team has decades of experience across a range of ﬁelds, in particular social development, education, and research. We have worked with organisations and businesses across the Paciﬁc, and our engagement with diﬀerent Paciﬁc languages, cultures, and communities means we oﬀer robust, informed perspectives. Fa’aeafale’upolu (Polu) Samuelu is the facilitator of this Talanoa Tai Learning experience.

The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Come with curiosity—leave with insight, inspiration, and a deeper connection to the sacred rhythms of nature.

My talk will be supported by a powerpoint presentation Email

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

In her upcoming talk, Nicole shares how simple, intentional skincare can become a powerful act of self-care and renewal.

description:
NZIFF: Deaf, A woman navigates the experience of motherhood as a deaf person in a hearing world in Eva Libertad’s crowd-pleasing, feel-good drama which collected the Panaroma Audience Award at Berlin this year.

Based on the award-winning short of the same name, Spanish filmmaker Eva Libertad’s debut follows couple Ángela and Héctor as they make the transition into parenthood. Ángela is deaf. Héctor is not. When she tells them she’s pregnant, her own parents can’t hide their shock – loving but concerned that their daughter will be unable to tackle the task of motherhood. Will the baby be born deaf? Uncertainty abounds as the due date draws closer, and it’s not just Ángela’s parents who are beginning to have doubts.

The foundations for the film’s narrative derive from the personal experiences of first-time actor Miriam Garlo, Libertad’s own sister, as she began to contemplate motherhood as a deaf woman. When surrounded by her other deaf friends, Ángela is comfortable, alive, vibrant within a community that supports her. Around the local mums in the park, or her husband’s friends, isolation sets in with a painful immediacy that anyone who has ever struggled to understand the language in a foreign country will know all too well. A poignant story bound by the chemistry of its leads, deafness is woven into the film as a lived experience, not a defining label. — Matt Bloomfield

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

description:
Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come and join Jenny Allan for a cup of ceremonial grade cacao and then enjoy a gentle and relaxing restorative yoga practice - twilight edition.

Event details

• What - 1.5 hr yoga session
• When -
TWILIGHT EDITION 7-8.30pm Tuesday 23rd September 2025
MORNING EDITION 10-11.30am Saturday 27th September 2025

• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
• Cost - $30 per person

• What to bring? Most props are provided but feel free to bring your own yoga mat for extra comfort as well as a cushion, blanket, socks and an eye pillow if you have one.

This class is suitable for all - no previous experience is required.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.
TWILIGHT SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/5a2pad44
MORNING SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/mw82z38u

Restorative yoga is a practice of deep relaxation in which yoga poses (asanas) are held for several minutes with the use of props such as blocks, bolster and blankets to support the body in gentle stretch.

When your body enters a state of relaxation, your mind will also relax. Once you have been guided to let go of any tension held in your body, all that is required is for you to pay attention to your breath, becoming aware of any thoughts that may arise, and then gently releasing them.

This restful practice calms both mind and body, allowing the nervous system to enter its parasympathetic state – the state of “rest and digest”, in which healing is enabled and enhanced.

About Cacao
Cacao is a superfood. It is plant medicine at its finest. Its scientific name, Theobroma cacao, translates to "food of the Gods." Containing many minerals, vitamins and phytonutrients such as flavonoids and antioxidants, it is also an extremely potent adaptogen that encourages the body to come into balance.

Cacao has a particularly strong influence on the heart – both physiologically and energetically. Cacao anecdotally is reported to enhance connection in community, hence its beauty in being shared in circle.

In Jenny's experience, cacao seems to enhance whatever it is that you are doing – be it running a marathon or meditating – cacao can make you go deeper, further, longer, stronger. However she does seem to have a mind of her own so be open to the experience she offers you – it may not always go quite how you planned!

Cacao is very safe and tolerated well by most people. However it is to be used with caution by people who are taking high doses of SSRIs. Cacao releases serotonin, so it works as a mild antidepressant. When taken with SSRIs that release serotonin chemically it can lead to serotonin syndrome. Individuals taking MAOIs (monoamine oxidase inhibitors) should avoid consuming ceremonial cacao due to potential interactions.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

How Big Should My Entry Be?
This is Armies on Parade, so go big!

Armies on Parade is your opportunity to show off what inspires you in the Warhammer hobby. Your project could be anything from a K*ll Team squad or a Warcry warband to a massive galaxy-conquering battleforce or a realm-shaking army.

For Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Warhammer 40,000, Legions Imperialis, Middle-earth™ Strategy Battle Game, Warhammer: The Old World, and Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, the minimum number of units per entry is two complete units. This can be any combination of unit types, including, but not limited to, a character model and a squad, two tanks, a tank and squad, and more.

For skirmish-style games including Necromunda, K*ll Team, Warcry, Warhammer Underworlds, and Blood Bowl, the minimum entry is one complete warband, K*ll team, gang, Blood Bowl team, or other equivalent.

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

description:
Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied

Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.

Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.
A lot of ~intimate eye contact~.
Maybe some touching.

The works.

Theatreview

Created and Performed by Emma Maguire & Hamish Boyle

description:
Monthly Life Drawing, Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

Halloween Friday in Wellington deserves a proper toast. On October 31st, 2025, join Drink Link for the Boos & Brews Pub Crawl, a night where costumes meet craft beer. This crawl will take you through 4+ pubs, each serving up themed drinks, lively music, and plenty of Halloween energy.

Roam (8:30–11:30 PM) – Move between pubs at your own pace, guided by the digital crawl map.

⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. Event Continuity

DRAG BINGO with Homer Neurotic @ Dirty Little Secret, This is not your grandma’s bingo night. Wellington’s resident sad boy and pint-sized powerhouse, Homer Neurotic, is taking over the rooftop at Dirty Little Secret for a night of unhinged chaos, cocktails, and camp realness.
Get ready for an evening dripping in glamour, glitter, and glorious nonsense as you soak up the skyline views from one of the capital’s most iconic rooftop hideaways.
What to expect:
• Free entry, all you need is a table booking and good vibes
• Over $200 worth of prizes, including a $100 bar voucher for the grand winner
• Spot prizes, cheeky antics, and bad decisions encouraged
• Live drag performances that’ll leave you confused, flustered, and deeply entertained
• Dad jokes, dance-offs, and plenty of double entendres
• Drink and kai specials to keep you going
• After the Bingo stick around to boogie down with one of the resident DJ’s, spinning your tracks all night long
Bookings essential:
Tables available from 7.00 pm with balls dropping no later than 7.30. Walk-ins are very limited so grab your spot now:
https://dirtylittlesecret.co.nz/events/drag-bingo/
Safe and inclusive:
Dirty Little Secret is proudly LGBTQIA+ friendly. Our staff and security are trained to make everyone feel welcome and safe. Elevator access is available, but some tables are on raised flooring, so please reach out if you have accessibility needs and we’ll make sure you’re well looked after.
Heads up:
This is an R18 event. Expect colourful language, cheeky antics, and wholesome masculinity served with a side of mischief. Consider yourself warned.
Follow me for more nonsense:
Find me on Instagram at @homerneurotic for a peek behind the scenes and more of the drama, glitter and tears.

About this Event


🩸🔥 FEEDING FRENZY HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL – Wellington 2025 🔥🩸

When Halloween Saturday hits Wellington, the streets turn into a party jungle — and the Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl is at the top of the food chain. Hundreds of costumed crawlers will be out in full force on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, bouncing from one high-energy bar to the next, chasing the best music, the best drinks, and the wildest crowds in the city.
This isn’t a night where you settle into one place — it’s a moving, breathing, full-costume swarm of energy. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks that fit the season, and the kind of Halloween madness that only happens once a year.




WHAT’S IN STORE
🍹 Bars and clubs stocked with exclusive drink specials just for the crawl.
🎶 DJs pushing the energy with Halloween remixes, EDM, hip hop, and throwback anthems.
👻 Crowds dressed in everything from elaborate horror make-up to clever pop culture costumes.
📍 Venues chosen for atmosphere, music, and their ability to keep the party moving.


THE PLAN
The party starts at 7:30 PM at the first venue — grab your wristband and you’re in for the night. The feeding frenzy moves through multiple stops, all within walking distance, with each bar serving its own vibe and drink specials. By 11:30 PM, the entire crowd converges for a final blowout party that carries the night until 2 AM.

PARTICIPATING VENUES We’ll reveal the full lineup soon. Every location will be transformed for Halloween and serving themed drinks you won’t find on the menu any other night of the year.
📍 On event day, click the Crawl Map Link to see every participating bar, drink specials, and live music schedule.


🩸 Whether you’re a vampire, witch, demon, or something completely unexplainable, this is your night to roam the city in full costume and let loose with a crowd just as wild as you are.



🚨 Tickets: Starting at $15 — lock yours in now before they’re gone.

Your Ticket Includes:
🎟️ Entry to all participating bars and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover charges
📱 Digital crawl map access
🎵 DJs & entertainment at every venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials




⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. You voluntarily assume all dangers, including but not limited to: accidents, personal injury, illness, disability, property damage, theft, alcohol-related incidents, interactions with other participants, and even serious injury or death.
You, and anyone acting on your behalf, hereby release and discharge Events Per Se, its affiliates, sponsors, contractors, employees, volunteers, and participating venues from any liability for losses, claims, or damages — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or any other cause — that may occur before, during, or after the crawl.

By attending, you confirm you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this agreement is intended to be as broad as allowed by law.
Event Continuity
The crawl will run rain or shine. Venues may change last minute. Always check your email and the digital crawl map for updates.

4 rounds of play
Event Timing: Saturday 1st November and Sunday 2nd November 2025
Event Address: Harcourt Park - Upper Hutt
Contact us at:

The Event
Players will play a combination of 18 holes from two short but technical courses, (Harcourt Park and California Park). Course Map will be available closer to the time and will include the opportunity to play all of the harcourt holes in either a split round or full round depends on pool numbers.

MPO / FPO - $65

Registration via discgolfscene.com

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #7, Sign up here: https://luma.com/ftstwellington7
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://luma.com/ftstwellington7
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms, A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025, Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025
Unleash your inner ghoul! Join the Halloween Nightlife Crawl in Wellington on Oct. 31, 2025. 4+ venues, specials & costumes!

About this Event


Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Wellington 2025 🎭

On Friday, October 31st, 2025, the Halloween Nightlife Crawl brings you through a curated mix of Wellington’s top bars, lounges, and clubs. One ticket gives you access to 4+ venues, exclusive Halloween drink specials, and a night full of music and costumes across the city.




What’s Included
Entry to multiple nightlife venues
Crawl wristband for access and specials
Digital crawl map for easy navigation
No cover charges
DJs and entertainment at every stop


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the first stop.
🍹 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars and lounges at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Everyone meets at the closing venue for the big finish.



Quick Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices rise as the event approaches.
👻 Costumes encouraged — from glam to scary, the night is yours.
📍 Venues announced soon. Full lineup will be available on the Digital Crawl Map.
🔞 18+ only. Government-issued ID required.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the Digital Crawl Map link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon, We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
label: Hobbies & Interests

Hello everyone, so making plans for our next Kapiti Burgers n Bikes, an as September is Motorcycle Awareness Month there is a lot of other events on so we are going to hold off and support these great events and we are planning to run our next event on the 12th of October,
BUT we want to make this a special event and on that note we have been given permission to close the road outside Kapiti BurgerFuel, allowing us to have better parking for bikes but also giving us lots more room,

description:
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!, Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!
Kapiti Spring Spin Disc Golf Pop-Up!

Celebrate spring with a spin! Whether you're a disc golf regular or just curious, this pop-up event is your chance to play, learn, and connect in one of Kapiti’s most scenic reserves.

🎯 What’s Happening:
All-ages, all-skill-level disc golf—no limits, just play!
Hire out gear and learn the basics from local players.
Relaxed, social vibe—bring friends, family, or come solo!

🧭 Where:
Pukekawa Reserve, Waikanae — a beautiful open space perfect for a casual round and springtime hangs.

🛠️ What to Bring:
Comfortable shoes
Water bottle
Your own discs (or hire some on-site!)
No toilet facilities currently available onsite.

💚 Support the Future of Disc Golf in Kapiti
Koha (donations) will be accepted on the day.
All contributions go directly toward building a permanent nine-hole disc golf course at Pukekawa Reserve.
A suggested koha of $20 or more helps make this vision a reality — but any amount is appreciated.

No registration needed — just show up and spin!
Follow this event for updates and weather info.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wellington Street Art Bicycle Tour, Public art and artists make our streets come to life.
Murals on the tour included 'Kaiota' by Ariki Brightwell, 'Ngā Kakano' by Johnson Witehira, 'Waimapihi' by Izzy Joy, 'Trust the Process' by Miriama Grace-Smith and Fluro, 'Kia whakatōmuri te haere whakamua Te Aro' by Keri Mei Zagrobelna and Tina Rae Carter at the St James Theatre, and more. From Parliament through Te Aro to Newtown, the locations on this tour are imbued with life. Each artwork tells a story about people and place – enabling us to see our city through a different lens and appreciate the heritage of our whenua, our buildings, and the people who moved through these spaces.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Hoscar (Sept) Monthly GWDG club event, Hoscar (Sept) Monthly GWDG club event
Come and participate in the monthly (930am 1st Saturday of the month) round of Hoscar at Hikoikoi reserve Petone.

This month is the clubs designated fundraiser for the Lower Hutt region courses and also the club series event at Hikoikoi. Come and participate in both with a flexible start round of 18 for the club series and Ript revenge 18 for the fundraiser.

Hey Disc Golfers
Stay tuned for more details on the GWDG club upcoming fundraising event to help with further developments at Hikoikoi reserve and the installation of permanent baskets and tee pads at Poole Cresent reserve. None of this can be possible without the community support.
This is a weekend fundraiser put on by the Lower Hutt sub committee and will have spot prizes for participants across the weekend. Come play and have some fun with the sub committee and take on Ript Revenge.

Entry cost $10 per day so you can play Saturday or Sunday or both. Who will claim bragging rights

Coordinated by Lower Hutt sub committee in

description:
Magic: Chaos Draft Event @ Cerberus Games, The latest Magic: The Gathering set has been incredibly popular leaving us with not enough packs to run a draft of it. As such, the format for the Friday draft this week is Chaos!
Chaos Draft is just like any other Magic Draft format: get together with seven of your drafting buddies and grab three packs of cards for each drafter. The twist is that instead of drafting a normal format the packs you will receive is chosen randomly from our store selection of packs!
Here are the details:
Start Time: 6:30PM
Entry Fee: $35.00
Format: 3-Pack Chaos Draft
Prizes:
Everyone will receive 3 packs (decided randomly at the time) to draft with. Any card you draft is yours to keep!
For each player, 0.5 standard Play Boosters are added into the prize pool towards top placers per pod. Additional Promos given out for attendance.

description:
Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Monthly Life Drawing, Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Omaka Wings & Wheels 28th Sept, Daylight Savings is coming, and so is the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre's Wings & Wheels Open Day! Make sure to mark Sunday, 28th September, 2025, on your calendar to spring forward into an amazing day of aircraft and classic cars!

We have a spectacular lineup of aircraft planned from throughout history, and joy flights will be available. Re-hydrate and refuel at the Omaka Cafe and guest food outlets. Bring your picnic rugs and deck chairs, and make yourself comfortable because you won't want to leave!

And don't forget to take the opportunity to visit the two remarkable exhibitions at the Omaka Aviation Heritage Centre. Entry to both is included in your Omaka Wings & Wheels ticket. For value for money, it doesn't get any better than this!
** There will be gate sales on the day. However, we highly recommend that you pre-purchase tickets online for the best price and quickest check-in experience. **

description:
The Pantoloons: Cinderella, Glass slippers, royal balls, and a Fairy Godmother who’s still on her learner’s licence, what could possibly go wrong?

Prince Percy is hopelessly charming (emphasis on hopeless), the Queen is busy approving new royal wave techniques (it’s very hard work being a Queen!), the step-sisters are causing chaos in couture, and Buttons has big dreams!

Will true friendship win over fairy-tale romance? Will Buttons dreams come true? And who is behind the kingdom’s mysterious gossip vlog? Packed with music, mischief, and magical mayhem, this is Cinderella with a twist, a tune, and a whole lot of sparkle! Step into a spellbinding world of wonder where dreams shimmer, magic floats on the breeze, and anything is possible… but only until the clock strikes twelve!

REVIEWS FOR RED RIDING HOOD

“You guys were amazing, thank you so much. Me and the kids had an amazing time. We can’t wait for the next holidays t come see you again.”

“My kids had a blast! My little man was in hysterics at Mr Moa.”

“Love everything that you do and each time gets better and better.”

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club, Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

description:
Get Animated! Stop-motion Animation Workshop, Get Animated! Stop-motion Animation Workshop
Ever wanted to try your hand at stop-motion animation and bring inanimate objects to life? Now you can!

Join animator Steffen Kreft and storyteller and poet William Connor for a practical, hands-on workshop that will inspire and enable you to make your own magical stop-motion worlds and movies at home.

Supported by Wairarapa Library Service.

You’ll need to download an app on your smartphone, bring a desk-lamp, a snack, your fully charged smart-phone and charger, a steady hand and an open mind. All other materials provided.

Here's the (free) app to download on your smartphone:
i-Phone:
https://apps.apple.com/nz/app/stop-motion-studio/id441651297
Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.cateater.stopmotionstudio&pli=1

Ages 12 and up welcome – no prior experience required.
Places are limited to 16, so get animated!

Workshop 1-4pm, then a break, and at 5.30pm, we'll screen everyone's work.

Registration is required.
To register your interest, please email <events.waiword>.

About the tutors:

WILLIAM CONNOR
William Connor studied German, English literature, and Theatre at Victoria University in Welling-ton, where he completed his Master’s in creative writing in 2016. He lives between Berlin and Greytown, and works as a teacher, translator, editor, writer, and puppeteer. He has published numerous poems and short stories in several anthologies and journals, has written and per-formed in a number of plays that have toured New Zealand and Germany, and is the writer and cocreator of the intercultural comedy web-series Lifeswap, which explores and celebrates the differences between the German and New Zealand cultures.

STEFFEN KREFT
Steffen Kreft is an animation film director, illustrator, marionette maker and puppeteer. He was born in Münster, Germany and is currently living in Greytown in the Wairarapa.
When he first moved to New Zealand in 2007, he did his Masters in design at Massey University and co-founded the animation company National Park Studios in 2010. He taught design, animation and puppet making at Massey University and The Learning Connexion. In 2012, he directed and organised the Greytown Arts Festival and directed and made marionettes for the award winning adult puppet show “The Kitchen at the End of the World”. In 2014, Steffen and his partner William moved to Berlin for a few years where they started the popular animated web series Lifeswap about the cultural differences between New Zealand and Germany.
Now, he spends his time making short films for organisations like the French/German TV channel Arte, several New Zealand ministries, German museums and start-up companies or creates giant puppets and mesmerising marionette shows for festivals. He is also building a beautiful tiny house on wheels – apparently his most creatively challenging as well as satisfying project yet.
He has a passion for making things with his hands and while his projects are so varied, he can be very proud of the attention to detail that is obvious in all of his work.

</events.waiword>

description:
Karanga taonga, karanga tangata, karanga whenua |Reversing Cultural Amnesia: Activating Māori Practice in Museums, In 1947, Māori leader, politician, and scholar Apirana Ngata spoke to his scholarly peers at the Polynesian Society, announcing his greatest desire to revive Māori culture as a living force within communities, not be relegated to dead exhibits in museums (Ramsden 1948, 85).
This lecture acknowledges the concerns of visionary leaders and champions of cultural practice and their activation within museums. Through her work as a Māori curator, writer, cultural practitioner and post-doctoral researcher, Awhina Tamarapa advocates for cultural restoration as a form of liberation in a museum context. In her research, Tamarapa is exploring strategies for the recovery and reclamation of taonga puoro (singing treasures) and karetao (animated storytellers) for new generations.
There are challenges regarding taonga held by overseas museums. Concepts such as keeping taonga warm, and mana taonga, recognises the connection and authority of descendants to their taonga, that underpin this work.
The focus on the reclamation of Indigenous practice has been bolstered by working with First Nations, Canada BC. Led by Professor Bryony Onciul, University of Exeter, UK, Tamarapa was privileged to be part of a research project “The Future of Indigenous Rights and Responsibilities: Ancestral governance, environmental stewardship, language revival, and cultural vibrancy” funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK.
_________
The Michael Volkerling Lecture series is a partnership event with the Museum and Heritage Studies programme at Te Herenga Waka | Victoria University of Wellington, National Services Te Paerangi and Te Papa Tongarewa. This annual public lecture series recognises the legacy of the late Dr Michael Volkerling who was one of the principal architects of New Zealand's cultural and creative sectors.

Pre-order my new book! Homegrown Fruit: A Practical Guide, Pre-order your copy of the book, then come along to Firebird on the 28th and pick it up. I'll sign it, and then we'll settle in for a book chat about 3.15.
Coffee + cake for sale.
Jason and I are so proud of this book! Were stoked to get this practical, useful information out there, and give you the tools to be an epic fruit gardener.
"A book for those who love growing their own fruit, or who want to learn how to do it or do it better – no matter your garden size. It covers it all – where to start, what to look for, what is suitable for your area, how to prep, how to look after and train – you name it, it is in here. A must have and a keeper." Fiona Eadie, author of 100 Best Native Plants for New Zealand Gardens

description:
WellyForge#4, 17th Sept 2025, Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
The September event is sponsored by Diana Minnee and Astronort and will have two main talks & Q/A from Wellington-based:
Matt Hayter, Founder & President of Projectworks, HITECH Emerging Company of the Year, who raised over $12m at a valuation of over $100m in 2025.
Dave Shoemack, CEO of Goodnature, Wellington Gold Supreme winner 2025.
We'll also have 3 short talks from Wellington-based:
Viv Baartman, CEO of Uunafit, custom-made clothing design, Wellington Gold Innovation winner 2025.
Joanna Struthers, CEO of legal start-up Navigater
Roydon Goldstack, PhD at Vic looking at emotion & bodily activity and "Using Generative AI to create Emotional Human Characters"
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness

Let’s send winter off with a flurry of fun and frosty smiles! ❄️

description:
Miramar Night Market, Miramar Night Market
Summer is on its way and there is no better way to celebrate than with the Miramar Night Market!

Join us on Saturday, 22 November 2025 from 3pm - 8pm to meet talented local artists and crafters from across the Wellington Region, selling their gorgeous products including:

• Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings
• Jewellery
• Clothing, bags and accessories
• Crochet & knitted toys
• Scented candles
• Homewares & soft furnishings
• Children & baby items
• Skincare, cosmetics, soaps & natural products
• Gifts & treasures
• Resin items
• Crystals
• Wooden & metal works
• Ceramics & pottery
• Pet accessories
• Carvings & sculptures
• Wool products
• Much much more!

Food trucks / stalls, coffee carts and entertainment for all to enjoy, while relaxing on the back lawn and watching the kids play on the playground!

Each stall will have either cash or eftpos facilities available, however it is best to bring cash to the market too.

This is a great opportunity to make the most of that last minute Christmas shopping, with one-of-a-kind gifts, decorations, and treats from some of Wellington's most talented crafters and artists!

A selection of Christmas music will get you in the festive mood to enjoy the atmosphere. This is a night, not to be missed!

Rising Star: A Drag Competition (Heat 3), Welcome to "Rising Star," the hottest drag competition in Wellington - where the spotlight is on, the outfits are sparkling and the competition is FIERCE!
Join us as we embark on a journey where charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent collide as we search for Wellington's next "Rising Star".
We don't just have contestants; we have visionaries, trailblazers, and the future icons of the drag world performing their absolute hearts out for you all.

description:
Radio Hauraki 'The Big Show' • Beervana Warm Up Show, We’re going BIG to warm up for the BIGGEST beer weekend in the capital.
Next Thursday, @radiohaurakinz are bringing The Big Show to Lyall Bay - broadcasting their @beervananz Warm-Up Show live from Parrotdog Bar.
Roll in early to score one of 100 FREE Backbone Tees and hang with The Big Show crew. Then pull up a stump for a cold pint of Parrotdog, perfectly paired with dinner from two Wellington food icons – @oikoshellenic and @tommytomato.
@oikoshellenic will be serving charcoal-grilled chicken, slow-cooked lamb, and charred eggplant, all tucked into their house-made pita.
@tommytomato will be firing up the @gozney for slices of hot, crispy pizza.
On the sounds we have DJ Karl Gebbie.
On tap we’ll be pouring our brand-new Alcoholic Ginger Beer, alongside all the usual suspects.
See you next week!
#parrotdogbar #haurakinz #thebigshow #beervanawarmup #nice

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!

description:
A Good Time to Sing!, There is so much going on in the world right now, and that can be overwhelming! Now is a good time to sing. A good time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.

Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.

Spend the day at the serene sanctuary that is the Home of Compassion in Island Bay and restore yourself.

We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy.

And for the perfect finishing touch, a delicious lunch and morning tea are all included. All you need to do is come along!

Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands.
