description:
Social Sewing Saturday - October, Social Sewing Saturday - October
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts!

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Special event - Herd Bathing, A Sharing of my horse herd in a unique experience - enjoying being in amongst a gentle herd of horses and sharing the afternoon, just being together.
Join me for a peaceful experience of being among my 8 horses. Soaking up their special presence, enjoying the country sounds while having a moment away from our busy lives. A moment to slow everything down and connect with a horse in a very different way.
(No horse experience necessary. )
This is 1 hour event, after a safety briefing we will enter the herds space, down by the river. There will be seats available or you can bring your own.
$50 per person, max 8 people in one sitting.
You will be in amongst 8 horses so wear appropriate clothing for the weather, and good footwear ie warm jackets and closed shoes/gumboots. Welcome to bring a blanket to keep warm. Will be postponed if weather isn’t suitable.
Looking forward to this

Message me to register

description: Takatāpui Kōrerorero - Panel Discussion with Utu ā Matimati Takatāpui Art Collective, Our panel of artists from Utu ā Matimati Takatāpui Art Collective will discuss elements of our kaupapa, inspired by our latest magazine. Topics of decolonizing mental health and art spaces within this modern world and society, the importance of our existence as takatāpui and how visibility and solidarity are integral to surviving in this political climate. Panelists include: Kauri Waihoea, Piripi Mackie / Misty Frequency, Story Hemi-Morehouse and facilitated by Taranaki Ah Young-Grace.

Create Your Own Bird of The Year Merch!, Create Your Own Bird of The Year Merch!
Bird of the Year is back for 2025! Show us who you're backing with our crafty merch station!

Show your colours by creating your own BOTY2025 campaign merch! Whether it’s a “Kiwi 4 Me” flag, “Vote Kākā” bunting, or a “Hihi for BOTY” sticker, get the word out there and support your favourite manu/bird!

Local artists Margaret Tolland and Tayla Hartemink supply the materials for these free events and guide tamariki/kids in creating their very own campaign merch to take home. You can even bring your own shirt, cap, or other cloth item to decorate! All ages are welcome.

This workshop will be held in the Visitor Centre Foyer, normal admission to the sanctuary applies.

Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne is delighted to be the Campaign Manager for kiwi in the 2025 Bird of the Year competition, and spot prizes are up for grabs for the best kiwi merch!

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Haunted Hop | Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl | Friday, October 31st, The Haunted Hop | Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl | Friday, October 31st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Crawl in Wellington on Friday, Oct 31st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event
https://vimeo.com/1111730489?share=copy


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the craziest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join The Haunted Hop - Halloween Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, 2025, and access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, Cavern Club, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're creepy, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be a part of on Halloween night.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your ghouls and take over the city with The Haunted Hop Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Haunted Hop Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and make Halloween a night to remember!


🚨 Get Your Haunted Hop 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this Haunted Hop Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
Cavern Club
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 22 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:





🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀




A SPOOKTACULAR HAUNTED HOP PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

Meet the Candidates, hosted by Cycle Wellington and Bicycle Junction, Meet the Candidates, hosted by Cycle Wellington and Bicycle Junction
Please register,for free, at https://events.humanitix.com/meet-the-candidates-cycling-edition so we know how many people are coming.
How people get around our city and suburbs is a critical issue for Wellington.
Safe public spaces is core Council business. We believe that a network of protected bike lanes is an essential part of a safe and modern city that seeks to attract growth businesses and their staff. Wellington has made good progress but we need to keep going.
Hear about Council candidates' visions and plans for Wellington.
Please join members of Wellington’s cycling community for an informal meeting.

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

Summit to Sea Show, Summit to Sea Show
Join us at stall 16 for the Summit to Sea Show.

Wellington's biggest outdoor adventure show is kicking off at Brewtown on the 18th of October.

With a range of outdoor activities represented from four wheel driving, fishing, hunting, camping and of course diving.

There will be live music, giveaways and demos throughout the day. Please come along for a great day out and to support local small business like ours.

description:
World Tandem Ensemble, Some of the best and brightest composers and players of Aotearoa converge for a swinging sound: from anger to solemnity, free to bop… From the heart.
After a stint in Auckland, Wellington is returning this group the favour with a hip gig at Hackett's. Not a gig to be missed!
The World Tandem Ensemble includes Iggy Nama Ruci (alto/bari sax, flute), Isaac Randel (tenor sax), Miro Holland (rhythm section), Jack Harris (double bass), Finn McNeil (drums), and Ryan Tomov (piano/bass). The ensemble features a mix of musicians from Wellington and Auckland, with original compositions and influences from various jazz styles and beyond

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Wellington - Oh Deer!, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Wellington Brick Show 2025, Wellington's largest display of LEGO® builds is back, bigger than ever!
Mark the 13th & 14th of September in your calendar and be sure to come along to see the amazing LEGO® creations from some of NZ’s best builders. This year’s show is our biggest yet, featuring over 150 passionate exhibitors from across the country to showcase their newest, most mind-blowing LEGO® creations. From towering cities to pop culture tributes, from amazing spaceships to fanciful unicorns, we have something to inspire and amaze LEGO® fans of all ages.
Come along to Walter Nash Stadium in Lower Hutt and experience amazing LEGO® displays, interactive activities, brick pits to get creative, raffles, food trucks and much more!
When:
Saturday 13th September, 9am–5pm
Sunday 14th September, 10am–4pm
Where:
Walter Nash Centre, Lower Hutt
How much:
Adults $10
Children $7
Family ticket $28
Door sales will also be available.
Be sure to like and follow the Wellington Brick Show on Facebook and Instagram to find out more about this amazing weekend of LEGO®fun! @WBS.nz
The Wellington Brick Show is proudly brought to you by Well-LUG - Wellington LEGO® User Group. We are a group of LEGO® fans of all ages from across the lower half of the North Island. New members are always welcome. Find out more about us at www.well-lug.nz

description:
WOW Train VIP Experience ex Christchurch : SOLD OUT, Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing Friday 26 September, 2025

Beginning in Christchurch or Kaikoura, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the pacific coastline aboard the Coastal Pacific WOW Train and Interislander Ferry. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with an accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience, journeying along the coastline and over the strait past marine habitats aboard the Coastal Pacific and Interislander. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with the Gold ticket to see the World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Saturday 27 September and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train aboard the Coastal Pacific (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!) and VIP Ferry journey on the Interislander on 26 September
Onboard WOW entertainment and a goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

Toi Art Saturdays: Artist Talk with Hāriata Rōpata-Tangahoe, Discover something new in Toi Art each month – talks, performances, and activities inspired by the exhibitions on show.
Every month brings new ways to experience Toi Art. Join us for free talks, performances, and hands-on activities that connect you with the artworks and exhibitions.
This month: Kōrero pūrākau are threaded through four decades of Hāriata Rōpata-Tangahoe’s paintings, which hover between Te Ao Mārama, the world of light, and Te Pō, the realm of night and death.
Join us for this special artist talk with Hāriata and Te Papa curator Megan Tamati-Quennell, which will take place in the exhibition Kōrero Pūrākau | Telling Stories.

Get to Know Your Sony Camera, Join us for a relaxed evening in store with Sony Digital Imaging Advocate Rebecca McMillan and get hands on with the latest Sony gear.

Rebecca is Wellington-based professional photographer who has been shooting with Sony cameras for over a decade. As an award-winning, NZIPP-accredited, portrait and film stills photographer, she knows how to capture incredible images using Sony Alpha cameras and lenses!

Rebecca also runs events for the local photography community, including coffee meet-ups and photo walks.

Feel free to bring in your Sony gear on the night, or just try the equipment we have in store. Rebecca and the Photo Warehouse staff will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Everyone who registers and attends this Scene Festival event will go into the draw to win a trip to Rome! There will also be Sony spot prizes given out during the evening.

Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

Namaste

description:
[@EDA] art~hack WLG: crawl around and find out, agenda:
- 6:30 PM - 7 PM: arrivals and casual chats

- 7 PM: intro circle

- show and tells

- collabs and jams
---
want to join others in each doing our own thing? ever dream about a future where technology, nature, and society mutually support each other in harmony?
introducing art~hack wellington's weekly jam: a safe space to discover, create, and share creative solarpunk energies with other (shy & introverted) humans.
every thursday we share a mostly unstructured evening of make-believe, of hanging-out-and-ignoring-each-other, of intertwingling. bring whatever is your thing! maybe a side project, maybe a beat in your head, maybe a conversation, maybe some electronics, maybe a notebook, maybe a costume, your art can be anything.
if you're new and/or need to be let in the front door, call the number on the door or send a private message to the event host.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
LVDF tickets, “Virtuosos” (The Guardian)
International jazz supergroup LVDF bring their genre-bending, globally informed sound to New Zealand for an exclusive appearance at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
All acclaimed bandleaders in their own right, LVDF is a cross-cultural quartet featuring Myele Manzanza (NZ/UK) on drums, Alex Hitchcock (USA/UK) on saxophone, Michelangelo Scandroglio (ITALY) on double bass and special guest Daniel Hayles (NZ) on piano and synths (stepping in for Maria Chiara Argirò). Their fresh sound fuses jazz with electronic textures, global rhythms and raw improvisation.
With Wellington-raised Myele Manzanza returning from London for this special hometown performance, LVDF will perform his groundbreaking Festival commission Music for a Multi-Polar World. This bold new work explores shifting global narratives through sound and draws on events from Brexit to the conflicts in Gaza, Sudan and Congo. Manzanza reflects “I’ve noticed how much the geopolitical shifts have unsettled and angered me, as well as shifting and widening my views on the world, and giving me some things to be hopeful for amidst change.” The work channels both the uncertainty and hope of a rapidly changing world.
The set will also feature tracks from LVDF’s upcoming self-titled EP - a bold and electric statement from a group as diverse in experience as it is unified in vision.
Only in Wellington - don’t miss the debut of one of modern jazz’s most exciting new ensembles, live at Meow Nui.
Commissioned by Wellington Jazz Festival
This LVDF performance is supported by Help Musicians UK, Embassy of Italy, Wellington & Comites Nuova Zelanda
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Power of Community - Dr Amanda Cahill, "What does it take for communities to lead the renewable energy transition - not just be consulted?"
If one person is positioned well to respond to that question, it is Dr Amanda Cahill.
Goodlife Collective, Sustainability Trust and WEAll Aotearoa are proud to be co-hosting Dr Amanda Cahill, founder of The Next Economy
Don't miss this opportunity to hear Amanda's insights from her work in Australia, which demonstrate how acting on climate change can help catalyse fairer, more regenerative wellbeing economies.
Amanda has worked at the intersection of government, local councils, big companies and communities for 30 years, to support communities to transition to a thriving future.
Amanda is the Founder of The Next Economy, where she supports regional communities across Australia to manage the impacts of decarbonisation and climate change in a way that builds more equitable and regenerative economies. Most of this work has been in coal and industrial regions, where she has brought together government, industry, workers and community groups to co-design transition strategies despite deep-seated tensions. Her work draws on 30 years’ experience working with changemakers across the world to address economic and health inequalities, environmental degradation, women’s rights and climate justice.
Event Programme:
5:15pm - doors open, drinks & nibbles
5:45pm - Welcome & Introduction
6:00-6:30pm - Talk from Dr Amanda Cahill
6:40 - Dialogues & Q&A
7:00(ish!): Networking

About Sustainability Trust: Sustainability Trust are your local experts in sustainability, healthy homes, ethical electricity and supporting our local communities.
About WEAll Aotearoa: WEAll Aotearoa is a non-partisan and independent ‘think and do’ tank working to redesign Aotearoa New Zealand’s economy around the wellbeing of our people and te taiao. WEAll use an evidence-informed approach and focus upstream to develop practical, long-term solutions for the public good.

About Goodlife Collective: Goodlife Collective designs and delivers events and experiences to build connection between people, nature and valuable ideas, in service of unlocking our collective potential.
About Dr Amanda Cahill
Amanda is the Founder of The Next Economy, where she supports regional communities across Australia to manage the impacts of decarbonisation and climate change in a way that builds more equitable and regenerative economies. Most of this work has been in coal and industrial regions, where she has brought together government, industry, workers and community groups to co-design transition strategies despite deep-seated tensions. Her work draws on 30 years’ experience working with changemakers across the world to address economic and health inequalities, environmental degradation, women’s rights and climate justice.
Amanda is a Churchill Fellow and has a PhD from ANU in human geography. She is also a Research Fellow at the University of Melbourne, an Industry Fellow at the University of Sydney and a co-editor of the recently published book: Regional Energy Transitions in Australia: From impossible to possible.
About The Next Economy
Next Economy works with government, industry, investment and community to create the conditions for a rapid, responsible and fair transition to a climate-safe, regenerative and socially just Australian economy.

description:
The Dave Wilson Quintet, Dave Wilson presents his quintet in a special performance of newly arranged material from his two most recent projects: Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation (debuted in 2025), and Ephemeral (Thelonious Records, 2023).  

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like. Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, explores the transience of human relationships with one another and the natural world through alternatively floating and driving improvisatory impulses of Wilson and his ensemble.

The quintet for this performance will present the music of Free, Free and Ephemeral in a brand-new configuration: Wilson on saxophone and bass clarinet, Mana Waiariki on violin, Seth Boy on bass, Callum Allardice on guitar, and Abe Baillie on drums.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

Nam Chucks, known formally as Namnita Kumar, is a DJ, selector, MC, and long time radio host at Radio Active FM.
Few selectors in this scene see critical acclaim, but Nam Chucks is a proud recipient of the Taite Music Prize, alongside the Outstanding Music Journalism Award from NZ on air.

Nam Chucks possesses a deep appreciation and respect for Soundsystem philosophy - dedicating her musical selections to the concepts of unity and inclusivity in rave culture. Soundsystem music serves as a vessel for her to heal others, guide the dance, and respect all things sacred & indigenous.

description:
NZIFF: Mirrors No. 3, In the wake of a traumatic incident, a young woman forms a surrogate mother-daughter relationship with her rescuer. As emotional walls come down, doubts arise: is there more to the care offered than simple kindness?

Laura and Betty seem to be poles apart. Laura, a young, city dwelling music student, lives in an apartment with her boyfriend; Betty has an adult son and lives alone in rural Germany. Their lives are thrown together after a car accident leaves Laura in the care of the older woman. Despite ostensible differences, each recognises a familiar melancholy in the other. As a tentative trust grows, the women find something unlocking within themselves, even as complicating factors emerge, in the form of Betty’s opaque family situation.

Master dramatist Christian Petzold reunites with frequent acting collaborator Paula Beer (Transit, Undine, Afire) and regular DOP Hans Fromm, turning his pen and camera to a smaller scale domestic drama. Mirrors No. 3 (named for a Ravel piano piece played within) makes visual and thematic echoes back to Petzold’s previous work: from extended bike rides down rural lanes (Barbara), to the centrality of a piano (Phoenix), as well as the thread of mysterious tension that underlies them all. The film revels in the messy, stimulating complexities of human relationships, exploring the way that sometimes even questionable motivations can affect positive outcomes. — Jacob Powell
label: Film & Media

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.
label: Business & Networking

📅 Date: Thursday, 11 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Kapiti Botanist Market, Kāpiti Coast, Get Ready – The Botanist Market is Coming to You!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$25***
Limited door sales for $30
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
Careers Without Borders 2025, 🗓️ When: 5:30-8:00pm, Wednesday 17 September 
📍 Where: RHLH1, Rutherford House, Pipitea Campus
The event will run as follows:
5:30–5:40 pm: Opening Remarks
5:40–6:10 pm: MFAT Panel
6:20–6:50 pm: Breakout Session 1 (choice of 3 panels)
7:00–7:30 pm: Breakout Session 2 (choice of 3 panels)
7:30–8:00 pm: Light Catering & Networking 🍕
Following the MFAT panel, the three specialised panels from which students can choose to attend two include: Trade & Commerce, International Development, and Defence & Security.
The following are our confirmed speakers for each panel:
MFAT: James Lester (Senior Policy Officer, Middle East & Africa Division; former WTO posting, Trade Law Adviser), Thandiwe Keet (Niue Desk Officer; previously NZ-UKFTA & IPETCA roles), and Anya Donohue (Deputy Secretary’s Office, Pacific & Development Group).
Trade & Commerce: Ailish Dodd and Brenna Burch (Wellington Chamber of Commerce, International Engagement Officers), Phil Quinn (MBIE, International Trade Negotiator), and Gregor Thompson (Business Desk, Economic Affairs Writer).
International Development: Peter Scott (Former Disaster Management Delegate to Tonga; current Pacific Programmes Lead). Additional speakers TBC.
Defence & Security: Ministry of Defence representative and Kevin Moar (Director of National Security Policy, DPMC). Additional speakers TBC.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Not Your Nana's Craft Market - R18 Art and Craft Market, *Strictly R18*
Are you ready for a unique and thrilling experience? Look no further! We invite you to the most captivating event of the year - the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!

What to Expect
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Join Us!

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less

description:
StudyTime NCEA Revision Workshops, The upcoming October school holidays are a golden opportunity. While rest is important, these two weeks can also be used wisely to build momentum, fill knowledge gaps, and reduce stress heading into exam leave.
That’s where our holiday workshops come in. After a hiatus, Inspiration Education, in collaboration with StudyTime, is running NCEA Level 2 and 3 revision workshops from 1-3 October at Wellington Girls’ College.
Each session is two hours long and covers an entire external/topic, giving students the chance to:
Go over all the key content they’ll need for the exam
Learn exactly what the exam will be testing
Pick up strategies for tackling the harder Merit and Excellence questions
Receive a workbook to use in the session and keep for revision afterwards
Ask questions and get support from experienced tutors who’ve been through it all before
Why Attend?
These workshops are designed to:
Fill any gaps in knowledge
Build exam confidence
Kickstart motivation heading into Term 4
Spaces are limited and workshops often sell out quickly. Register now to secure your spot and head into exams feeling prepared, confident, and ready to succeed.

description:
Laura Collins and the Big Blues Band, Laura Collins, known for her soulful vocal delivery and upfront entertainment brings a show with a ‘whole lot of brass’. Expect blues, soul, boogie and swing, you’ll hear Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Fats Domino, Ray Charles and more. The emphasis is on having a hugely good time, with the brass enabling the dynamic energy to be turned up to 10!

Laura is joined by some of her long-time Wellington based musical companions, Wayne Mason, Kiwi music icon, being utilised here in his capacity as a master of boogie keys, John O’Connor on sublime lead guitar, George Barris and Richard Te One bringing a powerhouse rhythm section. Adding that soulful uplift, the brass /horn section are Manawatu locals, James Tait Jamieson (saxophone), Craig Collis (trombone) and Neville Lauridsen (trumpet).

Get your bling on and come out for a blast! We will be!

description:
Queensgate Night Market, What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

description:
Spring Flowers In Watercolour - 2 Day Painting Workshop, Watercolour is an ideal medium for painting flowers using hard and soft edges to build the form of the petals. Tutor, Charlotte Hird, will demonstrate with beautiful bright colours and wet in wet technique for rich smooth backgrounds.

Charlotte uses an overhead camera projected onto a 55 inch TV for easy step by step instruction.

This workshop is for intermediate to advanced watercolour painters.

Bring your own watercolour paints, palette, brushes, and four Quarter sheets or four A3 sheets each of good quality 100% cotton 300gsm watercolour cold pressed or hot pressed paper.

One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

description:
Kapiti Crop Swap WAIKANAE, Kapiti Crop Swap WAIKANAE
THIS INVITE IS FOR THE WAIKANAE SWAP😁🌱
Everyone is welcome to our CROP SWAP meetings!
1st Saturday of the month – Otaki (1-2pm)
2nd Saturday of the month – Raumati (1-2pm)
3rd Saturday of the month – Pukerua Bay (3-4pm)
4th Saturday of the month – Waikanae (2-3pm)
To be clear, at Crop Swap, we swap more than just crops! We share everything homegrown and homemade: Vegetables, fruits, herbs, plants, seedlings, flowers, seeds, baking, preserves, sauces, jam and all things yummy! You can also bring everything garden and kitchen related like empty containers, tools, labels, planting pots, worm juice, coffee grounds, gardening magazines, cook books, recipes, a SKILL…possibilities are endless.
The key is that this is a cashless event, no koha can offered or accepted.
This is generally how a Crop Swap will run:
2-2.15pm
• People arrive with their crops and put them out on the tables provided.
• You are then free to chat and mingle with your fellow garden enthusiasts, exchange tips, make new friends or just wait until it starts.
2.15-2.45pm
• We conduct a quick briefing outlining the guidelines for swapping.
• If there is not a lot of people, we can listen to anyone who wants to introduce their crop.
• Once everyone has placed their crops we like to do a Karakia to bless the kai. We want to emphasise our values regarding generous giving and mindful taking.
2.45-3pm
• Close out, put away tables and clear the hall.
The meetings will be held regularly on the 2nd Saturday of every month in Raumati and the last Saturday of every month in Waikanae.
Further information:
1. There will be a koha food box for anyone who wants to donate food or seedlings in addition to their swaps. The Crop Swap team will distribute any koha crop and left over crops to local food pantries.
2. If you do not have any crops to swap but need fresh fruit or veges for the next week, you can bring plants, flowers, seedlings, herbs, eggs, preserves, jams, baking, liquid manure, gardening books, magazines, planting containers, sometimes even chooks who need a new home! We want this to be accessible to everyone, especially those who are struggling to put fresh fruit and veges on the table!

description:
Sofa Session with Frida & Na'amah, See Frida Flacks and Na'amah Cheiban live in the comfort of Wellington's favourite community living room for an afternoon of harmonies, soul and original music.
~
Na’amah Cheiban is an Auckland-based singer-songwriter, session musician, teacher, and co-founder of Wāhine In Jazz. A graduate of the University of Auckland’s jazz programme, her music reflects the raw honesty of navigating relationships, faith, and mental health in her 20s. With solo guitar and soft, alluring vocals, she crafts intimate jazz-folk songs layered with lyrical melodies and intricate grooves.
~
Frida Flacks, a rising voice from Wellington’s scene, draws inspiration from artists like Lianne La Havas and Melody Gardot. A graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, she blends harmony, improvisation, and melodic textures to create performances that feel dreamlike and ever-changing.
~
After first collaborating at the 2024 Wellington Jazz Festival, Na’amah and Frida have built a close artistic bond. Their voices blend together like honey, offering audiences an experience both soulful and comforting—a warm embrace of harmony to start your festival weekend.

description:
From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday, From Pemberley to Pipitea: Celebrating Jane Austen's 250th Birthday
Marking 250 years since Austen’s birth this romp through her irreverent Juvenilia is spliced with deliciously pompous gems from Aotearoa’s earliest newspapers.

From the drawing rooms of Georgian England to the dusty streets of Victorian Wellington – the pretensions of polite society never change.

To mark 250 years since the birth of Jane Austen, her wildly funny Juvenilia is brought to life, including The Beautifull Cassandra, The History of England, Love and Friendship – and more.

Between Austen’s sharpest barbs you’ll hear genuine gems from New Zealand’s early newspapers, courtesy of Papers Past: gossip, pomposity, early etiquette advice, and scandalous society mishaps.

The result? A sparkling, one hour romp proving that the absurdities of status, marriage and manners travel across oceans, continents and centuries.

Performed as a series of readings with lightning character swaps, sly narration, and just a hint of scandal, this is Austen as you’ve never heard her: young, bold, and perfectly at home in 19th century Wellington!


Booking is REQUIRED.
Cost: $25
Booking information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/from-pemberley-to-pipitea-celebrating-jane-austens-250th-birthday/


Health & Safety
Please contact the event host for health & safety information.

description:
The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!, The Annual Celebration of Monty Python Day!
And now for something completely different…
Prepare yourself for a day of absurd antics, ridiculous competitions, and nonsensical fun as The Bond Store descends into Monty Python–inspired mayhem.

💰 Entry is FREE!
But to join the day’s silliness, games, and glorious nonsense, we will be asking for a donation to Kāpiti Golf for Good – a Lions & Rotary initiative.

👑 Gather your knights, twits, and lumberjacks for:

🕺 The Ministry of Silly Walks Competition

🩸 The Black Knight’s Limb Toss (just a flesh wound)

🎩 The Upper-Class Twit of the Year Race

🐴 The Two-Person Coconut Horse Race

🌲 The Lumberjack Song Karaoke (he’s okay!)

🧠 The Monty Python Quiz (bring your brain, or a dead parrot)

🏆 Prizes to be won, dignity to be lost.

But that’s not all! Beware of French guards at the gate, pop into the Argument Tent (“This isn’t an argument!”), and expect confusion, silliness, and possibly a Spanish Inquisition (though nobody expects that).

Plus: Market stalls and Monty Python–themed drinks at the bar.

Plus Steve Poulton live music from 4.30pm.

So grab your coconuts and gallop to The Bond Store for a day you won’t forget (no matter how hard you try).

Kindly stuff your pockets with good old-fashioned cash (none of that funny monopoly money) to hurl generously at the ‘Golf is Good’ charity in exchange for your entry into the day’s utterly ridiculous games

WE ARE LOOKING FOR TEAMS AND INDIVIDUALS TO ENTER THE EVENTS - IF YOU ARE KEEN - YOU NEED TO BE QUICK:

a BIG THANK YOU!! to Coastlands for sponsoring great prizes for the day!

description:
The Mad Hatter's Market Express, The Mad Hatter's Market Express

Journey with Steam Inc on this return trip to the Woodville Mad Hatter's Market Day!

Bring the family up into the heart of the Manawatu on the steam train, and enjoy a fun filled day at Woodville's famed Mad Hatter's Market Day. Hauled by Ja 1271, our 1956 built steam locomotive. Join the train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin or Palmerston North. Upon arrival at Woodville, there is the option to walk up to the square, or travel by shuttle bus up.

Woodville 150th Mad Hatter's Day
Since 2017, the local Woodville community have hosted this special event in the heart of the township celebrating all thing's 'mad'! Bring the kids along for a children's tea party and old time games - with a particular focus on steampunk. Featuring live music, over 70 market stalls and most importantly - the annual Crazy Hat Competition! Last year, people on our train took away 1st place!

Spot prizes are to be given out throughout the day for best costumes and hats, and an array of vouchers will also be up for grabs!

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage number and seating allocations at the ready.

Please note that if booking online, our booking system does add on a small percentage to the above fares. Steam Incorporated does not see this revenue.

Mad Hatters Menu
The wonderful team has put together an array of food trucks for all to enjoy at the market, and you can also support the local cafes of Woodville township. There will also be tea/coffee available on board the train, along with some alcoholic beverages and light snacks.

We can cater for larger group bookings - these are best dealt with directly through us by emailing admin@steaminc.org.nz or contacting 0800 783 264.

Book the Mad Hatters Market Express!
All seating is reserved and allocated on these special experiences. Prior booking is essential.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

description:
Michelangelo — A Different View, There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Wellington Knife Show, The Wellington Knife Show
Coming to Brewtown this October – The Wellington Knife Show!

Join us for a celebration of craftsmanship as knife makers from across New Zealand gather to showcase their finest work.

Browse a stunning range of handmade kitchen knives, hunting blades, swords, and more. Enjoy free entry, live demonstrations throughout the day—including forging, blade grinding, leatherwork, and sharpening.

More details coming soon – mark your calendar!

*Contact Stackhouse Knives if you'd like to be apart of the event
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Food Truck Friday at The Bond Store!, Food Truck Friday at The Bond Store!
Imagine all your favourite food trucks gathered in one spot (The Bond Store), ready to serve up delicious feasts. After you’ve made your choice, unwind in our cozy outdoor or indoor area with a refreshing drink to complement your meal.

✨ Food trucks + gin = the perfect Friday treat! ✨

Join us for an incredible lineup of culinary delights, featuring:

Hot Wafel

Las Fridas

Lalies

Treat yourself to a delightful night off from cooking and indulge in a feast that’ll satisfy every craving.

description:
Earth, The Wellington Youth Orchestra, Wellington Youth Sinfonietta and Wellington Youth Choir are joining forces for a one-of-a-kind concert at the Michael Fowler Centre on Sunday, October 19. This unique collaboration promises an unforgettable afternoon of music you won't want to miss.
The performers will be playing music by Runestad, Mantyjarvi, Hopkins, Rameka, Thomas, and Schubert. Wellington Youth Orchestra's concerto competition winner Solace Ward will perform the Ritchie Concerto for Viola and Orchestra.
Earth
Tickets are ON SALE NOW!

Don't miss your chance to be part of the action — grab yours today on Ticketmaster before they're gone!
https://www.ticketmaster.co.nz/ear.../event/2400631B8EEB1209
#WYOEarth #TicketsOnSale #DontMissOut

description: Wellington Film Critics Circle: 'Parasite' Screening & Discussion, The Wellington Film Critics Circle is hosting a screening of Bong Joon-ho's 'Parasite,' followed by a lively discussion on its themes, direction, and cultural impact. This is a great opportunity to engage with other film lovers and share your thoughts on this modern classic.
label: Film & Media

description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair, Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Underground Arts + Thrift market SEPT EDITION, Underground Arts + Thrift market SEPT EDITION
That's right, we are back spooky creatures! Te whanganui a tara's original spooky and weird market is happening!

If you make it, and it's weird, we want to know about it! We welcome all the underground community, goth, punk, alternative, queer, metal, whatever and however you express yourself, we have space for you. Doesn't matter if you are fresh to creating, an up and comer or well established. This market is focused on community and celebration of it.

Have some weird and wonderful objects, stuff and things you no longer need? We have space for you too!

located inside the Newtown school hall and runs parallel the the Newtown vege market on a sat.

get in quick! we always book out!

description:
The Waikanae Beach Monthly Indoor Market, Enjoy a Sunday outing with your family by visiting this great Community Market where you will discover handmade treasures and local creativity by highly talented stallholders where every piece tells a story.

You will find a huge variety of quality items and GIFTS plus local natural Honey, Prenzels, Oils and Sauces.

Bring the Kids along so they can meet local author Michael Peryer and view his latest Children's Adventure Books. Jane will also be there with her hand made Crochet Toys along with Helen and her incredible range of Children's Dress Ups and Dolls Clothes.

Meet up with Friends and enjoy a day out on the Kapiti Coast and visit this great friendly Community Market then spend the rest of the day at other events and attractions including a visit to our awesome cafes.

Don't miss it... support local!

description: Young Flame, Young Flame is a dining experience inspired by fire. Think fire show and flaming cocktail on arrival to then dine surrounded by hundreds of flickering candles casting a warm glow, for an evening of fine finesse. QT Wellington’s Executive Chef, Antoine Collet, delivers a bold three-course chef’s tasting menu that’s as deliciously playful as it is refined. And if you like the finer things in life, while devouring each course you'll sip on beer & wine to your heart's desire and let the sultry sounds of live music weave through the room, adding a touch of old-school glamour to your night. Young Flame promises an evening steeped in elemental elegance.

description:
Upper Hutt Night Market, Upper Hutt Night Market
The Upper Hutt Night Market returns to RACE Trentham for an unforgettable evening.

This vibrant community event promises an exciting evening of entertainment, artisan crafts and delectable food options for attendees of all ages.

Over 80 artisan craft stalls will showcase the talent and creativity of local artists. Attendees will have the opportunity to browse and purchase a wide range of unique handmade products, including artwork, jewellery, candles, home decor, plants, clothing and much more.

To satisfy the appetites of hungry visitors, the Upper Hutt Night Market will also feature over 20 carefully selected food trucks offering a diverse range of culinary delights. From international cuisines to local favourites, attendees can indulge in a variety of mouthwatering dishes, ensuring there is something to satisfy every palate.

At the heart of the event will be the sensational sounds of The Shenanigans, a local band renowned for their energetic performances. Their lively melodies and infectious tunes will grace the sound stage, ensuring a memorable night filled with music and joy.

Vendors can apply to sell via this link : https://membership.raceinc.co.nz/Vendors/07-11-2025

description:
Fundraiser - Seaweed and Ocean-inspired Art Sale at the South Coast Arts Trail, Purchase ocean-inspired art and support marine conservation!
Seaweed and ocean-inspired artworks by Explore Your Coast Founder Nicole Miller will be on show at the 2025 South Coast Arts Trail in Island Bay, 13 & 14 September 2025 (10am to 4pm).
Nicole will be at the Presbyterian Church both days with the immersive 360° video tours of Wellington's Blue Belt and Taputeranga Marine Reserve. Come along, experience Wellington's underwater world, and be inspired to dive into our local marine reserve!
All profits from artworks sold support the marine conservation and outreach initiatives of Explore Your Coast.

Weekend Shenanigans, Spring is well and truly here, so lets 'spring' into another epic line up here at DVB HQ! Check out below what we have in store:
Wednesday- We're back open from 3pm with our first NEW BEER ALERT! Keep an eye out on socials for more info, and don't forget we have another Mid Month Open Mic kicking off at 6:30pm! Try your hand on the stage or come check out the local talent!

description:
Wairarapa Farmers' Market, The Wairarapa Farmers’ Market is held every Saturday from 9am to 1pm (rain or shine!) at the Solway Showgrounds Masterton. Entry is off State Highway 2 or the by pass, onto Judds Rd. There is plenty of car parking and a camping ground for NZMCA Members

Picnic tables are situated underneath the majestic Redwood Tree for you to sit and enjoy a coffee and something to eat while listening to live music. Plus you get to take home quality, delicious produce grown seasonally within the Wairarapa region. It makes for a great morning's outing.

Enjoy breakfast, brunch or lunch and pick up your dinner items with locally produced coffee, eggs, meat, berries, bread, jam, fruit, olive oil, pastries, pies, pickles, slices, cakes, soup, vegetables and more. Shop for plants, seedlings, seaweed, artisan goods including wood turning, Māori weaving, children’s and baby clothes, aprons, peg aprons, tea towels, knitted and crochet toys and hand dyed knitting wools.
Sign up for our regular Wairarapa Farmers' Market newsletter here https://mailchi.mp/d99e1ad65a18/newsletter-sign-up or join us on Facebook to get updates on all the Market goodness! Dogs are welcome to the market and a dog bowl can be provided. See you on Saturday!

"From Paddock to Plate Since 2006"

description:
Wellington City Libraries' Clawsome Annual Book Sale, 26–29 Sept 2025 | 10am–4pm
St Patrick’s College Hall, Kilbirnie
There’ll be everything from tall tails and non-fiction to pukapuka for the kids so it’s a purrfect time to start, or maybe complete, your own collection. Pre-loved, good condition items are sold as is, with no refunds.
Sale tables are replenished more often than a cat licks its whiskers, so you’ll want to keep coming back…just like the proverbial cat.
We’re feline generous - with some items priced from as low as 50 cents. Others are between $1−$5 or individually marked. Cash and Eftpos payment options are available.
The hall is accessible and reasonably close to buses, with parking on-site and on-street.
Avid, curious, and occasional readers - everyone is welcome. See you at the book sale!
