description:
LVDF tickets, “Virtuosos” (The Guardian)
International jazz supergroup LVDF bring their genre-bending, globally informed sound to New Zealand for an exclusive appearance at the Wellington Jazz Festival.
All acclaimed bandleaders in their own right, LVDF is a cross-cultural quartet featuring Myele Manzanza (NZ/UK) on drums, Alex Hitchcock (USA/UK) on saxophone, Michelangelo Scandroglio (ITALY) on double bass and special guest Daniel Hayles (NZ) on piano and synths (stepping in for Maria Chiara Argirò). Their fresh sound fuses jazz with electronic textures, global rhythms and raw improvisation.
With Wellington-raised Myele Manzanza returning from London for this special hometown performance, LVDF will perform his groundbreaking Festival commission Music for a Multi-Polar World. This bold new work explores shifting global narratives through sound and draws on events from Brexit to the conflicts in Gaza, Sudan and Congo. Manzanza reflects “I’ve noticed how much the geopolitical shifts have unsettled and angered me, as well as shifting and widening my views on the world, and giving me some things to be hopeful for amidst change.” The work channels both the uncertainty and hope of a rapidly changing world.
The set will also feature tracks from LVDF’s upcoming self-titled EP - a bold and electric statement from a group as diverse in experience as it is unified in vision.
Only in Wellington - don’t miss the debut of one of modern jazz’s most exciting new ensembles, live at Meow Nui.
Commissioned by Wellington Jazz Festival
This LVDF performance is supported by Help Musicians UK, Embassy of Italy, Wellington & Comites Nuova Zelanda
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Lecrae - Reconstruction World Tour NZ | Wellington, Lecrae - Reconstruction World Tour NZ | Wellington
4x GRAMMY® Award-winning artist, author, actor and activist Lecrae has formally announced his headlining tour, ‘Reconstruction World Tour,’ on the heels of unveiling the release date for his tenth studio album, Reconstruction, due August 22nd.

Tickets will be available starting with an artist presale beginning Wed, July 30 at 10am local time. Additional presales will run throughout the week ahead of the general on sale beginning Fri, August 1 at 10am local at lecrae.com/tour.

Making his anticipated return to the stage, the tour will mark one-year since Lecrae’s last outing in 2024 for ‘The Final Church Clothes Tour!’ The fan favorite is slated to perform songs from his decorated catalog, as well as music from his upcoming album Reconstruction.

Beyond the music, Lecrae has fostered a direct relationship with his local community. Last Monday (July 21), the Grammy-winner held a back-to-school drive in the heart of Atlanta alongside nonprofit City Takers. With over 100+ people in attendance, both fans and residents alike joined Lecrae in assembling backpacks filled with essential school supplies for students across the city.

As a special treat to fans, Lecrae revealed the features on Reconstruction with a one-of-a-kind mailer that went out to 1,000 of his most active supporters. Each mailer included a handwritten note from the Reach Records founder, and a QR code linking to The Workshop – an online community where fans can access early music, content, and engage to earn points for incentives.

Continuing his mission of bringing Christ to the culture, he now gears up to make international headlines with his renewed stage presence, ultimately setting the tone for an unstoppable and intentional run. The announcement also heralds the arrival of Lecrae’s forthcoming album Reconstruction – his first solo project since 2022’s Church Clothes 4 LP.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Volunteer Info Evening- 2/57 Willis Street, Are you ready to make waves in conservation?
Join Mountains to Sea Wellington on our journey to restore and protect our marine and freshwater environments.
This information evening will give anyone interested in volunteering with us an opportunity to hear all about our volunteer programme and meet the MTSW crew.
There are lots of ways you can help us at MTSW! Are you into photography? Do you make a mean cuppa? Love to snorkel? Love to talk about marine critters? Nau mai, haere mai! We’d love your help! In return, we promise you a summer of adventure and fun times.
You're welcome to join us anytime from 5pm, there will be a short presentation at 5.15pm, followed by drinks and kai. There will be Mountains to Sea Wellington Staff onsite, as well as some of our current volunteers who'll be able to give you the inside word on what it's like to volunteer with us!
We’ll be in the Silver Lining Room at 2/57 Willis Street. Entrance is via the lifts in the alleyway to the left of Unity Books, take the lift to level 2.
RSVP HERE: https://forms.gle/URvGHkFxRmEmALgq8 so we know how much pizza to order!
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Messie - *New Show*, Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills, has announced additional dates for the TEETH TOUR, now performing DJ sets in Gisborne and Christchurch, with an additional All Night Long date added in Wellington due to high demand. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’, which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.

Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying All Night Long sets in Auckland and Wellington until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, 13 September, will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, for a sold-out show on 20 September. She’ll return for a second San Fran show on Friday, 26 September, before continuing the TEETH TOUR at Gisborne’s Smash Palace on Friday, 7 November, and Christchurch’s Hide Club on Saturday, 8 November.

MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East already this year, there is no slowing her down.
label: Music & Concerts

Love Shack 80's Super Band - SOLWAY MASTERTON, Love Shack 80's Super Band - SOLWAY MASTERTON
After lifting the roof off at their last Wairarapa show, come and party with 80's Super Band 'Love Shack' as they bring their Ultimate 80's party show back to the region with a live show at Solway Masterton Friday 26th September -

Come and join us for the best night out in Decades!

Tickets on sale from Eventfinda

Show 26th September
Doors from 7.30pm
Show starts 8.00pm

Playing songs by The B52's, Prince, INXS, Blondie, David Bowie, Billy Idol, Peter Gabriel, The Eurythmics, Devo, Tina Turner, The Pretenders, INXS, Queen, Katrina and The Waves, The Mockers, ICEHOUSE, Stevie Nicks and Tom Petty, Coconut Rough, UB40, U2 and lots more.

Love Shack features some of New Zealand's finest and most experienced musicians. Including Tui nominated and NZ charting artists, session muso's, hired guns and Diva's who have drawn on all their years of experience to create a magic live music show that will help you relive the great days of dancing the night away & rocking out to your favourite 80's bands

The band are

Lynley Christoffersen - Vocals
Hamish Graham - Vocals and guitar
Rob Joass - Lead guitar
Cameron Crawford - Keys
Miklin Halstead - Bass guitar
Vinnie McParland - Drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Waikanae Artisan Craft Market (28/9/25), Waikanae Artisan Craft Market (28/9/25)
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event on Kapiti Coast at Waikanae Memorial Hall. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Messie - *New Show*, Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills, has announced additional dates for the TEETH TOUR, now performing DJ sets in Gisborne and Christchurch, with an additional All Night Long date added in Wellington due to high demand. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’, which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.

Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying All Night Long sets in Auckland and Wellington until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, 13 September, will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, for a sold-out show on 20 September. She’ll return for a second San Fran show on Friday, 26 September, before continuing the TEETH TOUR at Gisborne’s Smash Palace on Friday, 7 November, and Christchurch’s Hide Club on Saturday, 8 November.

MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East already this year, there is no slowing her down.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Danica Bryant, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Danica Bryant
Danica Bryant is a force to be reckoned with. A pop-folk singer-songwriter with a gritty rock-edge, her music tackles provocative themes from celebrity culture to neurodiversity through an unabashedly queer feminist lens.

Her “playful indie pop” (Rolling Stone) has seen her open for legends like Elton John and Robbie Williams, hit #2 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart with her 2024 release ‘Acid’, and undergo mentorship with Kiwi icon Bic Runga. Bryant has undergone multiple successful New Zealand tours and played festivals including Gardens Magic, Outfield and Cuba Dupa.

With her debut album 'Feast' out this August, Bryant is “venomous yet passionate” (Ambient Light), “cynical but emotional” (NZ Musician), and an unapologetically fresh voice on the pop music scene.


About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors at 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission. As a season pass holder you will be reserved seats near the front of the audience.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

With thanks to support from Creative NZ's Creative Communities Fund administered by Kāpiti Coast District Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Rameka Tamaki, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | Rameka Tamaki
People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.


About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. description:
Nick Baucke-Maunsell Quintet, Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet — reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York.
The two first played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Programme under the mentorship of the legendary Rodger Fox and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher.
The set will also feature compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.
Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt performance live.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Niels and the Cartertones an evening of Leonard Cohen, Join us for the special opening night concert of Greytown Art Town weekend. An evening of Leonard Cohen is a collaboration between four extraordinary, Wairarapa-based musicians. They will cover many of Leonard Cohen’s best loved pieces. This performance is an alliance between:
Niels Gedge, fingerstyle guitar and lead vocals, a well-known singer-songwriter on the folk scene, with two albums of original songs. He has also performed extensively in cafes and bars and at events in the UK and throughout NZ. Niels' vocal range is very similar to Leonard Cohen.
Kate Marshall, multi-instrumentalist and vocals. As well as singing in a duo with her partner Bob Cooper-Grundy at clubs, pubs and festivals, Kate is a key member of the much-loved Raven Mavens, the all-woman Boogie/Blues band that plays regularly around the Wellington Region, and beyond.
Bob Cooper-Grundy is an Americana/blues musician who plays finger-picking guitar, mandolin, and slide guitar. Bob has opened for Americana Greats: Guy Clark, Townes van Zandt, Tom Russell, and Jimmy LaFave.
Steve Trotman, vocals and acoustic guitar. Inspired by the bands of the 1950s and 1960s and singer/songwriters, such as James Taylor and Paul Simon, Steve fronted various Wellington groups in the 1970s. He co-founded Verandah Band in the early 2000s, playing a mix of genres in every Wairarapa venue (and beyond) for the past 20-odd years, including Toast Martinborough and Summer Hummer.
The Offering is fully licenced and will be serving snacks and drinks from 6.30pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, Original Sin (UK) | Wellington
FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON


The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.


With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.


This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:


🎧 Molly (AKL) & Gusty
🎧 Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
🎧 Storm & Scholten
🎧 Freeman x Chano
🎧 Dkav
🎧 Stems


––––––––––––––––––


Welly… brace yourself. 👀

description:
Nui Hui 7, Nui Hui 7
NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. No industry machines, no corporate gloss – just raw, rising talent backed by the passion of locals and volunteers who believe in the power of music.

This year’s lineup is stacked with unsigned and upcoming artists from across the region and beyond:

4PM – Munkiez

With a sound as cheeky and chaotic as their name suggests, MUNKIEZ is a bluesy, funk-rock explosion that proves good times and great grooves go hand-in-hand. Hailing from Upper Hutt, this crew is all about embracing the raw energy of rock and roll while slathering on a thick coat of soulful, slinky funk.
They're not here to reinvent the wheel, but to make it spin faster, dirtier, and with a whole lot more swagger. With a dash of that no-nonsense, straight-outta-the-garage Kiwi attitude. MUNKIEZ are a band you feel in your bones, a sound that gets your head nodding and your feet moving before you even realize what's happening. They play it like they mean it, because they do.

5PM – The Groundsmen

Scott Paddock and Shane Martin formed The Groundsmen back in the heady days of 2017 and went through various drummers and bass players before finally finding stability with drummer Rowan Carlyle in 2018.

Since then they’ve played numerous gigs (one supporting Head Like A Hole in Gisborne at Smash Palace 30th anniversary) and released 3 singles on Spotify and other streaming platforms - Black Car, Supanova and Achtung Baby (check them out!).

They’ve recorded their debut album and are just about to mix it and release it.

Playing only original earthen rock punk, we always, always, perform at 110% energy levels and put on a great show with hooky uptempo toons!! With songs commenting on contemporary society and life at large all 3 members throw themselves fully into their performance and leave no energy unused. You will leave one of their shows changed.

See the excerpt from a review of a in Whanganui July 2020:

“After a quick change of equipment, The Groundsmen were next on the agenda. Proclaiming themselves to be Taranaki’s premier rock punk band, the trio wasted no time in belting out a hard and fast set of original, classic punk-inspired tunes that were lapped up by the growing gathering of punters. Bass player Scott Paddock is a tour-de-force; full of noise, energy and an appropriate rock-punk swagger. Along with guitarist Shane Martin and drummer Rowan Carlyle, The Groundsmen powered their way though and energetic set, and it was immediately evident that they were ecstatic to be back on stage and performing again after the recent enforced hiatus. The trio powered through a set of classic, no-frills, original punk inspired tracks that had almost everyone in the room either on their feet or gyrating in their seats. Definitely a crowd-pleaser, there is no doubt whatsoever that The Groundsmen were in their element, and clearly love what they do.”

….from Ambient Light, author Bridget Herlihy, 4th July 2020

6PM – Kaletta Band

Kaletta is a Latin rock band that brings together the rhythms of ska punk and gypsy sounds in Spanish. With musicians from Chile, Colombia, Argentina, Italy, the UK, and New Zealand, our sound is a blend of different beats and roots. We've had the privilege of being two-time national finalists in the Battle of the Bands (BOTB 2024 and 2025) and have performed at festivals like Island Bay and toured the top South Island. We're excited about our upcoming tours in New Zealand next year.

What we're passionate about is creating music that's true to ourselves. Each song is a journey, moving from calm to energetic moments that we hope will keep you engaged. Our lyrics touch on social and political themes, and we hope our performances will inspire thought and conversation. We're looking forward to sharing our music with you and creating memorable experiences through our dynamic sound and energy.

7PM – Burning Embers

Accustomed to breaching anything that requires sociable etiquette they still manage to pull off their unique brand of Wainuiomata rock.

From out of nowhere, they regroup, drink a few, set a plan, and do the complete opposite in tasteful fashion. Burning Embers have an uncanny habit of pulling off a great set, usually unscripted but full of the essence that is Rock n Roll. We're not here long enough to care, but we do love a great audience
Reminiscent of Days of the New and Alice in Chains they're definitely genuine entertainment

8PM – Stretch to Mould

Stretch to Mould is a rock band from Wellington New Zealand who formed in 2012. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Darrell Vickers, who has been the only constant member throughout multiple line up changes. Since 2024 the line up has consisted of Vickers alongside Chris Fursdon (bass guitar) and Thomas Fuller (Drums). Stretch to Mould are known for their high energy, hard hitting riffs, powerful vocals and all-round solid musicianship. The band released their debut album Shadows in 2012, EP Painting Faces in 2014 and are currently working on their next release.

9PM – Ras Judah and the Culture Embassy

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

10PM – The Fabulous Pakehas

Were first conceived in London England, way back in the early 90s whilst on O.E's. Currently working on a album, & after 33 years, still in no rush.
With two of us having roots in WOA TFP are honoured to be playing a set of our originals for NUI HUI 7
The T.F.P original line up are, Antony Maddock, Scott McGill, Leslie Tearne, &
Bevan Ritchie.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From soul-stirring grooves to fist-in-the-air anthems, Nui Hui 7 is more than just a gig – it’s a celebration of musicians who hustle, create, and share their art on their own terms.

Nui Hui: supporting local, celebrating original, and keeping the fire of live music burning

description:
Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine, Mostly Music Soundscape Series | The Weather Machine
The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.



About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors at 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission. As a season pass holder you will be reserved seats near the front of the audience.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

With thanks to support from Creative NZ's Creative Communities Fund administered by Kāpiti Coast District Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Romi Wrights And Leao, This October, two of Aotearoa’s brightest talents come together for a one-night-only double headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
On Saturday, October 18th, 60s soul, funk, and R&B revivalists Romi Wrights & the Commotions join forces with fellow "niu-wave" sonic explorers LEAO for their debut headline performances in the capital.

Don’t miss this celebration of era-blending, electrifying Pacific journeys through sound.


LEAO

Formed from a Pacific heart, LEAO is a Samoan musical project led by guitarist/vocalist David Feauai-Afaese, joined by bassist Navakatoa Tekela-Pule, Hawaiian-steel guitarist Levi Gemmell, and drummer Larsen Tito-Taylor. With a deep adoration for Pacific musical reference points and a desire to explore new sonic ground, LEAO synthesises non-traditional tonalities with a fa‘asamoa spirit, creating what some have called “niu wave” and “Pacific neo-psychedelia.” A creative enigma and phenomenal live act since the release of their critically acclaimed debut GHOST ROADS in 2019, LEAO has continued to expand its vision with the 2024 single TAEAO / MEA UMA - a sparkling glimpse into a significant body of alternative Pacific music currently in development. The group is now actively working towards the release of a new full-length album, deepening their bold contribution to contemporary Pacific sound.



Romi Wrights

Although she grew up on the sensibilities of US RnB and Hip-hop, when the Tokelauan singer-songwriter Romi Wrights shares her voice, it’s hard not to feel transported back to the spirit of the late 1960s soul/funk era by her incandescent melodies and stirring stories of love, loss and the confusion that lies in between. Raised between Porirua and the Hutt Valley, Romi started writing diaristic poetry at age eight before beginning to set her words to music during her teenage years.



After finishing high school, she moved to Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland) to study music at the EXCEL School of Performing Arts and pursue her dreams of being a singer. Several years later she formed the gospel, funk and soul band The Elected, who spent three years performing at venues like Portland Public House, Kings Arms and Golden Dawn.


Since 2021, she has been working alongside Mānuka Recordings co-founder Kenny Sterling and a cast of session musicians and backing vocalists, including Julien Dyne, Cory Champion, Olivia Wilding, JY Lee. In December 2023, Wrights opened for soul legend Lee Fields, at the Hollywood Avondale, and has since performed twice at Pōneke festival CubaDupa. Via Mānuka Recordings, she has released 3 singles; Bring It Back, Without You and Capsized and has an album scheduled for release mid to late 2025.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah, Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah
Join us for a magical evening of music at Firebird Café, Levin.

Three amazing Wellington acts are coming through to present their beautiful sounds and share their heart and soul with you. We warmly invite you to join us and become a part of this collaboration of creativity and connection; spanning triumph and heartbreak, and everything in between, celebrating all it means to be human.

Our wonderful hosts at Firebird Café will be serving their delicious food and creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Tickets are $15 online or $20 on the door.

Mercy Lie:

Driving all night under the stars, along the highways of human experience, the original songs of Mercy Lie will haunt, surprise, remind and affirm.

Mercy Lie is the musical guise of Laura Chester-Murphy. An instinctive sound maker from an early age, Laura just wants to keep the music rolling. There’s a lot of sound from that little acoustic guitar and a voice to match. In the songs, you will find fierce independence, crushing vulnerability and a reflective wit that speaks to a life of figuring stuff out along the way.

With influences ranging across and not limited to folk, funk, country, goth, indie and 90’s rave, Laura puts the focus on crafting percussive earworms that won’t leave your head easily. The music of Mercy Lie is a unique soundscape, sculpted with ambience and depth, the silence unforgettably painted by explorations into the motivations of both the self and fellow travellers.

Mercy Lie is about connecting over the foibles of polite society and the ways we are wired to weave around each other.

Hometowns, journeys, mysteries, ghosts, growing up, messing up, speaking out, moving on. If you like getting nostalgic over something and nothing all at once, buckle up.

“Mercy Lie’s novel approach to the guitar and talent for songwriting make for the perfect storm.”
“I did not expect that voice to come from that mouth.”
“An acoustic delight!”

Araiyah & Izzy:

Born in the coastal town of Patea and raised in the vibrant community of Gisborne, Araiyah’s musical journey is as rich and diverse as her heritage. Now based in Wellington, she is not just a musician but a devoted mother of four tamariki and a proud grandmother to one mokopuna. For the past decade, Araiyah has poured her heart into writing, recording, and performing her original compositions, each note resonating with the depth of her experiences.

Araiyah’s music is a poignant reflection of her life’s journey, weaving together themes of love, loss, and resilience. Her deeply moving compositions are rooted in the lessons learned through relationships and the pain that often accompanies them. Through her art, she shares a narrative of healing, transformation, and the strength that comes from embracing vulnerability.

Influenced by a diverse array of artists such as Bic Runga, Tracy Chapman, and The Eagles, Araiyah’s sound is a fusion of heartfelt storytelling and melodic richness. However, it is her whanau and friends who serve as her greatest inspiration, fuelling her passion and creativity. Their support and love provide the foundation upon which her music thrives, making each performance an authentic expression of her gratitude and connection to those who matter most.

With a voice that captivates and lyrics that resonate, Araiyah invites listeners into her world—a place where pain transforms into beauty, and healing becomes a shared experience. As she continues to evolve as an artist, Araiyah’s music promises to touch the hearts of many, leaving a lasting impact on all who have the privilege of listening.

Araiyah will be accompanied by guitarist Izzy and Laura Chester-Murphy on percussion.

Rain and the Urban Bohemians:

Formed around the music of singer-songwriter Cathy Elizabeth aka Rain, supported by her band of Urban Bohemians, this group has been able to weave together many different influences and styles to create something quite unique and beautiful.

Peppered with contemplations of our existence and the fleetingness of time, Rain & the UBs bring the magic with a folk-rock edge and an alluring authenticity at its centre. Spiritual undertones and overtones give way to an uplifting joyfulness, of triumph over difficulties and life lessons learned and expressed through music.

With Cathy Elizabeth on vocals & acoustic guitar, Chris Ewers on bass, Murray James on drums and Izzy and Dion on guitars, these guys have got the goods and are ready to deliver!

So come along and allow yourself to be immersed and transported, moved and entertained. It’s going to be a very special night all round!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Petone Depot - Lower Hutt, NZ (Less than 20 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Petone Depot - Lower Hutt, NZ (Less than 20 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 20 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/4hl4XOt

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.

description:
Songwriters' Saturday, These Wellington singer-songwriters have put together an evening of original music for your enjoyment.

Opening the evening is Rachel Hird on piano, with vocalist Brenda Shearer. Next up is local producer, musician and songwriter Phil Riley, followed by a good 50 mins of toe-tapping grooving with The Grey Dog Band.

More about the artists:

Rachel Hird is a Wellington based singer-songwriter. She grew up playing the piano and studying classical music. Nowadays she writes and performs her own songs, best described as ‘songs from the heart'. She is constantly inspired by people she meets in the world of music such as musician, vocalist, songwriter and mentor Brenda Shearer, and sing-songwriter Charlotte Yates whose songwriting school is a place where many songs have been crafted. Rachel's songs are inspired by people, places and events of the past and present. She is planning an EP release early 2026.

Phil Riley is a full-time writer /producer with a recording studio in Korokoro. He's a wordsmith and melodic songwriter with influences from the Beatles and Paul Simon to Coldplay. Phil started on the English Club circuit as a guitarist, then drummer and keyboard player/singer in NZ bands.
Riley got to know Grammy winner Jon Mark of White Cloud Records (Naxos), and this led to a series of 6 Celtic and World music albums for the label, including The Blessing Tree, which reached #11 on the US radio play charts and was nominated for 5 NZ Tui music awards.

Riley has tracks on European and US albums alongside artists such as Enya, Sarah McLachlan, Sinead O’Connor, Secret Garden and Clannad. The compilation ‘Celtic Journey’ reached #1 on the American Billboard charts.

Over the past few years, the art and craft of songwriting has become a priority, driving his recording and performing focus and moving his musical centre of gravity. His first ’new’ indie album ‘Five Dollar Rockets’ featured a stellar cast of instrumentalists and singers.
In this unplugged ‘sneak preview’ of songs from the first and upcoming second album he’ll be joined by long-time talented music buddies Charlie Harter and Marty Parlane on guitars and the wonderful Brenda Shearer on vocals.

The Grey Dog are a deluded bunch of cork-sniffers who think they will improve with age. They are John Broadbent – vocals, guitar and harp, Martyn Parlane – vocals and guitar, Graeme “Grey Dog” Sullivan – bass and vocals and Greg Bates - drums. They often play around Courtenay Place, where they use their music to lure passing sailors to their doom. Their musical style is wide-ranging, but basically Boomer. They hope their music will provide some fuel for your hearts, heads, and toes.

The Realm is a family friendly venue with a great vibe, good food, including children's menu and a good range of refreshing beverages available at the bar. You can book a table online at https://therealm.co.nz/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Renaissance Gold - in celebration with Manawatū Sinfonia featuring Bach's Magnificat, Renaissance Gold - in celebration with Manawatū Sinfonia featuring Bach's Magnificat
On Saturday 13 September, at 7.00 pm in the Cathedral of the Holy Spirit on Broadway, PN, the choir under Christine Archer-Lockwood is to be joined by the Manawatu Sinfonia and soloists, Caroline Hickman, Jennifer Little and Lindsay Yeo with choristers Nigel Tongs and Bronté Hodgetts also singing solo in Bach's Magnificat. The Magnificat is a world favourite, arguably Bach's best choral piece that has transcended the ages, celebrating Luke's description of Mary's pregnancy.

In addition, the choir and orchestra perform Ritchie's Then I Understood. When a child of seven to nine, Laura Rangers sketched eight poems centred on summers at Otaki Beach, Ritchie seized the opportunity to add the musical dimension and the result are dual choirs - the Renaissance Singers split - accompanied by the Sinfonia to set off Rangers' delightful insights, so elegantly displayed. The magic that can be childhood.

The concert has a celebratory theme, it being the 50th anniversary of the choir. Thus the inclusion of Forrest's Three Nocturnes that express the wonderment involved when examining the heavens and the universe full of stars. Throughout this piece the percussionists alone from the Sinfonia provide whimsical accompaniment with a celeste providing the heavenly tones - a hit when played on the last occasion the choir sang the piece.

Opening the concert will be Carl Orff's O Fortuna from his popular Carmina Burana. While O Fortuna laments the role of fate it is set in the larger piece that celebrates life with gusto.

With the performers in great form (two choristers just back from singing with the world's best choir) this concert will no doubt build the sense of celebration - full of life and wonderment.

General Admission $25, Concession $20, Secondary School $15,
Under 13 Free.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Ghost Trio, Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Three: Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Ghost Trio
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Ghost Trio
Shostakovich: 4th String Quartet, Five Pieces for Two Violins and Piano, 2nd Piano Trio
Unpacked: The music of Robert Burch
Spotlight: Feel the past merge with the present, as beloved former NZSQ member Monique Lapins joins current violinist Peter Clark in Shostakovich’s delightful work for two violins and piano. Ghost Trio conclude the evening with their celebrated virtuosity and emotional intensity in the second piano trio.
Tickets: $15 - $55, or get a season pass to all four concerts for $180pp
Season pass discount will be automatically applied at checkout when you have one 'Season Pass' ticket per concert date in your cart.
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Ghost Trio, Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Three: Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Ghost Trio
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Ghost Trio
Shostakovich: 4th String Quartet, Five Pieces for Two Violins and Piano, 2nd Piano Trio
Unpacked: The music of Robert Burch
Spotlight: Feel the past merge with the present, as beloved former NZSQ member Monique Lapins joins current violinist Peter Clark in Shostakovich’s delightful work for two violins and piano. Ghost Trio conclude the evening with their celebrated virtuosity and emotional intensity in the second piano trio.
Tickets: $15 - $55, or get a season pass to all four concerts for $180pp
Season pass discount will be automatically applied at checkout when you have one 'Season Pass' ticket per concert date in your cart.
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Vogelmorn Upstairs - Wellington, NZ (Less than 80 tickets left!), LESS THAN 80 TICKETS REMAINING!
More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/43KgdRg
With special guest: Nick Herbison
Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"
Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.
Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”

description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, ‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.
‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.
‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.

SET TIMES:
7pm - Doors Open
7:30pm - Half/Angel
8:30pm - IVY
9:50pm - The Beatniks

description:
The Dave Wilson Quintet, Dave Wilson presents his quintet in a special performance of newly arranged material from his two most recent projects: Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation (debuted in 2025), and Ephemeral (Thelonious Records, 2023).  

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like. Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, explores the transience of human relationships with one another and the natural world through alternatively floating and driving improvisatory impulses of Wilson and his ensemble.

The quintet for this performance will present the music of Free, Free and Ephemeral in a brand-new configuration: Wilson on saxophone and bass clarinet, Mana Waiariki on violin, Seth Boy on bass, Callum Allardice on guitar, and Abe Baillie on drums.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Romi Wrights And Leao, This October, two of Aotearoa’s brightest talents come together for a one-night-only double headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
On Saturday, October 18th, 60s soul, funk, and R&B revivalists Romi Wrights & the Commotions join forces with fellow "niu-wave" sonic explorers LEAO for their debut headline performances in the capital.

Don’t miss this celebration of era-blending, electrifying Pacific journeys through sound.


LEAO

Formed from a Pacific heart, LEAO is a Samoan musical project led by guitarist/vocalist David Feauai-Afaese, joined by bassist Navakatoa Tekela-Pule, Hawaiian-steel guitarist Levi Gemmell, and drummer Larsen Tito-Taylor. With a deep adoration for Pacific musical reference points and a desire to explore new sonic ground, LEAO synthesises non-traditional tonalities with a fa‘asamoa spirit, creating what some have called “niu wave” and “Pacific neo-psychedelia.” A creative enigma and phenomenal live act since the release of their critically acclaimed debut GHOST ROADS in 2019, LEAO has continued to expand its vision with the 2024 single TAEAO / MEA UMA - a sparkling glimpse into a significant body of alternative Pacific music currently in development. The group is now actively working towards the release of a new full-length album, deepening their bold contribution to contemporary Pacific sound.



Romi Wrights

Although she grew up on the sensibilities of US RnB and Hip-hop, when the Tokelauan singer-songwriter Romi Wrights shares her voice, it’s hard not to feel transported back to the spirit of the late 1960s soul/funk era by her incandescent melodies and stirring stories of love, loss and the confusion that lies in between. Raised between Porirua and the Hutt Valley, Romi started writing diaristic poetry at age eight before beginning to set her words to music during her teenage years.



After finishing high school, she moved to Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland) to study music at the EXCEL School of Performing Arts and pursue her dreams of being a singer. Several years later she formed the gospel, funk and soul band The Elected, who spent three years performing at venues like Portland Public House, Kings Arms and Golden Dawn.


Since 2021, she has been working alongside Mānuka Recordings co-founder Kenny Sterling and a cast of session musicians and backing vocalists, including Julien Dyne, Cory Champion, Olivia Wilding, JY Lee. In December 2023, Wrights opened for soul legend Lee Fields, at the Hollywood Avondale, and has since performed twice at Pōneke festival CubaDupa. Via Mānuka Recordings, she has released 3 singles; Bring It Back, Without You and Capsized and has an album scheduled for release mid to late 2025.

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!
The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
Book now through the link above

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!
Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!
A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.
All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.
Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”

www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.

description:
5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model, 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size 750mm tall figure. From there the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop contributing to major films and exhibitions and has worked across materials scales and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.
Armature is supplied during the workshop.
You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.
Tea

we are here for you, for ourselves and for it all. Come all Jah one - individual in our togetherness, together in our uniqueness. Our personal messages and mauri and our collective vibrations and spontaneous moments of authentic expression. From vulnerability to mana, from stillness to ecstasy, the troughs and the crests, the eggs and the fluids. the dub and the deep, the groove pocket and the light tasty treats. well prepped to be enjoyed by all but also unprepped to be raw and pure. digested in reciprocity, fed by those sentients present souls, a gift. Its a Sunday funday, a gathering to reset the weekly cycle, go for a run, a swim, a sleep, take a breathe and connect with te taiao - do some mahi, something good.... for you or someone else and then you have the option of enriching this collective experience by gracing us with your essence, as we sink into the hum of the universe together within the stories of MOON 1. every day is but a little life. See you there, here and now. Hanno, Simon and Nikau x

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN, Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // LEVIN
Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.

Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.

Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.

with support from ABBEY EVE

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

description:
Tyaan Singh presents the Music of Studio Ghibli, Join us for a beautiful evening celebrating the magical worlds of Studio Ghibli, brought to life by a vibrant 12-piece ensemble blending both jazz and classical orchestral instrumentation.
We’ll journey through the music of eight classic Ghibli films, performing inventive arrangements of their iconic main themes intertwined with other musical moments from throughout each soundtrack.
The soundtracks have been reimagined in a jazz context while staying true to the original cinematic sound, so the music will have something new for seasoned Ghibli fans and newcomers alike.
Featuring:
Tyaan Singh - Arranger, Alto Saxophone, Clarinet
Will Hanlon - Tenor Saxophone, Flute
Eilish Wilson - Baritone Saxophone
Jack Harré - Trumpet
David Codd - French Horn
Julian Kirgan Báez - Trombone
Mana Waiariki - Violin
Hayden Nickel - Violin
Joanna Dann - Cello
Hector McLachlan - Piano
Seth Boy - Bass
Shaun Anderson - Drums

Brio Magazine NZ is turning 2, and we want to celebrate YOU, the amazing teen girl who has been journeying with us! Step into a world of creativity and connection at our upcoming events across Aotearoa.

description:
Vorn and his Prog Consort, Vorn and his Prog Consort
Wellington legend Vorn Colgan has been writing and releasing extraordinary and odd popular music from bedrooms across Aotearoa and the world since 1999, a career which was scheduled to be cut short in 2019 by a terminal cancer diagnosis. 2023 saw him release his surprisingly non-posthumous hit The Late Album, and given his demonstrated inability to die he was left with maybe the world's most wonderful problem: what to record for his 10th album?

The answer is The Aeronaut, a 60ish minute meditation on Wellington, the universe, and everything, hewn from purest regionally-sourced prog rock and presented in a single baffling and hopefully pleasant serving. The Aeronaut is currently still a work in progress; this evening offers keen punters a chance to watch Vorn and his frighteningly good band (Nick Brown - Drums; Charley Davenport - Bass, Thomas Liggett - Violin) iron out the final kinks on a future Kiwi classic. Be there so you can say you were!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston, Acting Voice - Tessa Livingston
In 2025, thanks to our generous funder Mercury, the course is FREE to Manawatu students aged 14 to 18.

The In-House Vocal Coach and Bookings Agent at BigMouth Voices, excels in Demo Reel Production, Audition Management, and provides comprehensive Accent and Voice Coaching for the agency's talents. Tessa is the newest tutor addition to 'The Voice Academy', and prior to this she has developed online courses focused on Vocal Stamina, Projection and Health. With a rich professional background spanning roles as a speech pathologist, vocal coach, voice-over artist, actress, podcaster, and content creator, Tessa brings a wealth of expertise to her multifaceted career. She is the creator of ‘The Good Talkers Podcast’, an entertaining and educational podcast dedicated to the lives of voice over artists. Her commitment to excellence underscores her reputation as a dynamic professional in the realm of voice and performance arts.

Learn how to use your voice to its full potential and spend the afternoon in the recording studio recording a piece for a show reel. Fun character voices, accents and using your voice to its fullest with confidence!

description:
Ziggy Alberts tickets, Presented by: Commonfolk
ARIA-accredited and APRA Award-winning artist Ziggy Alberts will return to New Zealand this November as part of his New Love World Tour, following three years of extensive touring across Europe, the UK, North and South America, Asia, and regional Australia. Celebrating the release of his seventh studio album, New Love, Ziggy will return to New Zealand for the first time since 2023, with three special shows in Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
From his early days busking the streets of Byron Bay to selling out venues like London’s Royal Albert Hall, Ziggy’s journey has been defined by grassroots touring, heartfelt songwriting, and an unwavering independent spirit.
The New Zealand leg of the tour kicks off on Thursday 13 November at Christchurch Town Hall, followed by Meow Nui in Wellington on Friday 14 November, and concludes at Auckland’s Powerstation on Saturday 15 November. This tour will showcase Ziggy’s signature solo style - spirited, raw, and deeply authentic - the kind of direct connection that has earned him over one billion streams, multiple awards, and a loyal global fanbase.
Fans can look forward to favourites like ‘Days in the Sun’ and ‘Runaway’, which recently surpassed 100 million streams, alongside new tracks from New Love - an album crafted for live performance. Featuring hit singles 'New Love’, 'Where Does the Love Go?' and latest single, ‘I’m With You’ the record marks a return to simplicity and authenticity, blending folk, rock, and country influences to create a cohesive yet dynamic listening experience.
Alberts’ year of New Love is not one to miss. This leg of the world tour will celebrate connection, authenticity, and music’s ability to bring people together. Don’t miss the chance to see Ziggy Alberts live on the New Love World Tour 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Social Animal, Created by Stephen Papps and Damon Andrews. Performed by Stephen Papps.

You can’t teach an old dog new tricks... can you? Biting satire and theatre wizardry fuse in a comically inventive roller-coaster about the fear of irrelevance and the healing power of an animal. Award-winning actor, writer, and solo performer, Stephen Papps, plays twelve characters with beguiling virtuosity, in this gloriously funny solo tour de force about a man who loses face in a desperate attempt to regain his relevance.

“It’s impressive for a performer to embody a big range of characters ... well-written and full of humorous insights and revelations ... glorious!” – Cate Prestige, Theatreview.

Audience care: Recommended for audiences aged 13+

description:
Torch Fired Enamels - 4 Weeks course, This is a 4 week's block focusing on beautiful glass enamels on copper and silver using the Torch Fired Glass Enamel technique. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work! The course starts on Sun 4 October and runs for 4 weeks until 25 October, 10am-1pm.

Beginners to jewellery work can use pre-formed shapes to apply their enamels to so they can focus on creating an excellent result. They will be shown how to apply textures and small alterations to the pieces using either hammers or roll printed textures before prepping the metal for the glass enamel.

Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced piece, exploring more complex techniques such as cloisonne.

High quality silver findings are supplied for one to two projects and more are available to purchase if required.

Sterling silver chains are also available if you want to complete the finish of a pendant.

Build your foundational jewellery making skill with this deep dive into enamel technique!

Beginners and advanced students are welcome.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre, Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre
An Evening of Live Mediumship and Healing with Aussie Medium, Simon Hay

Simon is a psychic medium, medical intuitive and healer. He travels throughout Australia and New Zealand doing private sessions and events. His down-to-earth style of mediumship is accurate, surprising, and entertaining.
At these events, Simon shares messages and accurate information from spirit, but he's passionate about educating about energy healing and mediumship so he also answers audience questions about his career. If you’re curious about communicating to spirit and energy healing, you’ll love this event.
Enjoy…
• A demonstration of psychic mediumship readings in the Elwood Room
• Q and A — ask questions about spirit and energy healing
Arrive to be seated by 7:15 pm.
$55/ticket
Re ticket purchasers, we have a no refund policy. Be certain about attending before purchasing.
Not all attendees will receive readings (attendance doesn’t guarantee you’ll get a reading)
This is an adults only (16 years +) event. Parents, be aware that I often talk about topics suitable only for adults.
To be polite and respectful, turn off your phone during the event, and do not video or record any part of the event.
Prior to attending this event, visit Simon Hay's website, read all the information there and the disclaimer in its entirety. Thank you.

This year’s theme is Rise and Build, and we believe God has something powerful in store for each and every one of us. Whether you’ve been part of our church family for years, or you’re joining us for the very first time, you are warmly invited.

Come expecting encouragement, connection, and an atmosphere filled with God’s love. Bring your family, bring your friends, and let’s grow together in Christ.

We can’t wait to see you there!

#ChurchConference #FaithFamily #AllAreWelcome
